loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 42-year-old married man and lives in A. Ouzai in the Beirut suburbs. He is a car mechanic, and he opened his shop in 1991. To further improve his services, Hussein is asking for $1,000 to buy new tools and machinery.

loans.use: Buy new tools and machinery

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.en:
Prudencia M. is a 66-year-old member of ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) in the northern part of the province, Culasi, Antique where the highest peak of Panay Island is located. Prudencia is raising pigs to support the needs of her two children. She is a widow and the sole provider.

She applied for this loan to use as a down payment on a motorcycle she wants to buy from a motorcycle shop. She wants to build a tricycle for hire (tricycle is a motorcycle with a sidecar). She will try her best to manage this business to assist in her children's education. She is grateful for the trust of the lenders, who are making this loan possible. She hopes that her membership in ASHI will help her achieve her greatest dreams in life.

loans.use: Finance the down payment of a motorcycle

loans.name: Elena Margarita

texts.es:
Su actividad D. la Sra. Elena es la venta D. desayunos, almuerzos  D. lunes a sábado su actividad diaria empieza a las 6:00 D. la mañana que va hacer compras del mercado espacialmente la carne que tiene que ser fresca así como la verdura, para tener satisfechos a sus clientes; atienD. a empresas que se encuentran ubicados en la zona ya que es céntrica y donD. hay varias empresas. El esposo tiene un ingreso fijo mensual el cual le ayuda con los gastos familiares, ya que cuentan con 5 hijos tres D. los cuales ya se encuentran en la universidad pero al mismo tiempo le ayudan a la mama en el snack atendiendo a sus clientes, uno esta en edad escolar y el último tiene 1 año.
Es una familia muy unida todos trabajan aportando en la familia.
texts.en:
Elena sells breakfasts and lunches Monday-Saturday. Her day starts at 6 a.m. when she goes to the market to make her purchases, particularly the meat that needs to be as fresh as the vegetables to satisfy her customers. She serves to businesses located in her area, which is central and populated with various companies. Her husband earns a fixed monthly income to help her with family expenses. They have five children, three of whom are attending the local university but also help her mother with her stand, tending to customers. Another child is in school, and the youngest is 1 year old. This is a very tightly knit family where everyone supports everyone else.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a chicken fryer and a hot food stand

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Since 2007, Francisca D. has worked as a trader selling goods such as flour, rice, sugar, margarine and oil at Yamoransa. She is single with no children and has received no formal education. She is responsible for supporting herself financially, paying for such things as food and clothing. Her loan will be used to purchase additional food supplies for resale and she hopes to use her newly gained profits to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional food supplies for resale

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Mrs. Aurelia M., 69 years old, is married and lives at Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She has one child who is married already. She spend her life with her husband. She is a member of PAGLAUM since last February 2006 and now she is applying for a loan of 5,000.00 pesos to buy additional stock, such as laundry items, seasonings, goodies, toiletries and other household items for her sari-sari (convenience) store.

Mrs. M. is able to manage this business successfully; in fact, it covers her daily consumption needs and she is able to save money for the future.

loans.use: Additional capital for sari-sari store.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Semillas del Futuro”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Puno, Provincia D.  Puno, Departamento D. Puno, tiene 45 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. 3 hijos, posee estudios D. primaria completa y vive en el Barrio San Martín.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 5 años, con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para su negocio D. compra y venta D. frutas. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio y así poder comprar frutas como: plátanos, naranjas, mandarina, manzanas y otras.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando y darles una educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y las charlas que se dan en su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Sra. Hilda belongs to the Semillas del Futuro ["Seeds of the Future"] community bank in the Peruvian "departmento" of Puno. She is 45 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She finished elementary school and lives in the San Martin neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 5 years, starting with a S/.300 [300 new soles] loan for her business buying and selling fruit. She is now applying for a S/.500 loan to invest in the same business so that she can buy fruits such as platanos, oranges, tangerines, apples, etc. Hilda's greatest hopes are to go on working and to give her children good educations. She likes the community bank meetings and discussing bank matters with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Ogechi

texts.en: Ogechi O. is 40 years old, married and has 3 children. She sells clothes. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to  sell.

loans.name: Dzifa

texts.en:
Dzifa A. is married and has one child. Her husband is a fisherman. Dzifa has received primary-level schooling and, since 2003, has been making a living selling processed fish at Denu. She uses her income to pay bills. 
At present, Dzifa needs a loan to be able to buy more fish for resale. She plans to use the additional profits to re-invest in her sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of fish for resale

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es:
Herminio tiene un pequeño taller de servicio de frenos y cambio de balatas de movilidades y por las noches trabaja como transportista, es su principal fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de tres hijos y esposa; tiene su casa propia ubicada en la Zona Ventilla de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinará para la compra de maquinaria (calibradores de frenos) y repuestos para el taller y de esa forma podrá facilitar su trabajo y ofrecer mejor servicio a sus clientes.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Herminio has a small shop that services brakes and changes brake linings. In the evenings he works as a driver. It is the main source of income to support his three children and his wife. He has his own house, which is located in the Ventilla zone in the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy machinery (brake calibrators) and replacement parts for his shop. This will facilitate his work, and he will give his customers better service. This is his first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy brake calibrators and replacement parts for his brake and brake lining repair shop

loans.name: Rossana

texts.es:
La Sra. Rossana Báez  de  32 años de edad, esta casada con el sr  Cristhian Palacios hace  4 años tienen un hijo de 1 año y 4 meses.
Cuenta  que antes de tener su negocio, ella trabajaba  con su padre quien tenia una escuela de conducción, se desempeñaba allí como secretaria e instructora de la escuela, Más adelante recibió una propuesta de trabajo al exterior y decidió viajar con su esposo en busca de mejoras económicas. 
Mas adelante  decidieron volver a nuestro país y en vista de tener un hijo chico optaron por abrir  una Despensa con venta de comestibles, al cual le anexaron una cancha de fútbol 5 (soccer 5), y también juegos electrónicos, que es atendido por su esposo. 
Piensa que con la ayuda del crédito seguirá creciendo, porque le permitirá acceder a mejores precios en la compra de sus mercaderías que le ayudará a tener mejores precios también.
texts.en:
Sra. Rossana Báez is 32 years old and has been married to Sr. Cristhian Palacios for 4 years. They have a young son who is 16 months old.

Prior to having her own business, Sra. Rossana worked for her father who operated a driving school. There she worked as a secretary and also as a driving instructor. Later she was given the chance to work abroad and decided to travel with her husband in search of better financial opportunites.

When they returned to their own country, and in light of having a baby boy, Sra. Rossana chose to open a grocery store. She added on a miniature soccer field (fútbol 5) and electronic games, which are managed by her husband.

She believes that her business will continue to grow with the help of her loan. She will be able to buy goods at a lower cost and then charge lower prices to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase consumer goods

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia sells cooked foods and drinks. She is 40 years old and married with 8 children. She has been in business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of N60000 to purchase drinks and foodstuffs to sell.

She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Josa

texts.en:
Josa R. is from the village of San Roque. She is 29 years old. Josa is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Josa owns and operates a hog raising business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Josa has been in business for over one year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Josa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. Josa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Josa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi

texts.fr: O. Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi est née le 08/10/1971 à Sakété dans le Département du Plateau. Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi est mariée à AMBALIOU Razack. Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi et Razack ont trois enfants tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Pk10 dans la Commune de Sèmè-Podji. Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi vend les produits cosmétiques (parfum, crème, lait corporel, déodorant, défrisant, etc.). Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi vend ses produits dans son quartier à Pk10 et s'approvisionne en ces différents produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi a eu deux crédits de ALIDé et elle a bien remboursé ces crédits. Pour augmenter le volume de son activité à la grande satisfaction de sa clientèle Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi O. was born on 8 October 1971 in Sakété in the Department of Plateau. Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi is married to Razack Ambaliou. Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi and Razack have three children, all of whom are in school and still in the care of their parents. The family lives in Pk10 area in the town of Sèmè-Podji. Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi sells cosmetics (perfume, cream, body milk, deodorant, hair straightener, etc.). Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi sells her products in her locality in Pk10 and supplies herself with these goods at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi has already obtained two loans through ALIDE (one of Kiva's field partners) and repaid these loans properly. In order to increase the volume of her business and satisfy her customers, Choukouratou M. Adéyèmi is seeking a third loan through ALIDE.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell cosmetic products

loans.name: El Mar Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Mar está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras una de ellas es Dina Guadalupe P. O. de 37 años quien tiene una modesta venta desde hace seis años y su sueño es mejorar su casa que se encuentra en muy malas condiciones y en un futuro tener una carro. 

Martha Lizbeth A. S. de 28 años comenzó una pequeña verdulería y con forme le dieron los créditos en adim incluyo la venta de carne y hueso. Margelia del Socorro B. N. comenzó con una venta y con las ganancias y los prestamos se dedico a lo que más  puso la costura. Ella puso su propio taller de costura y empezó a vender también productos Avon.
texts.en:
The group Mar is made up of three enterprising women. One of them is Dina Guadalupe P. O. who is 37 years old and has a sales shop since 6 years ago and her dream is to better her home because it is in very bad condition and in the future to own a car.

Martha Lizbeth A. S. is 28 years old and has a small vegetable store and got a loan through ADIM (Kiva’s field partner) and in her sales included the sale of meat and bones. Margelia del Socorro B. N. began her sales and with the profits and loans began sewing. She set up her own sewing shop and sells Avon products as well.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy key grains and products for home consumption.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia B. is from the village of Dimaluna in Ozamiz City. She is 55 years old and married. She has two school-aged children and six adult children. Venancia sells dried fish. She has been engaged in this business for almost a year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In July 2009, Venancia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She had successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more dried fish to sell. This will be Venancia's second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Vilma ha logrado tener su propio negocio y se siente sastifecha por ser una mujer independiente, procreo dos hijos los cuales están cursando los estudios para un porvenir mejor. Su esposo es abogado y han venido haciendo mejoras a su casa, ella vende comida, refresco desde hace varios años, con ayuda de su esposo y préstamos ha logrado crecer en las ventas, la venta de comida se requiere de mucho capital para hacer un menú variado y captar clientes, así como comprar mesas, asientos, utensilios entre otros. Con este préstamo quiere invertir en la compra de granos básicos, lácteos, carnes, pollo, frutas, golosinas, gaseosas entre otros productos para preparar los ricos platillos y seguir fortaleciendo su pequeño comedor para un futuro mejor de la familia todo esto lográndolo por los financiamiento que como muchas familias Nicaragüenses, tenemos la oportunidad de crecer como mujeres responsables, trabajadora de nuestra familia.
texts.en:
Vilma has managed to have her own business and feels satisfied in that she is able to be an independent woman. She has 2 children who are in school in order to have a better future. Her husband is a lawyer and they have been making improvements to their house. She has had a business selling food and drinks for a number of years. With the help of her husband and loans she has managed to make her sales grow. The sale of food requires a lot of capital in order to make a varied menu and gain clients, as well as to buy tables, chairs, utensils, etc. With this loan she wants to invest in the purchase of staple grains, dairy products, meat, chicken, fruit, candies, and soft drinks among other products, to prepare the rich dishes and to continue to strengthen her small eatery for a better future for her family. This financing allows Vilma and many other Nicaraguans to have the opportunity to grow as responsible women working for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy staple grains, dairy products, meat, chicken, fruit and candies to prepare the meals

loans.name: Katey

texts.en:
Katey is one of FATEN’s first clients. She took several loans from FATEN within its group guarantee program, and the last three loans as individual loans. She started with a 150 USD loan and gradually increased her loan size, but the loan was always very small so that it met her ability for repayment and her business size.

Katey is married with three children. She and her husband have owned and managed an olive-wood workshop for twenty years. They buy the olive wood and make crosses, statues, Christ caves and many other Christian religious handcrafts. They sell them to souvenir shops in Bethlehem as well as to wholesalers who export them to the USA and Europe.

 In the Palestinian territories there is no national currency and there are three main currencies used: US dollars, Israeli Shekels and the Jordanian Dinar. Katey has requested a loan of 405 Jordanian Dinars (1 USD=0.71 JOD).

Katey appears in the photo at her workshop. Last August, Katey’s photo taken at her workshop was used for a FATEN billboard media campaign throughout the West Bank. She was very proud that she was selected by FATEN to represent FATEN's clients.

loans.use: To purchase more olive wood

loans.name: Harvin Jose

texts.es: Harvin trabaja desde hace un año como tecnico de La Alcaldia del Municipio el Coral,  el vive con sus ancianos padres el cual ayuda  a su familia con los gastos  basicos del hogar. Con este crèdito pretende comprar materiales de construcciòn para repellar dos paredes ya que no ajusta comprarlo con el salario ya es muy poco, es por esta razon es que esta solicitando este crèdito a la Instituciòn de AFODENIC, su mayor sueño es seguir estudiando, tener un trabajo digno que alcance para sobrevivir y poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Harvin has worked for a year as a technician at City Hall for the City of El Coral. He lives with his elderly parents and helps them with basic household expenses. This loan will be used to buy building materials so that he can apply stucco to two walls. Harvin is not able to purchase these items because he earns very little money. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from AFODENIC.

His greatest dream is to continue his education so that he can have a decent job, earn enough money to survive, and gradually make improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to stucco two walls

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua is fifty five years old. She is a divorcee with six children. She is really dedicated to her work and very supportive to all her children. Through her hard work, Comfort has supported her five of her children to complete school and has one still in school. She owns and operates clothing shop in the local market. She believes she can make her business grow bigger and brighter with loan support and wants to use the loan to buy more clothing materials to increase her stock of goods.

loans.use: To purchase assorted clothing.

loans.name: Grace Santa

texts.es:
Grace R. de 43 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento pero solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico. Su esposo trabaja en otro País, pero tiene 4 hijos que viven con ella.

Grace empezó hace 5 años atrás vendiendo cuadernos y plumas a sus vecinos. Cuando ahorro dinero suficiente construyo en la parte delantera de su casa un pequeño local para su papelería.

Ahora ella trabaja todo los días desde las 06h30 hasta las 21h00 todos los días vendiendo cuadernos, juguetes, plumas, laminas, cartulinas, etc. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene son las lluvias que hay en su sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas, juguetes y libros para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener sucursales de su papelería.
texts.en:
Grace R. is 43 years old. She lives in a suburban area of Fortín de Guayaquil. Her house is made of cement but she has only light as a basic service. Her husband works in another country but she has four children who live with her. Grace began five years ago selling notebooks and pens to her neighbors. When she saved enough money, she built a small paper shop in the area behind her house. Now she works every day from 6:30AM until 9PM selling notebooks, games, pens, sheets, cardstock, etc. One of the inconveniences that she faces is the rains that occur in her area. With the loan, she wishes to buy notebooks, pens, games and books for he business. In the future, she wants to have branches of her paper shop.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks, pens and games.

loans.name: Javier Oswaldo

texts.es:
Javier es un padre de familia de 39 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en Puerto Malabrigo, distrito de Razuri, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace ocho años a trabajar en una empresa procesadora de pescado, Puerto Malabrigo es conocido en la zona por poseer varias plantas de procesamiento de este producto hidrobiológico para su conversión en harina de pescado. La mayoría de los pobladores encuentran en estas fabricas una fuente de trabajo e ingreso económico para sacar a su familia adelante.

Tal es el caso de Javier, que se apoya en este trabajo para mantener a su familia, los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le han permitido mantenerlos sin problema, pero hace unas semanas las lluvias que azotaron las ciudades del norte del país, hicieron algunos daños en la estructura de su vivienda. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de materiales para hacer mejoras en la estructura de su vivienda.

Javier es una persona honesta y muy trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es instalar una bodega en su vivienda con la cual la economía de su familia goce de un ingreso extra y de mayor estabilidad. El es conocido y respetado por sus vecinos quienes lo consideran un hombre honorable y que siempre ayuda a los que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Javier, 39, lives with his wife and children in Puerto Malabrigo, Razuri district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, which is three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region. For the last 8 years he has worked for a fish processing plant. Puerto Malabrigo is well known in the area for having several fish processing plants specializing in turning fish into fish meal. Most of the area residents find employment and income to support their families in these plants. Such is Javier’s case. He relies on this job to support his family. Income from this work has made it possible for him to support them problem-free. However, a few weeks ago heavy rains pelted the cities in the north of the country causing structural damage to his house. For this reason, he is asking Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time, for a loan of 1000 new soles to buy building materials to repair his house. Javier is an honest, very hard-working person. His greatest wish is to set up a store in his home so that the family’s economy can enjoy an extra source of income and more stability. He is known and respected by his neighbors who consider him to be an honorable man who always helps those in need.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

location.town: Puerto Malabrigo - Rázuri - Ascope - La Libertad

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de la de la comarca pueblo redondo, es madre  soltera, trabaja en el instituto señor de esquipulas, se desempeña en el cargo como docente, además cuenta con el apoyo económico de su hija.
texts.en:
This client is from Pueblo Redondo. She is a single mother. She is a teacher at the Señor de Esquipulas Institute. Her daughter contributes to her support.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for home improvement labor costs.

loans.name: Tunde

texts.en: Tunde is a hard working and honest man. He has a fish pond where he raises fish to sell. He loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with his customers. He works for long hours to be able to support his home. He is married, has 4 children and he is 40 years old. His wife also works to support their home. Tunde is requesting for a loan amount of NGN50,000 to purchase more fingerlings to boost his business. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more fingerlings

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia J. is currently in the business of selling dresses and bedsheets and is requesting a loan to stock pairs of trousers and sandals to sell.  Fozia is 22 years old and is divorced.   She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a supermarket.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock pairs of trousers and sandals to sell

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia Y. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 57 years old. Cecelia is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Cecelia owns & operates a specialized retail store selling coconut wine known as "tuba" in the local community. Cecelia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Cecelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Cecelia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Cecelia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Guillermo De Jesus

texts.es: Guillermo de Jesús de 40 años, es un hombre trabajador y disfruta mucho de su trabajo. El se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de taxi. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que sus inicios se dan por que su familia anteriormente alquilaba un taxi y Guillermo se dedicaba era quien lo manejaba. El ha se sacrificado mucho por comprar su propio carro ahora que lo obtiene está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de reparaciones que son necesarias. Sus deseos son obtener una nueva unidad de taxi.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 40 years old. He is a hard worker and loves his job. He provides taxi services and has been doing so for more than ten years. He used to rent his taxi, but he has worked hard to be able to buy his own vehicle. He is asking for this loan in order to buy some needed spare parts. He would like to buy a new taxi one day.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Jamoliddin

texts.en: S. Jamoliddin was born in 1979 and is married with three children. As an aspiring and hard-working man he has always dreamed of achieving success in whatever he does. Thus, when he joined IMON International four years ago, he was able to make much progress with his previous loan, which he invested mostly in crop farming. Then, Jamoliddin saw a new business opportunity: rearing calves, which is very profitable because of the constant demand for meat at the market. Given this loan, he will purchase calves and feed for them to expand his business. Jamoliddin plans to use the profits from his business to educate his children, improve the structure of his home, and improve the standard of living of his family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase calves in order to expand his business

loans.name: Lamulatu

texts.en:
N. Lamulatu is 21 years-old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka area of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  Lamulatu has a business managing a retail store, which sells various small goods, in Kyotera.  Lamulatu has had her retail business for approximately one-and-a-half years.

To expand her business, Lamulatu is requesting a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy goods to resell and obtain more inventory for her retail shop.  Lamulatu hopes to expand her business and gain more clients in order to generate profits for her family.  

Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. First, the ELA program provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterwards, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer youth a unique chance to access finance at a young age, improve their prospects for the future and to target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nieves es una madre de familia de 47 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, allí ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de productos de uso diario por los cuales tendrían que dirigirse hasta el mercado del distrito para adquirirlos. Nieves se encarga de que sus clientes encuentren  los productos que necesitan en su establecimiento, por ello trata de ofrecerles productos de buena calidad, esto y el trato amable con el que los atiende han hecho que actualmente cuente con un grupo de clientes fieles que mantienen una preferencia por su negocio.
Su esposo trabaja como transportista en una mototaxi (motocicleta con una cabina anexada que sirve para brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros), con los ingresos que ambos perciben sacan adelante a su hogar.
Nieves desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas productos para ofrecérselos a sus clientes, por ello ha solcicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su meta.
Nieves es una mujer tranquila y responsable, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona de confianza. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Nieves is a 47 year old mother who lives with her husband and two children in the Chepén district, an agricultural area with a lot of commercial trafic, in the province of the same name. The area is in the La Libertad region, an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She is in business selling groceries and household necessities, from a store in her home. She provides her customers with all sorts of everyday products, which they used to have to go all the way to the district market to buy. Nieves likes to make sure her customers always find the quality goods they want in her shop. Together with her friendly manner, this has meant she now has a group of loyal customers who choose to make their purchases in her shop. Her husband works driving a mototaxi (which is a motorcyle with a cab on the back that is used for transporting goods or passengers). With the two incomes they share in the running of their home. Nieves wants to grow her business by purchasing additional stock to offer her customers, so she has requested a loan of 2000 soles from [field partner] Edpyme Alternativa that will help her realize her aims. Nieves is a calm and responsible woman. In the area where she lives, her neighbours consider her a reliable person. She has already been working with this organisation and has shown herself to be punctual and responsible with regard to her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy additional stock for the store she runs in her home

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La Señora Rosa Argentina tiene 39 años, es una mujer casada. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de comida. Hace más de 10 años que posee este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en el mercado, Por lo que sus inicios surgen con muy poco capital, pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante ya que tenía que pagar las cuentas de su vivienda y además proporcionarles a sus hijos estudios y alimentación. Poco a poco fue incrementando su inventario con las pocas ganancias que su negocio le generaba, sus clientes recurrían a su negocio ya que la atención de Rosa es muy buena y además atiende a sus clientes con una sonrisa en sus labios. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite y maíz, refrescos, bolsas, platos y cubiertos. Su mayor sueño es que cada uno de sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios y que sigan adelante con esta actividad que les ayudo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Argentina is 39 years old; she is a married woman and has 2 children under her care. She sells and makes food as a source of income and has had the business for over 10 years. Her business is located in the market. In the beginning, she had very little capital but had the will to get ahead since she had to pay the household expenses and give her children a good education and food. Little by little she increased her inventory with very little earnings but her customers kept coming back since Rosa’s attention to her customers is very good and she always greets them with a smile on her lips. The loan is for work capital to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil and corn, refreshments, bags, plates and utensils. Her biggest dream is that each of her children will be able to finish their studies and that they will continue with their respective jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Consentidas Group

texts.es:
“CONSENTIDAS” es el nombre de la Asociación Comunal que se organizò para su segundo ciclo en el Centro Focal de VILLA EXALTACIÓN, como todas las asociaciones está guiada por una mesa directiva, compuesta por una presidenta, tesorera y secretaria de actas. 

La tesorera,  doña L. se dedica a la venta de carne, aprendió este negocio de sus padres pues antes trabajaba con su familia.    Actualmente le colabora su pareja, compran carne por mayor del matadero y la venden por menor todos los días.  Es parte de la asociación desde el primer ciclo, la primera vez fue invitada por sus compañeras.


La asociación comunal esta integrado por siete mujeres y un varón. Tienen negocios diferentes, como: venta de carne, venta de comida, recicladora de chatarra, venta artesanía, venta de salchipapa, venta de productos de salud.
texts.en:
“Consentidas” (Easy-Going Women) is the name of the communal bank that was organized for its second loan cycle at the Villa Exaltación Service Point. Like all the communal banks, it is guided by a board of directors, consisting of a president, treasurer and secretary. The treasurer, L., sells meat. She learned this business from her parents because she used to work with her family. Now she works with her husband; they buy meat wholesale from the slaughterhouse and sell it retail everyday. She has been part of the bank since the first loan cycle. The first time, she was invited by her friends. The communal bank is made up of seven women and one man. They have different businesses, such as: meat sales, food sales, scrap iron recycling, handcraft sales, sales of salchipapa [a Bolivian fast food], and sales of health care products.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: meat

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is happily married to a businessman. She has four children, one in secondary school, two in primary school and one infant. She has been selling clothes in a shop for the past 10 years. Lucy also gets income from mobile phone charging from her house which has an electricity connection. With the kshs. 40000 loan, Lucy wants to buy bales of clothes. She experiences the challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to sell clothes wholesale in future. She owns her home which has both electricity and water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: Buy bales of clothes

loans.name: Janyl

texts.en:
Janyl S. is young farmer, who lives in Ak-Jar village, in the north –west of Kyrgyzstan. She is 28, married and has three children. Janyl graduated from medical college and works as a nurse at the local ambulance room. In order to find an additional means of subsistence for her children, Janyl decided to start her own business in cattle breeding. Using her initial capital of 3,500 KGS, she bought only one calf. Her start as an entrepreneur was successful due to strong efforts and today she has two milk cows, two calves, and three horses. Also, Janyl started to engage in bee-farming, which became her favorite activity. At present days, she has 12 bee-families and earns about 8,000 KGS monthly from selling the products of bee keeping. 

Now Janyl applies for  loan of 60,000 KGS to buy more milk cows that will allow her to increase milk sales and enlarge the number of customers. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Los Solidarios De San Isidro Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS SOLIDARIOS DE SAN ISIDRO ”; El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Chicón, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El  socio es él Sr.Eliseo él tiene 51años de edad, él tiene 3 hijos y es casado; el socio se dedica a la agrisultura , él tiene terrenos para cultivar maíz y papa. El socio es agricultor desde hace 10 años, el socio es natural de Quillabamba ubicado a 8 horas de Cusco, el radica en el poblado de Chicón desde hace 11 años y es feñiz allá, el socio solicita el préstamo para esta temporada que iniciarán las siembras de los diferentes productos agrícolas. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas, abonos, preparar la tierra.

Los otros socios son  agricultores otras se dedican a la crianza de animales, otras socias venden comida, otros son albañiles y artesanos.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Here is a member of the community bank "Los Solidariso de San Isidro". The community bank is located in the district of Chicon in the province and region of Cusco.One of the members is Eliseo, he is 51 years old, he has 3 children and he is married. He is an agriculturist and he has his fields where to cultivate corn and potatoes. He has been an agriculturist for the past 10 years. He is originally from Quillabamba, a city located 8 hours from Cusco but he has lived in the city of Chicon for the past 11 years and he is happy there. He requests a loan for this season when the fields are seeded of various produce. He requests a lon to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and to ready the fields. The other members are agriculturists and livestock farmers, some sell foods, others are construction workers, and artisans. She is very grateful and she values the loan granted to her through this organization and she is committed with the payment obligations of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MACHUPICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


El socio es el Sr. Luis Alberto; el tiene 45 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; el socio tiene un negocio de imprenta, el tiene una pequeña tienda de imprenta  que atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar  papeles y materiales para la imprenta.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the community bank "Machupicchu".  The bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the Cusco province and Cusco department.

The member is Mr. Luis Alberto, 45 years old, married with two children.  The associate has a printing business.  He has a small printing shop that he runs from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, and through this business he takes care of his children.  He wants to expand his business and is requesting a loan to buy paper and other printing materials.

He gives thanks to all that are participating making his dream come true and promises to comply with the established payment terms.

loans.use: The associate is seeking a loan to purchase paper and printing materials.

loans.name: Dannys Geovanni

texts.es:
Dannys de 19 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de mariscos, reside en el Puerto El Triunfo, departamento de Usulután ,  vive con su madre y su hermano , es soltero y no tiene hijos, el negocio lo inicio trabajando con su padre luego quiso ser independiente para lo cual inicio este negocio, su única dificultad  es que tienen mucha demanda de producto y no cuentan con un vehículo para entregar la mercadería a domicilio por lo que se ven en la necesidad de alquilar un carro para realizar las ventas generando un mayor gasto para ellos .
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de mas producto y dar abasto a toda la demanda, logrando obtener mayores ingresos viendo de esta manera más cerca el sueño de comprar su propio vehículo, esto le ayudara a progresar como persona y como  comerciante; sus sueños son crecer en el negocio, poseer su carro, tener un buen inventario  de producto, cancelar a tiempo  este préstamo  y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Dannys is 19 years old and sells shellfish. He lives in Puerto El Triunfo in the department of Usulután. He lives with his mother and his brother. He is single and doesn't have any children. He started out working with his father, then he wanted to be independent, so he began this business. His only difficulty is that there is a lot of demand for his product and he doesn't have a vehicle to deliver his merchandise to homes, so it is necessary to rent a car to complete his sales, and this generates a considerable expense.

He is applying for the loan so that he can buy more product and meet the demand, and also obtain greater income, thus coming closer to his dream of buying his own vehicle. This will help him progress as a person and as a businessman. His dreams are to expand his business, have a car, have a good inventory of product, pay back this loan on time, and improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: Buy shellfish to sell.

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en:
Clarisse is 28 years old. She is married and has three children who are between nine months and eight years old. Two of her children go to school. Her husband works at a government institution. Clarisse owns a butchery selling meat, and she has been in this business for a period of four years. 

She would like to get this loan to buy more meat to sell.  With the profit from this business, she expects to pay school fees for her children and reinvest in her business.   In the future, she plans to expand her business and would like to see it prosper.

loans.use: To buy more meat to resell

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas, es socia del Banco Comunal Dignidad, tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos.
Felicitas es feriante, viaja a Cangallo, donde vende frutas surtidas, verduras surtidas, pan y en Cangallo compra: maíz, trigo, cebada y lo vende los días domingos en la feria de las Américas.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en surtir su mercadería (frutas, pan, verduras, queso)
Lo que le gusta de Finca es que puede acceder al crédito y puede ahorrar. Su sueño es poder construir sus casa.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Dignidad Microfinance Group. She is a 42-year-old married mother with 5 children.

She is a stallholder at Cangallo, where she sells assorted fruits, vegetables, and breads. At Cangallo, she purchases corn, wheat and barley, which she sells on Sundays at the Feria de las Americas Market.

The loan that he is requesting will be invested in restocking her stand with goods (fruits, bread, vegetables, cheese). What she likes about Finca is that she can obtain a loan and save money. Her dream is to be able to build her own house.

loans.use: Purchase local fruits, vegetables, and breads

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es: Maricela tienen 33 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 2 años compra y vende alfalfa al por mayor, negocio que le proporciona ganancias y le demanda mucho trabajo, ya que tiene clientes que viven en su zona, lugar que queda muy lejos y les es difícil llegar a la ciudad para adquirir éste producto. Ante esto decidió vender este producto, hoy son muchos los que le solicitan alfalfa, ya que les sirve como forraje para sus animales. Sus hijos, son quienes le ayudan en el negocio, durante toda la semana, repartiendo a los clientes. En adelante anhela aumentar su capital de trabajo y así cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito podrá invertir en la compra de más alfalfa.
texts.en: Maricela is 33 years old; she lives with her three children in her own home. For more than two years she has bought and sold alfalfa wholesale, a business that gives her revenue and demands a lot of work because she has customers who live in her area, a place that is very far and hard to reach from the city where they could buy this product. She decided to sell this product, and now there are many people who request alfalfa because they use it to feed their animals. Her children, who are helping her with the business, make deliveries to customers all week. She wants to increase her working capital very soon so she can keep up with customer demands. This is her first loan with Kiva partner MFP; she is very happy to know that she has some financial support. She is grateful to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and loyal. She is grateful to all the people who will be lenders on this loan because it will be very useful in moving her business forward. With this loan she will be able to purchase more alfalfa.

loans.use: Buy more alfalfa

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 49 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 5 años decidió emprender su propio negocio, vendiendo productos de primera necesidad en un espacio que disponía en su casa. Desde entonces brinda una atención cálida y amable a sus clientes que consumen los productos que ella vende. Todos los días los dedica a su negocio y hasta los fines de semana, en ocasiones recibe el apoyo de sus hijos. Hoy espera aumentar sus ganancias, debido a que se encuentra en temporada navideña por lo que habrá más afluencia de gente que irá a su establecimiento, por tanto espera comprar más mercadería para abastecer su negocio. Es el crédito número 8 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que recibirá, lo utilizará en la compra de más productos.
texts.en: Elizabeth is 49 years old. She lives with her two children in a home that she owns. Five years ago, she decided to start her own business, and using some available space she had in the house, she set up a shop to sell basic staple products. Since then she has been bringing warm and friendly customer service to clients who purchase from her. She works in her shop every day, including weekends; sometimes her children help her out as well. Currently, Elizabeth is hoping to increase her earnings because of the upcoming Christmas season, when she'll have a larger influx of customers; therefore, she would like to buy a greater quantity of merchandise to supply her store. This is Elizabeth's eighth loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support. In addition, Elizabeth likes being a part of her communal bank because all of its members are people that she knows - people who are responsible and committed to the group. Elizabeth is grateful to all the individuals who will make this loan possible since it will be very helpful to her in advancing her business. She will use the loan to buy more inventory for her shop.

loans.use: Purchase more inventory to supply her store

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es:
Isaías, reside en Jucuapa departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos de 6, 4, 3 y 1 año de edad, él tiene 28 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, desde hace seis años, este negocio lo aprendió de su padre ya que al igual que él se dedica a la venta de productos derivados de la leche, su trabajo es de lunes a sábado y es la única fuente de ingreso con la cuenta para sostener su hogar.
Por el momento Isaías quiere adquirir más productos para comercializar, por lo que solicita un préstamo que le permita adquirir dichos productos, con la idea de mantener siempre una buena cantidad para atender la demanda de los clientes, su compra será en queso, crema, queso fresco y quesillo, con esta inversión su negocio será fortalecido y mejorara sus ingresos familiares ya que tendrá la posibilidad de vender más manteniendo estable el comercio.
Su sueño es atender a nuevas zonas de mercado, ampliándose y obteniendo el reconocimiento de muchos clientes, también de su negocio espera mejorar la condición de vida de su familia y dar el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Isaías, residing in Jucuapa department of Usulután, lives with his wife and four children ages 6, 4, 3 and 1 years.  He is 28 years of age. He has been dedicated to the sale of dairy products for six years. He learned this business from his father, since he was also dedicated to selling products derived from milk.  He works from Monday to Saturday.  This is the only source of income for his household. 
At the moment, Isaías would like to acquire more products to sell.  He has requested a loan which will permit him to buy said products, with the idea of always maintaining a good quantity to meet the demands of his clients. His purchases will be cheese, cream, cheese curds and string cheese.  With this investment his business will be fortified and his family income will improve, now that he will have the possibility to sell more and maintain a steady commerce.   
His dream is to expand into new markets, growing and obtaining more clients.  With his business he hopes to improve the living conditions for his family and give an education to his children.

loans.use: To buy cheese, cream, cheese curds and string cheese.

loans.name: Mercedes Obdulia

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Bosques  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores, conocida desde hace muchos años como la Ciudad Del Valle  encontramos el lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Emprendedora de los Bosques.

La señora Mercedes es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución y por las facilidades para los créditos. Tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero dos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es Abogado. Ella estudio y obtuvo el título de Ing. Comercial.

Se dedica al comercio, vende productos industriales como por ejemplo purificadores de agua, tiene un local en donde funciona su negocio. Hace algún tiempo atrás tenía unas cabinas telefónicas pero tuvo que cerrar por motivos de viaje pero que con este nuevo crédito espera poder volver a abrir, también espera vender teléfonos, accesorios de teléfonos, recargas y tarjetas telefónicas entre otras cosas.

Este crédito es para comprar tarjetas, recargas telefónicas, en si para adecuar sus cabinas. Sus metas son seguir trabajando y mejorando dia a dia.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Los Bosques in the beautiful city of Portoviejo--known for its green mountains and charming landscapes, and at one time called The City of the Valley--we find the place where, every 15 days, the members of the Emprendedora de los Bosques communal bank meet. 

Mercedes is a founding member of this communal bank. She likes it for the benefits it provides and because it facilitates loans. She's 54-years-old, married, and has three children who are grown; two of them still live at home. Her husband is a lawyer. She studied and earned a degree in commercial administration/management.

She works as a merchant, selling industrial products such as water purifiers. She has her own shop where she runs her business. A while ago she had some telephone booths but she had to close them for travel. With this loan she hopes to open them again and she also hopes to start selling telephones and telephone accessories, such as phone cards and phone credit. 

This loan is to buy phone cards and phone credit for her phone booths. Her goal is to continue working and improve everyday.

loans.use: Purchase of phone cards and phone accessories for her phone booths

loans.name: Genaro Deciderio

texts.es:
Genaro casado, comerciante y agricultor el negocio es familiar ya que sus hijos le apoyan trabajan en el cultivo. Inicio con esfuerzo propio poco a poco mejorando su finca, tiene la necesidad de comprar de una yunta de bueyes para arrear la tierra y trasportar la producción siendo esto unos de sus planes para beneficio en mejorar su nivel de vida. 
El préstamo que solicitad será utilizado para la compra de fertilizantes para obtener mejores productos y venderlo a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Genaro is married and works as a merchant and farmer in the family business. His children help by working in the fields. Genaro started through his own efforts and gradually made improvements to his farm. He needs to buy a yoke of oxen so that he can plow his land and transport his harvest. These are some of his plans so that he can improve his standard of living.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy fertilizers so that he can obtain better quality crops that he can sell at a higher price.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia R. is from the village of Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 47 years old. Letecia is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Letecia owns & operates a business which provides pedicure & manicure services to local community members. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Letecia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. The previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase items like nail polish & nail cutters needed to provide service This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Letecia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase items like nail polish & nail cutters needed to provide service

location.town: Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: La señora Ana posee un negocio que es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Desde hace 7 años que inicio este medio de vida, ella vende sus productos de contado y al crédito, algunos camiones llegan a dejarle sus productos hasta su hogar, pero algunas veces ella tiene que ir hasta el mercado para buscar lo que sus clientes solicitan. es madre de dos hijos las cuales están a su cargo, todas ellas asisten al colegio gracias al apoyo incondicional de la mama , la señora está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio ya que sus clientes  están demandando diversidad de productos. A pesar de las circunstancias es una persona que quiere salir adelante con su negocio que es el único medio de ingresos que tiene.
texts.en: Ana has a local store located in her house which she opened seven years ago.  She accepts cash for her products, but also sells on credit.  Trucks arrive to leave her products at her house, but she sometimes has to go to the market to look for what her customers request.  She is the mother of two children who are under her care and they all go to school thanks to her unconditional support.  Ana is requesting a new loan to invest in her business because her customers are demanding a variety of products.  Despite the circumstances, she is a person that wants to move forward with her business, which is her only form of income.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn A. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 36 years old and married, with 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Genalyn sells green bananas and coconuts for making copra, or dried coconut meat. Genalyn has been engaged in her business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Genalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Genalyn is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconuts and bananas. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Genalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts and bananas

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor tiene 58 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en el sector Primero de Mayo del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz. Uno de los distritos más poblados de la región Lambayeque, caracterizado principalmente por tener altos índices de pobreza, ya que las personas viven generalmente en zonas urbanas marginales que carecen de servicios básicos.

Desde hace 5 años tiene instalado en el exterior del mercado de abastos Atusarías se dedica a la venta de frutas. Todos los días ofrece a sus clientes una variedad frutas. Este negocio es una fuente importante de ayuda a la familia. El negocio de Víctor siempre cuenta con clientes que prefieren su buen trato y amabilidad. 

El desea adquirir más mercadería, por ello há creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.  De esta manera ella podrá adquirir la fruta a menor precio y por consiguiente ayudara a tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Víctor, 58, is married living with his wife and two children in the Primero de Mayo sector of José Leonardo Ortiz District, one of Lambayeque Region’s most crowded districts, known primarily for its high rate of poverty since the people generally live in marginal urban zones that lack basic utilities.

For the last five years he’s had a fruit stand located outside the Atusarías Foodstuffs Market.  He offers a variety of fruit daily to his customers.  This business is an important source of help for his family.  Víctor’s business always has customers because they prefer him because of his good treatment and kindness.

He wants to acquire more merchandise so he thought it would be a good idea to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan so that he can get the fruit at a lower price and thus have higher income.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Pol

texts.en:
Pol S., 58, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. 

S. is a farmer and a grocery seller, earning an income of $7 US per day. Two of her children are employed at the factory, earning an income of $3 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend $20 on food and $35 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase groceries to sell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy groceries to resell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet P. is from the village of Poblacion, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 53 years old. Juliet is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Juliet owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling electronic loads of several networks like GLOBE & SMART and digital video discs in the local community. Juliet has been engaged in business for over 13 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional electronic loads of GLOBE & SMART. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Juliet from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional electronic loads of GLOBE & SMART.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 59 years old and married with six children.

Antonieta is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Antonieta requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Antonieta has been raising pigs for six years now and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Antonieta would like to save enough to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 52 years old and lives in New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 10 children.

Anita has a general store selling shampoo, toothpaste, soap, etc. to earn a living. She has had this business for 30 years. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 12,000 PHP to purchase more variety of products such as soap, shampoo and toothpaste for her general store.

Anita has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase more variety products such as shampoo, toothpaste, and soap for her store

location.town: Liloy-New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del presente comité, fue a iniciativa de la Sra. Celsa, quién vive en  la zona de Ciudad del Este. Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona.
Las mismas ya formaron parte del Comité Emprendedora de la Fundación Paraguaya.
La Directora General del Comité que se denomina “Mujeres Activas”, es la Sra. Celsa. Ella es una señora luchadora, responsable y muy activa junto con sus compañeras que conforman el grupo. El comité se encuentra en el   Segundo   Ciclo con 25 integrantes, quienes desarrollan diversas actividades, todas en busca de generar mayor ingreso en sus hogares y tratar de brindarles a sus hijos una mejor educación y bienestar. Anhelan poder brindarles todo a lo que ellas no pudieron acceder.
Son muy unidas, responsables, trabajadoras y solidarias.
Solicitan el credito para la compra de mercaderias para la venta, las mismas consitirían en: comestibles de primera necesidad: verduras, frutas, arroz, harina, azúcar, etc.
texts.en:
Ceslsa is the general director of the communal bank, which is called “Mujeres Activas” (Active Women).  She is a tenacious and responsible woman.  She is very active together with her colleagues in the communal bank.  The communal bank is in its second cycle, and it is comprised of 25 women who carry out diverse business activities.  

All of them look to generate greater income for their households, and they try to give their children a better education and well-being.  They strive to be able to give them everything that they were not able to have.  They are very united, responsible, hard-working, and supportive.

They are requesting the loan to buy basic needs food, which includes vegetables, fruit, rice, four, and sugar, etc.

loans.use: to buy basic needs food like vegetables, fruit, rice, four, and sugar, etc.

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Sothea, pictured here, is a construction worker and his wife is a farmer. The couple has been married since 2009 and has a young daughter. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sothea is requesting a loan to buy a cow to raise and sell when it grows big enough.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to raise and sell

loans.name: Yayah

texts.en:
44-year-old Yayah is married and has two children aged nineteen and sixteen. His dependent father also lives with him.

In 2001, Yayah began selling garri (cassava flakes) because he needed to alleviate his domestic difficulties. His business is the only source of livelihood for him and his family. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about 7,600,000 SLL every month. The rising cost of transportation is his major challenge, though, and competition is extremely high.

Yayah would like a loan of 3,000 SLL in order to buy more garri to sell. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly income by approximately 751,000 SLL.

In the future, Yayah plans to purchase and install a garri processing machine in his village and to give his children a quality education. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more garri to sell.

loans.name: Mutinda

texts.en:
Mutinda, aged 40, is married to Kanini; they are blessed with four children between the ages of six and fifteen. He has a farm producing mainly maize, beans, and millet, and has been doing this for ten years. The business earns him a monthly income of 6,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

This is his second loan with KADET Ltd. He will use the loan funds to buy fertilizer for planting and to pay for labor. 

He intends to use the expected profits to pay school fees for his children and hopes to build a permanent house for his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for planting and to pay for labor

loans.name: Charley

texts.en:
" To be successful in life" is the main goal of Charley, a 55 year-old mother of five. To attain her goal, she engages in selling frozen foods to earn additional income. She has been in this business for almost 9 years and usually earns P6,000 a month. Her income was used for their food and for necessities for their children.

She aims to improve the business to make it more profitable. She is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy longanisa (pork sausage), tocino, ham and hotdogs to sell in their village. She believes that hard work and strong determination are the keys to gain success.

loans.use: to buy longanisa (pork sausage), tocino, ham, and hot dogs to sell in the village

loans.name: Todos Juntos Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Todos Juntos”, está conformado por 18 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran, ventas de carbón, tejidos, venta de ropa, pintores, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valdivia.
Yeisi integrante del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra al fondo del grupo y solo se puede apreciar su rostro sonriente, usa un corte de cabello hacia el lado. 
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, comenzó vendiendo ropa de segunda mano desde hace dos años, sin embargo en la actualidad y desde hace dos meses está incursionando con la venta de ropa nueva.
Comenta que ha alcanzado tener un gran número de clientes, debido a sus trabajos anteriores de manera dependiente. Su horario de trabajo es flexible, lo que le permite coordinar su día de manera organizada.
Su mercadería la encarga a la ciudad de Santiago, específicamente en el barrio Meiggs, sector que surte de productos a comerciantes con un bajo costo.
Con el crédito invertirá en su negocio y comprará ropa nueva.
Sus metas son instalar su negocio en un local establecido, ya que esto le permitiría abastecer con novedosos diseños su negocio. 
Yeisi vive junto a su madre y sus dos hijas de 10 y 3 años de edad. Sus sueños  a nivel personal son proporcionarles a sus hijas una educación de calidad y que puedan ser profesionales.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida con los créditos y servicios brindados por Fondo esperanza. Comenta que se siente muy cómoda con el grupo del Banco comunal y reuniones impartidas en éstas.
Valdivia es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Ríos. Se destaca por tener uno de los pocos ríos navegables de Chile, el Calle Calle. Valdivia presenta, dentro de sus principales actividades económicas, la industria de la construcción naval, maderera, papelera, celulosa (Celco), cervecera y molinera. El turismo desempeña un papel importante, como también los servicios educacionales universitarios, encabezados por la Universidad Austral de Chile.
texts.en:
This community bank is called Todos Juntos.  It is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who work in different sectors, including coal sales, textiles, clothing sales, painting, and others.  All of the members live in the city of Valdivia.

Yeisi is a member of the community bank.  In the photo, she is in the back, and you can only see her smiling face.  She has a hairstyle to the side.  She works selling clothing.  She started selling second-hand clothes two years ago, however two months ago, she began selling new clothing.  She already has a large number of customers thanks to her past jobs.  Her schedule is flexible, which allows her to organize her own day.  

Her merchandise is made in the city of Santiago, specifically in the Meiggs neighborhood, an area that provides products to merchants at a low cost.  With this loan, she will invest in her business and purchase new clothing.  Her goal is to have an established store for her business so that she can stock up on new designs.  

Yeisi lives with her mother and her two daughters, who are 3 and 10 years old.  Her dream on a personal level is to provide her daughters with a quality education so that they can be professionals.  

She is very happy and thankful for the loans and services provided by Fondo Esperanza.  She comments that she feels very comfortable with the members of the community bank and the meetings given by them.  

Valdivia is a city in the south of Chile, located in the Los Rios region.  It is known for having one of the few navigable rivers in Chile, the Calle Calle.  Valdivia's main economic activities are shipbuilding, lumber, paper, cellulose (Celco), brewing, and milling.  Tourism also plays an important role, as does university educational services, headed by the Universidad Austral de Chile.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing.

loans.name: Penh

texts.en: Mrs. Penh, 31, lives in the Baray district of Kompong Tom Province, where she earns a living raising pigs and farming her own farmland. She has been running this business for many years, and it has provided her with income to attain her standard of living. She has a life partner in her husband, who is a firewood seller. They are blessed with two children, both of whom are single and living under their care. This couple currently owns a cultivating machine that they use for their farming. In order to create more income, Penh would like to request some funds from HKL and Kiva toward purchasing additional firewood for her husband to sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood for her husband to sell.
