loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas, vive con sus padres y dos hermanos no tiene hijos, él se dedica a la venta de medicina natural, el negocio lo comenzó con el apoyo de un amigo quien le ayudo, y ahora ya tiene mucha experiencia, no tiene horario establecido, todos los días sale a vender el producto.
El crédito lo utilizara para comprar mercadería(vitaminas, antibioticos, en presentacion de pastillas, jarabes e inyecciones) y aumentar más su negocio y un estante el cual le ayudara para tener una mejor presentación en su negocio y atender mejor a sus clientes.
El sueño de Tomas es tener un negocio grande, y de esa forma mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Tomas lives with his parents and two siblings.  He doesn't have any children and sells natural medicines for a living.  He started his business with the help of a friend and now he has a lot of experience.  He doesn't have a fixed schedule and goes out every day to sell his products. 

He will use the loan to buy merchandise (vitamins and antibiotics in the form of pills, syrups and injections) and shelving to improve the presentation of his products.  This will help him to increase his business and better serve his customers.  

Tomas's dream is to have a large business so that he can support his family.

loans.use: buy vitamins and antibiotics in the form of pills, syrups and injections.

loans.name: Chamnap

texts.en:
Chamnap (pictured above) is a weaver. She also buys finished silk products from other weavers in her village to resell in Phnom Penh market. 

She has been married since 2001 and has two sons - one who is in school and the other who is too young for school. She lives in a village across the Mekong River, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her husband has full-time employment at a company in Phnom Penh.

Chamnap is in the process of building her new house, but she lacks the money to finish it. Hence, she has decided to ask for another loan in the amount of $1,200 to finish building her house.

loans.use: to finish building her house.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Anecita has had a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & vegetables for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, vegetables & spices. Anecita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, vegetables & spices

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Rosemarie has a retail shop that sells vegetables, spices & food seasonings. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy vegetables & spices to sell.

Rosemarie is a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables & spices to sell

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. 

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en: Rana is a 35-year-old Lebanese divorced woman living with her parents. She has owned a female beauty salon since 2009. Her work is very important because she helps her father with the family expenses. In addition, Rana has three children and contributes in paying their educational fees even if she is not staying with them.  Today, she’s requesting to borrow $2500 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new cosmetics products which will allow her better serve her customers. She is very positive and has high hopes for the future of her business.

loans.use: to buy new cosmetics products

loans.name: Kossomine Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe KOSSOMINE sont toute des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans,  5 enfants et qui vivent dans des  familles polygames à Kaboïla un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.
KOROTOUMOU, au milieu fait la transformation et vente de Sounbala dans ce groupe de femmes KOSSOMINE. Expérimentée à la matière elle beaucoup sollicitée par des clients venant de Sikasso et d’ailleurs. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 150 kilogrammes de graines de néré, dans les villages avoisinants. Elle les transforme avant de les vendre au  grand marché de Sikasso  sur commande et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.50FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The five members of the Kossomine group are all married women, who average 40 years of age with an average of five children each; they live in polygamous families in Koboïla, one of the working-class districts of the town of Sikasso. 

They are on their third loan from the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with a view to satisfying their customer demand. Their previous loans have been repaid in full.

Korotoumou, who is in the middle of the photo, makes and sells sounbala (a spice made up from "néré" seeds) within the Kossomine women's group. As a result of her experience in this domain, she is in great demand from her customers who come from Sikasso and elsewhere. With her loan she is planning to buy 150 kg of "néré" grains in the neighboring villages. She transforms the "néré" seeds into sounbala before selling them at Sikasso's Grand Market to order and within her family, to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash. 

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 20,500FCFA, part of which will be used to pay her loan and the interest on it, while the rest will be saved. Her ambition is to increase her turnover in order to satisfy customer demand more readily.

loans.use: to buy "néré" grains

loans.name: Bokk Diom 7 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Bokk Diom regroupe quatre femmes et un homme qui s’activent dans la vente de paniers, fruits, bancs.
La présidente, une dame de 40 ans  est veuve et mère de famille. Elle vend  des balaies, des oranges, des paniers. Le prêt lui servira  à renforcer son activité.
Avec les bénéfices de son activité Ndew arrive à gérer sa famille au quotidien.
texts.en:
Bokk Diom Group is made up of four women and one man who sell baskets, fruits, and benches. 

The group's president is a 40-year-old woman, who is a widow and the mother of a family. She sells brooms, oranges, and baskets. She will use her loan to bolster her business.

With her profit, Ndew manages to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fruits and crafts (baskets, benches, …)

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en: Elmer is married and is a loving father of three children. He is an industrious and determined man. He has been growing agricultural crops for more than ten years. He grows rice as a primary source of income. He wants to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for sowing.  He is asking for a loan of P13,000 for this purpose. He hopes it will bestow plentiful profits for the assurance of their future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for sowing

loans.name: Aridza

texts.fr:
Aridza est une femme âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée å un tapissier. Elle a quatre enfants, dont trois à l’école. Le premier a 15 ans et le dernier a 1 an.
Aridza travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1995. Elle vend des produits de mercerie et du déguè pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la mévente.
Aridza a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits de mercerie, du sucre, du petit mil, du lait et du couscous. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Aridza voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en: Aridza is a 31 year old woman. She is married to an upholsterer. She has four children, three of whom are at school. The oldest is 15 and the youngest 1 year old. Aridza has been working as a retailer since 1995. She sells haberdashery products and 'déguè' (a food product) for all her customers in her shop. She buys her stock in Lomé. She works alone. Currently, her main problem is the slump. Aridza is seeking her third loan with WAGES in order to buy haberdashery products, sugar, millet, milk and couscous. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Aridza would like to grow her business. She says that with her profits, she intends to ensure the family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase haberdashery products, milk, sugar and other products.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es una persona emprendedora, dinámica y objetiva,  ella decidió  estudiar enfermería porque  hace 5 años tuvo un accidente el cual casi le cuesta la vida, pero tuvo el apoyo de la familia, quien estuvo pendiente y la ayudo a salir adelante  y se dio cuenta que siempre necesita de alguien que  cuide y este pendiente de los medicamentos  y además ella  siempre ha sido la persona que cuida en la casa de los enfermos, hace años ella fue la que estuvo cuidando del abuelo, un señor de 94 años, cuando estuvo enfermo se encargó de darle los medicamentos, de estar pendiente y de ponerle  oxígeno. 
Además fue  la persona que se encargó de cambiarle las vendas  y aplicarle las gotas a  el primo cuando le hicieron una cirugía en un ojo, por eso decidió estudiar enfermería.
Ella quiere en un futuro poder entrar en una empresa que le pueda dar una estabilidad laboral, no ha podido cumplir los sueños de ser enfermera por problemas económicos, pero quiere poder tener este beneficio que le brinda KIVA para poder estudiar.

loans.use: Para pagar un semestre de matricula

loans.name: Valentin

texts.en:
Valentin N. is a cutter and his wife is a tailor. Valentin is 65 years old and for 30 years he had worked as a cutter in a tailor factory in Blagoevgrad. There he met his wife.

In 1990 the factory was closed and both Valentine and his wife became unemployed. Then they decided to set their own tailor atelier.

They borrowed some money from friends and used them to buy an old swing machine and an iron press. Now 16 years later their two sons help them in this little business. He still cuts, she still sews and their sons do the delivery.

Now Valentin needs a new model iron press and some sewing materials and applies for this $ 1 200 loan

loans.use: To buy a new model iron press and some sewing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her tailoring and waste paper recycling business

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal P., 33-years-old, is a father of 2 children living with his wife and his parents in Kampung cham province, Cambodia. He makes his living by feeding and selling pigs and chickens, and can typically earn around $5 a day, while his wife stays at home to look after her children. One of his children is a student and another is too young to go to school. Phal Part, is struggling to supplement his family, especially his parents by feeding and selling pigs and chickens. Eventually  he hopes, the loan will allow him to make additional profits by purchasing more pigs and chickens to feed and sell at the local market. 
In the future, he expects to expand his business by purchasing one more piece of land to feed more pigs and chickens. If he has enough money, he would like to decorate his house and to send his children to a local university.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs and chickens to feed and sell to the local market.

loans.name: Nieve

texts.en:
Nieve R. S. is a 44 year old mother of 3 (son pictured) and wife to Francisco. She currently owns a small general store from which she sells different types of food and beverages to the people in her neighborhood. With this loan she is hoping to be able to expand her business to carry more types of food including vegetables and fresh fruit. She wishes to expand in order to improve the quality of life for her family and to be able to better serve those in her neighborhood.

NOTE: Nieve is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $875 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: To buy more wares for her store.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice R. is 35 years old, married with 4 children. She sells eggs in the open-air market. This business is a source of income to the family. Eunice lives in Benin City and has been with LAPO for 6 years; she has been in this business since 1992.

Eunice hopes to receive a loan of US$ 250 so that she can buy more eggs for resale and improve her turnover and thus her profits.

loans.use: To buy more eggs for resale

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en: Mrs. Philomina J. is 34 years old, married with two children, lives in Benin, and she sells yam and potatoes for a living. She learned her business from her mother and started hers in 1999. She is a faithful LAPO client. She requests a $400 loan to buy more yams for sale.

loans.use: To buy more yams for sale

loans.name: Hari

texts.id:
Hari rents land about 1.5 are. In that land he personally made a building for business, as well as rooms for him and his helpers. Since 2004, he is in Furniture business. Starting with 4, now he has 8 helpers. Raw materials are bought from Building stores in Denpasar. This business could bring profit of about Rp3000,000.00/month (Translator's note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp9000-9500.00). Customers are people surrounding his business location. Also friends of customers. Transportation used are motorcycle or pick up. Hari is married and is blessed with 2 children. The 2 childrens lives in Java island with their grand parents. Daily living expense Rp30,000. Children's education expense about Rp500,000/6 months.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Hari mengontrak tanah seluas ± 1.5 are. Di tanah tersebut dia membangun sendiri bangunan untuk tempat usaha sekaligus kamar untuknya dan anak buahnya. Mulai tahun 2004 dia menekuni usaha Furniture. Mulai dari 4 orang anak buah sampai dengan sekarang dia memiliki 8 anak buah. Bahan baku dibeli dari toko - toko bangunan yang ada di Denpasar. Usaha ini memberikan keuntungan per bulan mencapai Rp 3.000.000,00. Pelanggannya merupakan warga sekitar lokasi usahanya. Selain itu dia juga memiliki langganan yang berasal dari teman – teman dari langganannya tersebut. Sarana transportasi yang digunakan berupa sepeda motor dan sebuah mobil carry bak. Hari sudah menikah dan dikaruniai dua orang anak. Kedua anaknya tinggal di Jawa dengan neneknya. Biaya hidup per harinya Rp 30.000,00. Sedangkan biaya pendidikan anak Rp 500.000,00/6 bulan.

loans.use:
To buy raw materials

Membeli bahan baku

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
“I live in Riawind, about 50 km from Lahore, Pakistan. I am borrowing money in a group because I and my neighbours want to help each other out. My husband trades firewood used for cooking and my husband needs a loan to purchase stock.

The other groups members include Razia M. whose husband makes sewerage pipes using cement. Subran’s husband makes summer bed sheets and Kausar sells cloth from home. Razia B.’s son wants to purchase an over-lock machine used in making clothes.”

loans.use: Buy stock of firewood

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es:
Doña Casilda is 49 years old and for a living she sells vegetables at the market “Primero de Abril” seven days a week. Casilda has four children and her husband is a small farmer. On the other hand, three of her daughters are employees and with their income they buy their own clothes for the beginning of the school year as their mother does not earn enough. They own a house at the km. 21, El Palmar, a wooden house with 2 rooms.

Casilda has been selling vegetables at the market for the past four years, before that she sold second-hand garments, but the sale of vegetables is more profitable as she can also use them to feed her family. Her stand is small and she has to compete with several saleswomen offering the same products and with bigger stands. The success of her business is because of her persistence and responsibility to attract clients. With the present loan she will buy 18 “arrobas” (1 arroba = 25 pounds) of big potatoes at Bs.(Bolivianos) 560.-, 9 “arrobas” of small potatoes at Bs. 200.-, a bag of onions at Bs. 140.-, a box of tomatoes at Bs. 60.-, other kinds of vegetables Bs. 78.-. She will give part of the loan, Bs.150.-, to her husband to buy pesticide for his rice and the rest will be used to pay basic necessities such as electricity and water. This is Casilda’s third transaction with this institution and she has had few late payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Casilda es una señora de 49 de edad que se dedica al comercio de verduras en el mercado PRIMERO DE ABRIL, donde atiende todos los días. Casilda tiene cuatro hijos y su esposo es un pequeño agricultor. Por otra parte tres de sus hijas trabajan como empleadas para poder comprarse ropa para el inicio de clases ya que a su madre no le alcanza. Viven en una casa propia en el km. 21, El Palmar, en una casa de madera de 2 ambientes.

Casilda vende verduras en el mercado desde hace cuatro años atrás, anteriormente vendía ropa usada pero ella considera que la venta de la verdura es mejor ya que con ello puede alimentar a su familia, su puesto es pequeño y ahí debe competir con varias vendedoras que ofrecen los mismos productos y con puestos más grandes. El éxito de su negocio es la persistencia y responsabilidad para atraer clientela. Con la presente solicitud comprará 18 arrobas de papa grande a Bs. 560.-, 9 arrobas de papa pequeña Bs. 200.-, Una bolsa de cabezas de cebollas Bs. 140.-, Una caja de tomate Bs. 60.-, Otras especies Bs. 78.-.Después una parte le dará a su esposo para que compre veneno para su arroz Bs.150.- y el resto para el pago de luz, agua y otras necesidades básicas. Esta es la tercera operación de Casilda en la institución, tiempo en el cuál mantuvo una mora muy baja.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables to increase sales at market place.

loans.name: Toshpulot

texts.en: Toshpulot D. is 33 years old, married and has two children. He works as a vendor, selling men's clothing such as sport suits and pullovers. He conducts his business in the town's central market, where his shop attracts many customers, in part because his prices are low and affordable for most people. His wife (shown here in the photo) helps out a lot, often running the shop when he is away making purchases. Toshpulot would like to increase the range of goods he has to sell, and has applied for a loan of $1,000 to make that possible. He has been a client of IMON since 2005, and proved himself to be an honest and diligent businessman. He is committed to repay the loan on time, and wishes to thank everyone who chooses to support him.

loans.use: To increase the range of items for sale by buying more men's clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of cloth, thread, etc.

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en:
Anderson C. is a young, 21-year-old man. At the age of 19, he began working as a salesperson, traveling from house to house. At that particular time, he did not own the business but was merely helping his mother. Later on, he realized that he could actually buy his own products and then sell them because he did not like the idea of having to depend on his mother’s business. And, since he already knew many customers and had learned how to deal with them, Alejandro took advantage of the opportunity.

Simply put, Alejandro sells various products such as irons, blenders, sheets, towels, and trays. Because May 15th is Mother’s Day in Paraguay, Alejandro affirms that there is a huge demand for his products during this period of time. Therefore, Alejandro is seeking a loan to buy more products in order to satisfy the demand.

loans.use: To meet the increase in demand for his products by purchasing additional items (e.g., irons, blenders, sheets, towels, and trays).

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Doña Flor lives with her partner, she is 36 years old from Lima, she has 3 children depending on her, she studied nursing and she lives in the District of Manuel Arévalo – Trujillo – Peru. Flor has been selling fruits and groceries from a small general store in her living room for 5 years. She received her first loan of S/.300 from Manuela Ramos six months ago and invested in candies and groceries to supply her store. She is a member of “Banco Comunal Santa Elena II”. With the loan of S/.800, to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy pops, candies, groceries, and other products for her general store. Flor dreams of a bigger store so she can increase her income and move ahead with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Flor es conviviente, tiene 36 años, natural de Lima, tiene 03 hijos dependientes aún de ella, tiene estudios superiores de enfermería, vive en el Distrito de Manuel Arévalo - Trujillo – Perú. Flor tiene una pequeña bodega en la sala de su casa donde vende fruta y abarrotes hace 05 años Se inició con Manuela Ramos hace medio año concediéndole un primer préstamo de S/.300.oo, lo invirtió en la compra de golosinas y abarrotes para surtir su tienda. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Elena II”. Con el préstamo de S/. 800. el cual cancelará en 6 meses comprará gaseosas, golosinas, abarrotes y demás artículos para su bodega. Flor sueña con una bodega más amplia que le pueda generar más ingresos y así poder salir adelante con su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase sales at general store.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Warni

texts.id:
Daily life of Ketut Warni is just getting by. Her husband income as a farmer is felt as not enough to pay for daily expenses. Plus they still have to pay for the child schooling. In that circumstance, Ketut Warni is in the pig farming business that she has run for almost 4 years. Ketut Warni owns 2 mother pigs, and with DINARI's help that was used to buy feed, the mother pigs condition is very well, and after 4 months, both produced 15 piglets, that was sold by Ketut Warni for Rp 200,000/piglet (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp8,000-9,500.00). Profit obtained by Ketut Warni after deducting feed expenses is about Rp 1,500,000. Ketut Warni continues her loan from DINARI, since it is felt to be very helpful to her pig farming business. The next loan would be used to buy 2 fattening piglets, and of course its feed. Profit obtained by Ketut Warni is very important for family economy, so that for the next loan the profit would increase compared to before.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Kehidupan sehari-hari Ketut Warni sangatlah pas-pasan. Penghasilan suaminya sebagai petani dirasa tidaklah cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga. Ditambah lagi harus membiayai sekolah anaknya. Dengan keadaan seperti itu Ketut Warni akhirnya menekuni ternak babi dan sudah dijalaninya selama hampir 4 tahun. Ketut Warni memiliki 2 ekor induk babi kemudian dengan bantuan dari DINARI yang digunakan untuk membeli pakannya perkembangan induk-induk babinya sangat bagus kemudian setelah 4 bulan keduanya menghasilkan 15 ekor anak babi dan dijual oleh Ketut Warni Rp. 200.000,- per ekornya. Keuntungan yang diperoleh Ketut Warni setelah dipotong biaya pakan sebesar Rp. 1.500.000,-. Ketut Warni melanjutkan pinjamannya ke DINARI karena dirasakan sangat membantu dalam usaha ternak babinya. Pinjaman berikutnya akan digunakan untuk membeli 2 bibit penggemukan serta membeli pakan tentunya. Keuntungan yang diperoleh Ketut Warni sangat penting pengaruhnya dalam ekonomi keluarganya sehingga untuk pinjaman kedepan ini diharapkan keuntungannya akan berlipat dari sebelumnya

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed (Membeli anak babi dan pakan)

loans.name: Salo

texts.en:
S. Salo lives in Isfara Town in the Sugd region of Tajikistan. He is 46 years old, married and has four children. He has a secondary education and an animal husbandry business. He has a small cow house where he breeds calves. Because he does not have a specialized education, animal husbandry is the only source of income for his family. 

Salo buys calves on the market at a low price, feeds them, and then resells on the same market at a more profitable price. He provides the markets with meat and his family with the necessary food. 

Salo wants to buy calves and needs money, so he decided to apply for a loan of 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) for a term of 12 months. He wants to earn more income so he can provide his children with a good education and improve their lives. This amount would help him accomplish his goals in a short time. Your generosity can change their lives.

loans.use: Purchasing of the calves for expanding the business

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: This the second time Mrs. Ouch S. is requesting a loan to improve her business. She sells vegetables in the local market located in Phsar Leur Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Previously, Mrs. Ouch S. had obtained a loan from AMK to start her current business and she has fully paid it back. Because her business is prospering, Mrs. Ouch S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to better satisfy her customers. Her husband, Mr. Um Sarom, is a motorbike taxi driver who earns some money to help support the family. Mrs. Ouch S. is 45 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending school. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to reach her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase products and materials for her small salon.

loans.name: Mwanakhamis

texts.en:
Mwanakhamis A. has been selling fabric and clothing in Zanzibar since 2005. She works daily from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. and is able to earn a profit of approximately $45 each month. She is looking forward to taking out her first loan through BRAC Tanzania so that she can expand her inventory and increase her profit.

Mwanakhamis is married and has three children, ages 1, 3 and 7.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to stock her small shop.

loans.name: Maura

texts.en: Maura is a member of the Aleli Village Bank.  Maura is 35 years old and married with three children. she sells prepared meals of pig intestines (tripe) at the last stop of an urban transport company. She works from 8am to noon. During summer vacation, she travels to the Ayachuchan tropical forest to sell potatoes, cheese and fish and buy tropical fruit to sell in the Nery Market in Ayacucho.  Maura needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy potatoes and firewood.  Maura’s dreams are to build her own home, to educate her children, and to expand and stabilize her business.

loans.use: Buy potatoes and firewood

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca Y. is a fish monger, which she has been doing since 1994. She buys fish at the shore and processes it at her house before reselling it at the market. Rebecca is married with four children and her husband is a secretary. She has received education through senior high school. She plans to use the money given her to increase her capital to buy more fish to sell at the market, which is at Mpoben near Elmina. She would then use the profits she gets to feed her children, pay for her children’s school fees and other bills, and also build a house for her family.

loans.use: Buy more fish to sell at the market

loans.name: Phoeurn

texts.en: Phoeurn L., 42, and is married to Nhov Yeng, who is 41 years old. They live in a rural area of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. They have eight children; six of them are single and the other two are married. Three of their single children are employed and help with family's needs. Phoeurn is a local cultivator. She grows different kinds of crops, including rice, vegetables, and fruits, and sells them to a reseller at the market three months after planting. Her husband sells wood carving. He carves from wood from the forest, using a cow-cart as transport, and then sells the items at clients’ houses. Phoeurn is applying for a loan of $1000 as capital. The loan will allow her to buy two cows and a cart to use for her farm work, as well as for her husband’s wood transporting.

loans.use: to buy two cow and a cart

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua D. is 35 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. All her children are in school and are doing very well there. She has been trading in the community of Abofour where she lives with her family.

Akosua has been manufacturing palm oil for four years. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits; she then supplies the palm oil to food vendors for use in preparing their meals. She also travels to the villages to purchase additional palm oil when the demand becomes very high.

Akosua will use this loan to buy more palm nut fruits, as well as an electric milling machine to increase her efficiency and allow her to produce larger quantities. This will allow her to expand her business and earn more income to support her family and finance her children's education.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and an electric mill

loans.name: Perju

texts.en: Perju S. is 40 years old and he has lived in Cahul town for 20 years. All his life he has wanted to build his own house with 2 floors where he will be able to have a piece of land in order to grow vegetables and fruits and to feel better and more free. He decided to start building the house in order to finishit  in the next 2 years. For this he needs to buy construction materials, namely cement, bricks, wood, and sand so he applied for a loan from MicroInvest. It is not much money but it is enough to start construction.

loans.use: To start construction of a house

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma.
Dina es soltera, tiene 39 años y 5 hijos, Dina tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado, la especialidad es la comida típica, los fines de semana prepara mas platos, para lo cual cuenta con una persona quien le ayuda. Además por las tardes vende bebidas.
Dina necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cervezas.
Dina sueña con comprar una casa propia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Dina is a member of the Paloma communal bank. She is single, 39 years old and has 5 children. Dina has a restaurant in a rented local. Her specialty is the typical food of the region. On the weekends she prepares more dishes, with which she has an employee to help her. She also sells drinks in the afternoons. Dina needs a loan of 1500 Peruvian Soles, which will be invested in the purchase of beer to sell. Dina dreams about having her own house and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beer to sell

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en: Lisa U., 43, is married with six children. She has three years of experience in the pancake/snack/soft drink selling business. Lisa sells to the village people and general public three days per week. She is a new member of SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 70 Tala ($28 USD). SPBD loans are Lisa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase cordial, sugar, cups, snacks, sacks of flour, baking powder, dripping, and utensils for the business

loans.name: Mayra De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Mayra de Jesús Rodríguez, tiene la edad de 39 años, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ya que ellos tienen, tres hijos a su cargo, doña Mayra es comerciante desde hace cinco años, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de sus hijos, ya que todos duermen en un mismo cuarto, con el financiamiento va a invertirlo en su negocio en la compra de ropa, chinelas para que su inventario incremente al igual que sus ventas  y poder ir ahorrando para hacer las mejoras a su casa para poder gozar de una casa digna.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mayra de Jesus R. is 39 years old, lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her husband, who works to help with the home expenses. They have three children to care for. Mrs. Mayra has been a businesswoman for the last five years. Her major difficulty is the lack of financial resources. Her plans are to improve living conditions for their children. They now all sleep in one room. She will invest the proceeds of the loan in inventory for her business, clothing, slippers, this will increase her sales. She will save her earnings to improve her residence and thus can enjoy living in a proper house.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, slippers and other products to increase her sales.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es: La señora Maria Elsa C. García , tiene la edad de 37 años , habita en el barrio la Francia numero dos , junto a su esposo , el cual trabaja como albañil y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos , uno de 13 y otro de 14 , los cuales trabajan y estudian , los planes hacia su familia es poder darle un mejor bienestar a su hijos , ella desde hace cuatro años se dedica a esta actividad agrícola , inicio con sus propios esfuerzos , sus sueños es poder establecer una manzana de piña . El financiamiento lo quiere para la comprar  insumos y fertilizantes para aplicar al cultivo y tener mejores resultado en la producción como en las ventas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Elsa C. García is 37 years old. She lives in the "Barrio la Francia" number two together with her husband, who works as a building worker. They have two children, 13 and 14 of age, who work and study. Her family plans are to be able to offer a better lifequality to her children. She has been working with farming for the past four years, she started with her own effort and it is her dream to plant a property with pineapples.The loan will be spent on buying supplies and fertilizers and thus obtain better results in the production as well as in the sales.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies and fertilizers to improve crops.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en: In 2005, Larisa was able to turn a corner in terms of her family’s circumstances due to her new found savings. She purchased a plot of land on the edge of the town of Calarasi, which is a regional capital. There she constructed a house and rented it out to another family for additional income. The following year, she was able to build an iron-roofed house for her family to expand from the thatch-roofed stone hut they had lived in for years. Since then, Larisa's business has grown even more, with a second plot of land and house for rent. Larisa is a self-sufficient farmer and businesswoman. She is able to provide food, clothing, and shelter for her family and education for her children.  This is a long way from where she was when she first received a loan from Microinvest. Now she has decided to take another loan from Microinvest to launch her business. She plans to grow vegetables like potatoes, cucumbers, and eggplants.

loans.use: Grow vegatables

loans.name: Rebeca Noemi

texts.es: La señora Rebeca se dedica a la venta de flores en el mercado Rodriguez, un mercado muy conocido en la ciudad, ella sale desde muy temprano, vendiendo una variedad de flores como claveles, rosas, retamas, margaritas. Vive en la casa de sus suegros con su esposo y su pequeño hijo, su esposo le ayuda con los gastos de la casa trabajando como chofer asalariado. Ambos se colaboran mutuamente ya que son un matrimonio joven. El crédito será invetido en la compra de mas variedad de flores para el puesto.
texts.en:
Sra. Rebeca operates a business selling flowers in the Rodriguez market, a market well known in the city. She heads out early to sell a variety of flower types, carnations, roses, Spanish broom and daisies. She lives with her husband and young son in the house of her parents-in-law. Her husband works as salaried driver and helps with the family's expenses. She and her husband help one another because they're a young couple. The loan will be used to buy flowers to resell.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Obodo

texts.en:
S. is a single woman who is 27 years old. She sells hair extensions and second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for the past two years. S. hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more hair extensions and second-hand clothes to sell. 

She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase hair extensions and second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Froilina

texts.es: Froilina tiene 34 años, es natural de Ucayali, ciudad de la selva peruana, vive en Lima desde hace 10 años con su pareja y sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la preparación de comida en su restaurante, siempre le ha gustado la cocina y por ello desde muy joven aprendió con su madre los mejores secretos del arte culinario. Y este oficio le ha permitido hoy mantener a su familia, siendo su esposo su mayor apoyo y fuente de motivación en todo lo que emprende, pues juntos han se esfuerzan por el progreso de su familia. Su negocio da buenos ingresos, ya que su sazón es incomparable y toda su clientela le es muy fiel. Froilina trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, siendo una labor muy cansada, ya que cada vez la clientela se incrementa y tiene que preparar más porciones. Para un futuro cercano, quiere tener un local grande que pueda decorar con bonitas sillas, mesas y vitrinas, y donde atienda más cómodamente a sus comensales. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, ella se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos, gustándole mucho su trabajo en su banco comunal. Con el dinero solicitado equipará mejor su restaurante y también comprará sacos de arroz, litros de aceite y demás comestibles al por mayor.
texts.en:
Froilina, 34, is from Ucayali, which is a city in the Peruvian jungle. She has lived in Lima with her husband and their three children for ten years. For three years she has made food in her restaurant. She has always liked cooking, and since was very young she learned the best secrets of the culinary arts from her mother. This work has allowed her to support her family. Her husband is her biggest help and the source of her motivation in everything she does. Together they have worked for the progress of their family. Her business produces good income. Her seasoning is incomparable, and all of her customers are very loyal. Froilina works from eight in the morning until six in the evening. It is very tiring work because her customer base keeps growing, and she has to prepare more food. In the near future she would like to have a large place that she could decorate with pretty chairs, tables, and cases. This is where she could wait on her diners more comfortably. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She is always very punctual with all of her payments. She really likes working with her community bank. She will use the money she is asking for to better equip her restaurant. She will also buy sacks of rice, liters of oil, and other wholesale foods.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food to prepare her meals

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.es:
Anacleta trabaja como comerciante de comida de lunes a viernes y los fines de semana va a su comunidad a cuidar sus animales tiene dos hijas las cuales ya están casadas, es viuda y vive en alquiler; la venta de comida es la  fuente de ingreso con  que cubre su manutención; su domicilio esta ubicada en la Zona de Vila Ingavi de la Ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de Abarrotes (fideo, arroz y acite) y así podrá incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Anacleta.
texts.en:
Anacleta sells food Monday through Friday. On the week ends she goes to her community to take care of her animals. She has two married daughters. She is a widow, and she rents where she lives. Selling food is her source of income to support herself. Her home is located in the Vila Ingave zone in the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy groceries (noodles, rice, and oil) in order to be able to increase her income. This is her first loan with Imro. The completed evaluation qualifies Anacleta for the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy noodles, rice, and oil for her food selling business

loans.name: Charling

texts.es:
Charling V. es una mujer bastante joven de 31 años de edad, cuya principal fuente de ingresos es la venta de manzanas y uvas en zonas céntricas de Managua (Capital de Nicaragua). Inició con la venta de ropa por encargo, negocio que dejo para dedicarse de lleno a la venta de manzanas y uvas.

Al principio su hermana le entregaba los paquetes y ella se encargaba de venderlos; Cuando conoció ADIM, decidió ella misma comprar y distribuir los productos. Actualmente ella tiene personas a las que le entrega y le vende el producto (Ella es capitalista), ya que para ella es un poco difícil movilizarse a vender (Embarazada). Pero a ella le gusta también salir a vender para generar ingresos extras.

Ella compra los paquetes de manzanas y uvas al por mayor en los Frigoríficos del Mercado Mayoreo (Mercado de productos perecederos en cantidades mayores).

Con el crédito ADIM, pretende retomar también la venta de ropa, para solventar gastos durante su embarazo, pero sigue con sus compras de manzanas y uvas que las da a sus trabajadores.
texts.en:
Charling V. is 31 years old and sells apples and grapes in the neighborhoods of central Managua (the capital of Nicaragua). She began selling clothing upon order, but decided to quit that business in order to sell fruit.

At first, her sister supplied her with inventory to sell. When she started working with ADIM, she decided she should buy the fruit herself for distribution. She currently has people who sell and deliver the goods for her (she considers herself a capitalist), because she was pregnant at the time and had some difficulty moving around the place. Nonetheless, she still likes to go out and sell in order to generate extra revenue.

She buys boxes of apples and grapes from the Refrigerated Wholesale Market (a market where perishable goods can be bought in large quantities).

With her loan from ADIM, she intends to resume her clothing business so that she can pay her medical expenses related to her pregnancy. She continues her business of buying and selling apples and grapes, but she delegates the work to her employees.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing requested by customers

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is twenty – five years old. She is married and has given birth to two children. Both are currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Rita is a hairdresser by profession. She has a workshop by the road side in her community. She says she has four apprentices under training. Rita has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy artificial hair and other working materials in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy artificial hair

loans.name: Ada Luz

texts.es: Ada Luz es una mujer trabajadora y colaboradora de 29 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos menores de edad, se dedica a la crianza de pollos junto a su esposo, pues tienen tres galpones que están ubicados en la carretera Federico Basadre (fuera del centro de la ciudad), estos pollos luego los vende en el mercado de Bellavista , es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras de Marko Jara” desde hace dos años ,el primer préstamo que recibió le permitió invertir en alimentos balanceados para pollos.  COn este préstamo de 1000 soles, piensa invertirlo en alimentos balanceados para los pollos. La meta de Ada es poder tener un molino para que pueda elaborar sus propios alimentos para la crianza de pollos.

loans.use: invertirá en alimentos balanceados para  pollos (aves de corral)

loans.name: Porvenir Feminino 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Flavia is the coordinator of her group Provenir Femenino. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated from Haiti to the DR) clients more generally. Her group is based in the Samana peninsula in an area where there is little access to running water (none of which is potable) and the electrical grid is very unreliable. There she makes her home with her five children in a home that, while providing the necessities, is very far from the commercial center of Samana. 

This is Flavia's seventh loan with Esperanza and she has shown herself to be a reliable associate, repaying all six previous loans without incident. She is taking this new loan to purchase more gasoline to sell to her neighbors and wells as coconuts which she processes to make coconut oil. She believes that the profits from this business will improve her life and the lives of her children by allowing her to take a course in English and photography so that she can change jobs. She says that working with the coconutsis very hard work and she would prefer to work in Samana City and eventually save enough money to move there. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Gasoline to sell and Coconuts to turn into oil

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha works at a car wash in San Sebastian, where it costs 2.50 soles for small cars, 4 soles for bigger cars and 8 soles for trucks for a wash. She washes 30 – 35 per day. She will use this loan to buy things for her house like a wardrobe, which may cost close to 300 soles.

Martha is 34 years old and lives with her partner and two children – one is in third grade and the other is in 8th grade. She is a client of Asociación Arariwa and part of a communal bank consisting of 26 members in Cusco. The group is called "El Amanecer", which means "Daybreak" in Spanish. She is from Cusco and lives in Cusco.

Martha appreciates, and thanks you for, the loan and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy a wardrobe for her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers for the soil and pay for plowing

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael D. is from the village of San Manuel. He is 24 years old, married, and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Michael owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling chicharon products (crispy pork skin, which is good for snacks) in the local community. Michael has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.
Michael joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of $200 USD from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Michael is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and North-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl tiene 41 años, vive en la tranquilidad de su hogar con su esposa (Delia) de 34 años y su hijo político, José de 11 años, que cría como si fuera suyo porque él tiene la concepción de que  padre no es quien engendra si no el que cría con cariño y esmero.

Todos los días debe levantarse con los primeros rayos del sol para empezar su labor de jornalero en las chacras donde lo contratan para machetear y limpiar las plantaciones de café, plátano y cítricos. Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 6 años, tiempo en que se mudó a vivir en la selva, él es oriundo de la sierra peruana. Al llegar a estas tierras le gustó tanto la manera de vivir y el trabajo que decidió establecerse con su familia y quedarse a vivir aquí, porque dice que el clima es perfecto y la tierra es muy productiva.
Como Raúl es un hombre muy emprendedor ya tiene planeado en el futuro comprar su propia chacra donde sembrará café, maíz, plátano y yuca, casi puede imaginar a sus fértiles tierras producir en gran cantidad y él feliz trabajando algo de su propiedad. Además, también quiere implementar una tienda de comestibles en su vivienda.

Este es el primer préstamo que Raúl tiene con MFP y asegura será muy serio en cada pago porque anhela salir adelante honradamente. Con el dinero que solicita comprará un pedazo de tierra para empezar a sembrar lo que tanto desea y brindar seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Raúl is 41 years old and lives in peace in his home with his wife, Delia, who is 34 years old, and his 11-year-old son José, who Raúl raises as if he were his own because his biological father did not raise him with love and care. Every day, he wakes up at dawn to begin his work as a day laborer in the farms, where he is contracted to cut away and clear the coffee, banana and citrus plantations. He has been pursuing this activity for 6 years, during which time he moved to live in the forest; he is a native the Peruvian mountains. When he came to the forest, he was so pleased with the lifestyle and his work that he decided to settle there with his family. He says that the weather is perfect, and the land is very productive. Because Raúl is a very enterprising man, he has already planned to buy his own farm in the future, where he will grow coffee, corn, bananas and yucca. He can almost imagine the fertile land producing large quantities and the joy of working on his own property. Also, he wants to have a grocery store in his home. This is Raúl’s first loan with MFP, and he will make sure to be very serious about each repayment because he wants to go forward honorably. With the money that he requests, he will buy a plot of land, where he will begin planting what he wants, so as to offer his family security.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy land to cultivate

loans.name: Alejandra Marina

texts.es: Alejandra Marina B. D. A. D. 44 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Colón, en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos. Ella posee una venta D. tamales, en la cual se encarga D. hacerlos y luego comercializarlos en su casa o con la ayuda D. sus hijos los cuales los reparten en las diferentes casas en las cuales le han hecho un pedido previo a Alejandra. Debido a que ella es una mujer muy tranquila, trabajadora y responsable, cuenta con muchos clientes los cuales la prefieren por ser una señora muy aseada para hacer los tamales. Alejandra solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar maíz, pollo y verduras, los cuales son los ingredientes más básicos para la elaboración D. los tamales, ya que ella desea poder contar con mayor cantidad D. materia prima, debido a que en muchas ocasiones recibe pedido grandes los cuales no pueD. aceptar ya que carece D. material para cubrir la cantidad necesaria del pedido.
texts.en:
Alejandra Marina B. D. Aleman is 44 years old. She lives in the town of Colon, in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and three children. She has a business selling tamales. In it she makes and sells them in her house, or with the help of her children, to different houses where they deliver orders previously maD. to Alejandra. Since she is a very calm, hardworking and responsible woman, she has many customers who prefer her because she is very hygenic while making the tamales. Alejandra is asking for a loan with which she can buy corn, chicken and vegetables, the most basic ingredients for making tamales. She wants to have a larger quantity of raw materials since often she receives large orders she can't accept without the materials to cover the quantity necessary for the order.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of raw materials to make tamales.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo T. is from the village of Poblacion 2 in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 53 years old. Rodolfo is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rodolfo operates a "habal-habal" motorcycle transportation service in the local community. Rodolfo has been engaged in his business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month from his business.

In 2010, Rodolfo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodolfo is requesting a loan of 10000 PHP to repair one a motorcycle that he uses in his business. This will be Rodolfo first loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hardware items and construction material

loans.name: Jencen

texts.es:
Jencen tiene 22 años, quien vive junto a su pareja, Diana de 20 años, y su hijo Kenyi de 2 años, en la casa de sus suegros.

A un kilómetro de la ciudad se ubican los terrenos agrícolas que les cedieron sus padres y suegros para que puedan sembrar papa. Paralelamente, con la ayuda de su esposa, cría 2 vacas, de las que extrae leche y elaboran quesos para venderlos; también tienen 2 toros, 3 ovejas y 5 cerdos, los que comercializa cuando se le presenta algún problema económico.
Jencen se dedica a las labores agrícolas desde hace 4 años y con las ganancias obtenidas está implementando los artefactos electrodomésticos, muebles y otras necesidades para de su familia para tener una adecuada calidad de vida. 
Ahora se proyecta a comprar más terrenos de cultivo y en su vivienda instalará una tienda de comestibles para que lo administre su esposa, mientras él venderá animales en las ferias semanales que se desarrollan en su ciudad.                       

Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP, y como siempre, está seguro que pagará cada cuota puntualmente, porque los miembros de su banco comunal son bastante cumplidos y responsables.  Con los quinientos soles que solicita tiene pensado comprar algunos sacos de semilla de papa, abono y fertilizante.
texts.en:
Jencen is 22 years old, and lives with his partner Diana (20) and their son Kenyi (2) in his parents-in-law's house. A kilometer from the city, he owns two pieces of land that his parents and parents-in-law gave him so that he could plant potatoes. Currently, with the help of his partner he raises two cows which he milks to make cheese to then sell. They also have two bulls, three sheep, and five pigs all of which he may sell if financial trouble demands it. Jencen has worked in agriculture for four years and with the income he is generating, he is slowly replacing household appliances and furniture, and fulfilling other family needs. Thus, he improves his family's lifestyle. He would like to now buy more land for planting. He will also build a food store at home that his wife will manage. In the meantime, he will sell animals in the weekly markets around his town. This is the fifth loan Jencen has requested from Kiva partner MFP. As always, he is sure he will pay every installment on time because his communal bank's members are quite dedicated and responsible. With the PEN 500 he is requesting, he hopes to buy bags of potato seeds and fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Srey Touch Nuon Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Touch Soun is the president of a village bank loan that consists of sixteen people located in Chheu Teal Phluos village in Takeo province. The members will use this loan to purchase supplies, equipment, and other items to support their own different purposes. 

Mrs. Srey Touch Soun is 28 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to study or work. She and her husband, Mr. Borey Chea, are farmers who own a two-hectare field to grow crops. They face a problem because their field has infertile soil. Thus, Mrs. Srey Touch Soun decided to ask for a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer to support her farming.  

Aside from farming, Mr. Borey Chea is a fisherman who can earn a small income to help support his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Alcides Domingo

texts.es:
Alcides tiene 49 años de edad, es conviviente hace 28 años, tiene 3 hijos los cuales 
ya son mayores de edad. El vive en casa propia. Alcides se dedica a brindar el 
servicio de transporte en su unidad vehicular, la cual adquirió con ahorros y el pago 
que recibió en compensación a su tiempo de servicio. El ya tiene experiencia en el 
negocio. Alcides sueña con poder culminar con la construcción de su vivienda, la cual 
fue afectada por el terremoto, solicita el crédito para realizarle mejoras a su 
inmueble y así su familia pueda tener seguridad.
texts.en:
Alcides is 49 years old and has lived with his partner for 28 years. They have 3 grown children and own the house they live in. Alcides provides transportation services using a vehicle he purchased with his savings and income as a taxi driver. He already has business experience. Alcides dreams of finishing construction on his home, which was damaged in the earthquake. He is requesting this loan to make repairs to his property and thus provide his family with better security.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repair

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Serafina

texts.es:
La señora Serafina Dominguez de 33 años empezó hace 4 años su negocio de confección de  ropa interior y gracias a la buena aceptación que tiene su producción hace 1 año pudo aumentar vendiendo también articulos de mercerías y roperías, es importante mencionar que el padre de su hijos tambien trabajo y a ayuda para la familia lleve una vida digna.

Desea incrementar sus ingresos invirtiendo en compra de telas para la confección de ropa interior, remeras, pantalones, short, sandalias, championes y otros articulos varios, que le permitirá ofrecer variedad a sus clientes, para este fin solicita el prétamos y agrdece a la Fundacion Paraguaya Y KIVA por la ayuda crediticia que la da mucha gente de escasos recursos.
texts.en:
Serafina Dominguez is 33 years old. Four years ago, she began a business sewing underwear and thanks to her great success in production, one year ago, she was able to expand to selling other clothing articles and notions. It’s important to mention that the father of her children also works and supports the family in a decent life.

She wants to increase her income, investing in the purchase of fabrics to sew underwear, as well as tee shirts, pants, shorts, sandals, tennis shoes, and other various articles, which will permit her to offer a variety to her customers. For this goal, she asks for the loans and thanks the Fundacion Paraguaya and KIVA for the financial support that they give to many people with scarce resources.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire fabric to make underwear; to purchase shirts, teeshirts, tennis shoes and sandals

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: T. is a 36-year-old married woman. To earn a living, T. owns a bicycle that she uses to deliver fish paste to sell in and around her community. She has another financial earner in her husband who drives a motor taxi.  The couple now has six children. One of the children is married and lives separately, and the remaining children are single. To help be responsible for the family, one of her daughters operates a laundry service. The fish commands special price in this season. T. hopes to take this occasion to earn more profit and is asking for a loan in order to buy fresh fish and turn it into fish paste for sale.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Petrona De Las Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Petrona De Las Mercedes se dedica a la venta de quesillos en dos colegios de la ciudad de León por la mañana, por la tarde se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de Avon y ropa usada. Pues es una mujer que le gusta el trabajo y sabe la responsabilidad que como son sus 3 hijos. Su esposo que también aporta ingresos a la familia se dedica a la venta de leña, juntos les enseñan a sus hijos los sacrificios que realizan para mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Necesita financiamiento para invertir en la compra de materias prima para la elaboración de quesillos, comprar ropa usada y adquirir más productos de la Avon. Su deseo es mantener activo este medio de ingreso.
texts.en:
Petrona sells cheeses in the morning in two neighborhoods in the city of Leon. In the evening she sells Avon products and second hand clothing. She loves to work and knows about responsibility because she has three children. Her husband also helps to support the family by selling firewood. Together they teach their children about the sacrifices they must make in order to improve their lives. Petrona needs this loan in order to invest in supplies for her cheese making; buy some second hand clothing, and acquire more Avon products. She wants to keep this source of income going.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
“San Miguel” es un grupo de diez señoras  que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “ Panamericana”,  este es su primer ciclo. Se agruparon por la necesidad de mejorar y ampliar sus negocios y acceder al préstamo y beneficiarse todas. 
Martha C. de 26 años casada, es vecina de la ciudad de El Alto, vive en la zona San Ancelmo hace 3 meses, ella tiene el negocio de artesanía (tejido de diferentes prendas de vestir), cuando termina sus productos los vende en la ciudad de La paz en la Garita de lunes a domingo hace 3 años y necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería. Las demás integrantes tienen diversos negocios como tejido de mantas, venta de ropa, servicios de constructor, tienda de barrio, librería y otros. Todas desean el préstamo para mejorar sus negocios.

En la foto aparecen 11 personas en lugar de 10 porque una de ellas es pariente de una de las integrantes del grupo.
texts.en:
“San Miguel” is a group of ten women who attend their meetings at the Panamericana Community Center. This is their first loan cycle. They formed a group because they need to improve and expand their businesses, as well as access a loan that could benefit all of them. Martha C. is 26 years old, married, and a resident of the city of El Alto. She has lived in the San Ancelmo district for three months. Martha has a craft business in which she produces and sells different types of woven garments. After she completes her products, she sells them in the city of La Paz at La Garita from Monday to Sunday. Martha has been doing this for three years and needs a loan to buy merchandise. The other members have different businesses such as weaving blankets, selling clothes, providing construction services, operating a neighborhood store, managing a bookstore, and other activities. They all need a loan to improve their businesses. There are 11 (rather than 10) people in the photo because one of the women is the relative of a group member.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materals for producing woven garments

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: N. Rosemary is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka area of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is four months old. Rosemary has a business selling bananas and coffee to customers in her village near Kyotera. She has had her business for approximately one year. To expand her business, Rosemary is requesting a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more quantities of coffee and bananas which she will sell in her community. Rosemary hopes to use the loan to expand her business, earning more profit to help support her young family. Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva that funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterwards, ELA participants can receive micro-finance loans to expand their small businesses. These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional micro-finance. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in micro-finance.

loans.use: To buy stocks of bananas and coffee to sell

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is divorced with two children. She sells women's clothing at the Ivano-Frankivsk open market. Irina has been in this business for 15 years. She has two business locations and one employee. This business is the only source of income for Irina and her children.

Irina would like to borrow 6,500 UAH to increase the variety of clothing she stocks. She hopes to increase sales and make additional income. Irina's goal is to save enough money to help her children enroll in college.

loans.use: To increase the variety of clothing stocked

loans.name: Mujeres Decididas E Independientes Group

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 03 hijos es separada D. su esposo, a pesar que sus niños son pequeños ella tiene que trabajar  para darles una mejor calidad D. vida, ella recuerda  cuando compraba ropa para ella y sus hijos  en un mercado D. su zona  poco tiempo después ella empezó a trabajar en gamarra una zona D. fabricantes D. ropa es ahí donD. se dio cuenta que lo que ella pagaba por la ropa que compraba era el doble así descubrió que los mismos confeccionistas  le dejaban la ropa a menos precio por eso deciD. dedicarse al negocio D. venta D. ropa y empieza comprando a los comerciantes que ella conocía ellos mismos la animaron a hacerlo debido a su carisma como todo negocio al  principio fue difícil por que no tenia capital.
El conocer la entidad  le fue D. mucha ayuda por que el dinero D. su primer préstamo lo invirtió para comprar algunas prendas como polos, pantalones y blusas. Su negocio le ha dado muchas satisfacciones como por ejemplo tener algunas comodidades en su hogar comprarse artefactos que no tenia, con su préstamo recién desembolsado podrá comprar mas ropa para vender  aprovechando  estas fechas donD. hay mucha venta  mas adelante quiere tener otro negocio que tenga que ver con el rubro D. comida o abarrotes  para eso esta trabajando y ahorrando. Carmen es la tesorera del grupo “ MUJERES DECIDIDAS E INDEPENDIENTES”  grupo formado por 8 socias vecinas del mismo lugar.

La Sra. Carmen esta con blusa celeste a cuadros tiene anteojos, es la ultima D. la fila.
texts.en:
Carmen has 3 children and is separated from her husband. Since her children are young, she has to work to give them a better quality of life. She remembers buying clothing for herself and her children in a market in their area shortly after starting work at Gamarra [the largest commercial center in Lima] making clothing. It was then that she noticed that what she paid for the clothing she bought was twice their original price. She also discovered that the clothing makers got the clothing for less. For this reason she decided to open a business selling clothing. She started buying from the merchants whom she knew, and they encouraged her to do it because of her charisma. As in all businesses, at the beginning it was difficult because she did not have capital. Knowing the business was very helpful because she invested the money from her first loan to purchase some garments such as polos, pants and blouses. Her business has given her much satisfaction, as for example she can have various comforts in her home, buying fixtures that she did not have. With this recent loan she will be able to purchase more clothing to sell, taking advantage of the dates where there are many sales. In the future she wants to have another business that has to do with the area of food or groceries. She is working and saving up for this. Carmen is the treasurer of the "Mujeres Decididas e Independientes" ["Resolute and Independent Women"] group, maD. up of 8 members who are neighbours in the same area. Carmen is in the blue checkered blouse and has glasses; she is the last in the line.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of winter clothing for sale

loans.name: Maximo Federico

texts.es:
El Sr. Máximo Vive en la ciudad de el Alto La Paz, en la zona de Villa Dolores, la casa donde vive es familiar herencia de los suegros, el cliente es casado con la señora Daría  Ambos son de origen Yungueño cuentan con terrenos donde se plantan coca esta es una hoja originaria de nuestros ancestros, pero mucha gente consume como calmante a algunos dolores, también para  aliviar la fatiga, muchos turistas lo consumen por los malestares que ocasiona la altura.
El Sr. Máximo y su esposa  son comerciantes de coca llevan con esta actividad mas de 20 años y cuentan con toda la documentación respectiva para comercializar su producto. El crédito será destinado para la compra de alcohol y cigarrillos que son complementos en la venta de coca ya que los mismos cuentan con dos puestos de venta fijos uno en la ciudad de la paz y otro en la ciudad de cobija, el Sr. Se encuentra en la fotografía junto a su esposa.
texts.en:
Máximo lives in the city of La Paz in the Villa Dolores area. The house where he lives was inherited from his mother and father-in-law. He is married to Daría. Both of them are from Yungueño, and they have some land where they plant coca. This leaf originated from our ancesters. But, many people consume it as a pain killer. It is also used to relieve fatigue. Many toursists use it for the ocasional discomfort from the altitude. Máximo and his wife are coca merchants, and they have been doing this for over 20 years. They have all of the documentation to sell their product. The loan will be to buy alcohol and cigarrettes, which compliment coca sales. They have two fixed sales locations. One is in the city of La Paz, and the other is in the city of Cobija. He can be seen in the photo with his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Renacimiento De Ceres Group

texts.es:
Santosa asume el cargo de presidenta de la alcancía comunal “RENACIMIENTO DE CERES” la cual está conformada por  7 socios, tiene 50 años de edad, es una mujer entusiasta y divertida, que lucha día a día para sacar adelante a su familia, casada, con 3 hijos adultos, su domicilio está ubicado en el Distrito de Ate, departamento de Lima.

Trabaja  con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad  desde hace 10 años. 

Santosa se dedica  a  la venta de especerías y verduras en un puesto en el mercado, desde hace 20 años, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de prendas de vestir y como el negocio no iba muy bien tuvo la necesidad de cambiar de giro de negocio, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha logrado construir su casa de material noble, el estudio de sus hijos en la universidad y la compra de un terreno para un nuevo mercado, su reciente préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería.

Santosa en el futuro anhela hacer una pequeña empresa de zapatos y ropa. (Niña en la foto hija de la socia).
texts.en:
Santosa is the president of the Renacimiento de Ceres (Rebirth of Beings) Village Bank, which is made up of 7 members. She is 50 years old, and is an enthusiastic and fun woman who works day to day to get her family ahead. She is married, has three adult children and lives in Distrito de Ate, in Lima. She has worked with EDAPROSPO – prosperity for 10 years. Santosa sells spices and vegetables in a market stand, she has done this for 20 years, before that she used to sell clothes but the business wasn't very good and she had to change the activity, with her daily effort she has been able to: build a house with strong materials, afford university studies for her children and buy a lot for a new market, she will use her most recent loan to buy merchandise. Santosa hopes to be able to start a small shoes and clothing business in the future. (The girl in the picture is Santosa's daughter).

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Vaidullo

texts.en:
Vaidullo M. has been in the cattle-raising business since 2006.  He's been able to support his family and his four grown children.  Vaidullo is requesting this loan in order to purchase cattle and increase his cattle inventory.  He is supported by his wife who works with him taking care of the cattle. His dream is to increase his current inventory and to improve his family's living standards.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle

loans.name: El Naranjo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “El Naranjo” se integra de 10 clientas. En él se encuentra la señora María de Jesús Guzmán R., la cual cuenta con 46 años de edad, y tiene 26 años en su negocio de colchas, pero el crédito lo quiere para comprar puerquitos e iniciar así el negocio que siempre había deseado, nos comenta que hace tiempo organizó una tanda con la cual construyó unas jaulas para poder criar a sus puercos, al conocer a la institución prefirió organizar a un grupo de señoras que como ella tenían la misma intención pero les hacía falta que alguien confiara en ellas. 

El nombre del grupo fue inspirado en un árbol frutal que caracteriza a la casa de la señora María De Jesús, la señora tiene 4 hijos, el menor de ellos es quien le ayuda a la crianza de puercos, su intención es que algún día con los créditos que la institución le otorga pueda apoyar a su hijo para que regrese a estudiar la preparatoria. Ella sueña en un futuro tener una granja y con ello tener una mejor calidad de vida, a pesar de sólo haber estudiado la primaria ella no quiere que la historia se repita con sus hijos y nietos, por eso desea apoyarlos para que tengan acceso a una educación superior, ya que ella de niña deseaba estudiar veterinaria, de ahí la inquietud por cuidar animales.
texts.en:
This group is called “El Naranjo” (The Orange Tree) and it has ten members.  María de Jesús Guzmán R., 46, is one of them and she has sold bedspreads for 26 years.  She wants the loan, however, to buy piglets to start a new business that she’s always wanted.  She comments that some time ago she organized a “tanda” (rotating credit associations formed upon a core of participants who agree to make regular contributions to a fund which is given in whole or in part to each contributor in rotation) with which she was able to build pens for her pigs but when she found out about the organization she preferred to form a group of women with the same goals as herself but who hadn’t been able to find someone who would trust them.
