The name of the group is inspired by a prominent fruit tree in María De Jesús’ house.  She has four children.  Her youngest child helps her raise the pigs.  Her intention is that with loans from the institution she will be able to send her son in the future to finish high school.

She dreams with having a farm in the future that will lead to a better quality of life despite completing only elementary school.  She hopes history will not repeat with her children and grandchildren and this is why she wants to help them have access to higher education since she wanted to be a veterinarian ever since she was a little girl; thus her desire to care for animals.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en: Ma. Luz L. is a 51-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: a general store and sugarcane farming. She lives in Hda. San Pablo, Brgy. San Pablo, Manapla, Negros Occidental. Ma. Luz has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and sugarcane farm, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Ma. Luz is borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell in her general store. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Ma. Luz hopes to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Superacion Group

texts.es: Doña Rosa P., es madre soltera, tiene veinticinco años D. edad, curso el sexto grado D. primaria, tiene 1 hija D. cinco años, ella se dedica a la confección D. Sudaderos, ya que cuenta con años D. experiencia porque desD. pequeña se dedicaba a esta actividad y con los ingresos, cubre sus gastos personales y la D. su hija, tomando en cuenta que sola ella es la encargada D. los gastos, porque no recibe ninguna ayuda económica del papá D. la niña. El próximo año su hija ingresaría a la escuela del paraje, por lo tanto se le estaría aumentando los gastos y ella sueña con un negocio granD. para salir adelante con su hija. Contando con entusiasmo, deseos D. superación y la ayuda D. una prima y vecinas organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un crédito. El Banco Comunal se denomina SUPERACIÓN, el nombré fue elegido por todas las integrantes, con el pensamiento D. que D. ellas depenD. la superación personal y familiar. El grupo cuenta con 11 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar; la crianza D. animales, elaboración D. utensilios D. cocina, tejido D. servilletas, confección D. prendas D. vestir y venta D. consumo diario.  El crédito ella lo utilizará para compra D. telas, y D. esa forma incrementar su Producción y así generar más ingresos. Ya que el sueño D. ella es que su negocio crezca, pero por falta D. capital no ha podido, y considera que con este crédito la ayudara aumentar su negocio y generara mas ingresos para su desarrollo personal y la D. su hija.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa P., age 20, is a single mother with a sixth graD. education. She has a five year old daughter and earns her living by manufacturing sweatshirts. Rosa has years of experience in this business because she has been working since she was a young girl. With the income she earns, she is able to cover her personal expenses and that of her daughter. Rosa is solely in charge of the expenses because she does not receive any financial support from the father of her daughter. Next year her daughter will enroll in school, so her expenses will increase. She dreams of having a large business so that her daughter can get ahead. With enthusiasm, the desire to succeed, and the help of a cousin and her neighbors, Rosa organized a group for the purpose of requesting a loan.

This Communal Bank is called “Superación” (To Overcome), a name that was selected by all of the members with the belief that they can overcome with inner personal strength and the support of their families. The group consists of eleven women who are engaged in different business activities such as raising animals, manufacturing cooking utensils, weaving napkins, making clothes, and selling daily consumer products. Rosa will use her loan to buy fabrics so that she can increase her production and generate more income. Her dream is to grow her business, but she lacks the capital to do so. She believes this loan will help her accomplish her goals, allowing her to achieve personal development and help her daughter grow.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy fabrics

loans.name: Said

texts.ar:
سعيد في عمر 51 سنة يعمل في ميكانيك السيارات متزوج وله 3 اولاد يحب عائلته واولاده يعمل على                             
تأمين العيش الكريم لهم فهو يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء بضائع للمحل وتكبير العمل                         
سعيد نشيط ويحب عمله فهو طموح يريد زيادة الانتاج في محله وتحسين وضع عائلته المادي له خبرة واسعة في مجال عمله                 
وله زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه يريد بناء عائلته على اسسس مالية سليمة ومتينة
texts.en: Said is a 51-year-old husband and father of three who loves his family very much and is trying to secure a dignified life for them. He is applying for a loan from A. Majmoua to purchase equipment to expand his auto mechanic business which is patronized by customers hailing from his neighbors and colleagues. Said is highly experienced and very passionate about his work and is driven to increase productivity so that he can put his family on firmer financiA. footing.

loans.use: Purchase equipment to expand business.

loans.name: Rosa Alba

texts.es:
Doña Rosa está dedicada a la compra y venta D. cerdos, vive con sus tres hijos D. 15, 11, 22 años D. edad, residen en San Rafael Oriente, departamento D. San Miguel, este negocio fue por iniciativa propia desD. hace 5 años, ella compra los cerdos, los alimenta y los venD. en el tiangue (mercado D. animales) D. El Transito, al momento no ha tenido dificultades con el negocio.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. cerdos ya que quiere aumentar el número D. animales en la granja, ir creciendo poco a poco dentro del mercado. Su objetivo es estabilizar el negocio por largo tiempo, contar con ingresos D. una forma segura para ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Rosa is a pig merchant.  She lives with her three children who are 15, 11 and 22 years of age in San Rafael Oriente, San Miguel department.  She started the business on her own initiative five years ago.  She buys pigs, feeds them and then sells them at the livestock fair in El Transito.  To date, she’s had no problems with the business.

She is asking for funds to buy pigs because she wants to increase the number of animals in her farm and gradually grow in the market.  Her goal is to stabilize the business in the long run to be able to count on a sure source of income to help pay for her children's schooling.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Duo Solidario Genesareth Group

texts.es:
G.S. GENEZARETH

FLORIDALMA P. U.. tiene 36 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de paca, desde hace dos años, ella dice que quiere su credito para poder comprar otra paca porque hay mucha gente que en esta epoca no tiene dinero para comprar ropa nueva, y es por esa razon que compra ropa usada.

SILVIA AZUCENA P. U.
tiene 32 años de edad tiene 4 hijos, ella vive sola con sus hijos se dedica a la venta de refacciones por las tardes y al mesdio dia vende tortillas en su casa, ella dice que su credito lo necesita para poder  Comprar más productos para elavorar comida y vender mas comidas elavoradas. en su tortilleria, y asi tener más clientes.
texts.en:
Genezareth Solidarity Group

Floridalma P. U. is 36 years old.  She has been selling bundles of clothes for two years.  She says that she would like a loan so that she can buy another bundle because there are a lot of people at this time who don't have money to buy new clothes.  For that reason, they buy used clothing.

Silvia Azucena P. U. is 32 years old.  She has 4 children and lives alone with her children.  She sells spare parts in the afternoons and at midday she sells tortillas from her home.  She says that she needs this loan so that she can buy more products for making meals and selling more prepared meals in her tortilla bakery so that she can attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy used clothes and to buy ingredients for preparing meals

loans.name: Juventud Activa Group

texts.es:
Este Comité de Jovenes se formó gracias a Liz Paola B. Mareco, que vive en la cuidad de Potrero Melgarejo Loma. Encantados aceptaron conformar el Comité de Jóvenes nombrando al Comité  Juventud Activa.
 
      Las integrantes del comité se dedican  a la venta de productos avon, ventas de ropas interiores, ropas de vestir, capataz,  etc. a la par de estas actividades están estudiando también la mayoría están cursando el último año del nivel medio. 
La presidenta del grupo es Liz, una joven emprendedora y que desea comenzar con un negocio de venta ropas. 
Comenta que quiere comenzar con una pequeña cantidad e ir aumentando a medida que consiga clientes. 
Para comenzar con las compras de ropas de la temporada entre remeras, vestidos, shorts y otros.

Todos agradecen por la oportunidad que ofrece la Fundación ya con esto aprenderán mucho como el trabajo en grupo, responsabilidad y lo más importante iniciar un trabajo que les puede ayudar en el futuro.
texts.en:
This Young People's Committee was founded thanks to Liz Paola B. Mareco who lives in the town of Potrero Melgarejo Loma.  The members were delighted to set up their Young People's Committee and named it 'Comité Juventud Activa' (Active Youth Commitee).

Between them, the members of this committee sell Avon products, underwear, clothes, etc.  As well as carrying out their business activities, these young people are also studying.  Most of them are in the final year of their intermediate studies.

Liz is the group's president.  She is an enterprising young woman who would like to start a business selling clothes.  She says that she would like to start with a small quantity of clothes and increase her stock as she gains customers.  She will start by selling seasonal clothes such as t-shirts, dresses, shorts, etc.

All of the members of the group are grateful for the opportunity that they are being given by Fundación Paraguaya since they will learn a lot such as how to work as a team, responsibility and, most importantly, how to start a business that can help them in the future.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, shorts, dresses, tops, etc.

loans.name: Carmen Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Cristina P. G. tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, 2 estan casados y los otros 2 son solteros, que tienen 24 y 20 años de edad, ellos le ayudan a su pdre en eun taller de vulcanizadora y llantas, su esposo de Crsitina se llama Irineo el tien 50 años de edad.
Carmen tiene la finalidad de obtener un credito economico, para invertir en la coompra de mas mercancia en su negocio de ropa, con el cual lleva poco mas de 3 años, iniciandolo por necesidad y para aportar recurso al gasto familiar, ella nos comenta que el negocio de la ropa es buena opcion de trabajo sabiendolo manejar, ya que actualmente hay mucha competencia y cada dia se renueva los modelos y diseños de ropa, a ella no se le es dificil solventar su credito, porque todos los dias tiene trabajo que realizar, su venta la hace de manera ambulante, lo que a veces le hace un poco dificil su recorrido, ella no cuenta con establecimiento propio donde pueda ofrecer de manera fija sus productos, es por eso que tiene que ambular de un lugar a otro.
A los retos que se ha tenido que enfrentar Carmen es a su problema visual pero su padecimiento no le impide trabajar y salir adelante con sus proyectos.
El proyecto mas grande que tiene la señora Carmen es etablecer de manera permanete y solida su venta de ropa en un lugar adecuado donde ella no tenga que caminar o trazladar su ,mercancia de un lugar a otro, espera gozar de buena salud, que no le falten las ganas y el animo para seguir trabajando.
agradece bastante a los que oaporten un granito de arena en el financiamiento de su credito,a fundacion relidad gracias y a kiva por ser la organizacion que apoya los proyectos de los que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Carmen Cristina P. G. is 46 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Two of them are married. The other two are single and they are 24 and 20 years old. They help their father in his tire repair shop. Her husband’s name is Irineo and he is 50 years old. 

Carmen’s goal is to obtain a loan to buy more merchandise for her business selling clothing. She has had this business for a little over 3 years. She started it out of necessity and to contribute for the family expenses. She has commented to us that the clothing business is a good option if one knows how to run it. There is a lot of competition and she updates styles and clothing designs every day. For her it is not difficult to repay her loan because she has work every day. She makes her sales as a street vendor, and sometimes her route is a little difficult. She doesn’t have a fixed place of her own where she can offer her products, and that is why she has to move from one place to another.

Among the challenges that Carmen faces is her vision, however her problem doesn’t keep her from working and making progress in her projects.

Carmen’s  biggest project is to establish her clothing business permanently in an adequate space where she won’t have to walk or carry around her merchandise. She hopes for good health—she doesn’t lack for desire and motivation to continue working. 

She is grateful to those who can provide even a grain of sand to help finance her loan, and to the Foundation, and to Kiva for supporting the projects of those who are in need.

loans.use: To buy women’s, men’s, children’s, and infant’s pants, shirts, T-shirts, shorts, blouses, socks, and underwear

loans.name: Lorenzo Jose

texts.es: Lorenzo tiene 45 años de edad, casado, originario de la ciudad de Totonicapán, docente y así mismo talabartero cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa francisca y así también con el cariño de su hija y de su hijo , el esta tramitando  su cuarto préstamo ya que es una persona cumplida y que se ha encontrado solvente en sus pagos anteriores en Asociación ASDIR, con esta ayuda el  desea comprar los útiles escolares para sus hijos , ya que el desea que los niños tengan una buena educación tanto personal como profesionalmente.
texts.en: Lorenzo is 45 years old, married and originally from the city of Totonicapan. He is a teacher and a belt-maker. He has his wife Francisca's support and love from his daughter and son. He is on his fourth loan and being a very honest person he has successfully repaid all the previous loans to Asociacion ASDIR (Kiva Field Partner). This loan will be used to purchase school supplies for his children, wanting them to have a good education, both personally and professionally speaking.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase urea, fertilizers, and plant nutrients

loans.name: Narine

texts.en: Narine A. is from the village of Kamo in the Shirak region of Armenia. She is married, with a six year old daughter. Narine has a high school education. She considers herself a hard-working, kind person. She has been engaged as an agricultural entrepreneur for the past five years, and is looking for a loan to purchase livestock. With this investment, she expects the family income to increase by 25 percent. Narine’s dream is to save enough money to purchase a new family house. She enjoys living in Kamo and is surrounded by many relatives and friends.

loans.use: To buy livestock.

loans.name: Isabelle

texts.en:
Isabelle is 25 years old with 2 children and a husband who works in customs. For four years the family has lived in Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital.
Having been educated through secondary school, Isabelle has been in retail for a year. This is her second loan with ALIDe following successful repayment of her first. With this loan she will purchase wholesale cassava and beans for resale.

Isabelle's dream is to save enough to build her own house and use it to provide rent income to her family.

loans.use: Purchasing cassava and beans for sale

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy D. is from the village of Bal-ason, Gingoog City. She is 35 years old. Joy is separated from her spouse and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Joy owns & operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making  & selling brooms to local businesses and community members. Joy has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Joy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. Joy is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional brooms. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Joy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional brooms.

loans.name: Luis Alcides

texts.es:
Luis tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Reside en casa de sus padres, quienes son comerciantes, en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, (JLO) una zona urbana y recién formada hace 6 años. Su comunidad está en vías de crecimiento. Ahora, cuenta con los servicios básicos de agua potable y luz eléctrica. 

Luis se dedica a la venta de periódicos, revistas y artículos de librería. Tiene más de 8 años de experiencia en esta actividad. Realiza las ventas de los artículos de librería en su vivienda y reparte los periódicos y revistas a domicilios y empresas en toda la zona de JLO. Ahora que la temporada escolar ha comenzado en Perú, Luis desea invertir su préstamo en la compra de un lote de artículos de librería por ejemplo cuadernos, libros, papelotes, láminas, etc para vender a sus clientes. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo la librería en su vivienda y tener un gran nivel de inventarios. Luis es un cliente recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado otros préstamos que invirtió en su negocio y los canceló de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Luis is 25 years old, single and doesn't have any children. He lives with his parents, who are merchants, in the district of Jose Leonardo Ortiz (JLO), an urban zone formed 6 years ago. His community is on a path of growth and now has basic services like drinking water and electricity. 

Luis sells newspapers, magazines and other book supplies. He has more than 8 years of experience doing this. He sells bookstore items from his home and delivers magazines and newspapers to houses and businesses all over the JLO zone. Now that the school season has begun in Peru, Luis wants to invest his loan in buying a bundle of items like notebooks, books, paper, educational materials, etc to sell to his customers. 

His greatest desire is to continue growing the bookstore in his home and to have a large selection of inventory. Luis is a recurring client with Edpyme Alternativa.  He has managed other loans that he invested in his business and paid them back on time.

loans.use: to buy more school supplies to sell at his bookstore

loans.name: Galina's Group

texts.en:
Galina J. leads this three-person loan group and lives in Nookat, a town in the Osh region. She is married and has two sons, one of whom breeds cattle for a living while the other is busy completing his schooling. Galina has made a living as a nurse since 1983 and earns 500 soms a month. Recently she bought some land and began building a house on it for her sons to live in. She is applying for this loan to buy building materials for the house, which she hopes will soon be ready for her sons to move into.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy building materials for a new house

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn B. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 37 years old. Evelyn is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a business venture making and selling snacks & other delicacies like sandwiches, cheese & rice cakes in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed like rice, milk & sugar. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients like rice, milk & sugar

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en:
Ms.Otgonjargal is a 27-year-old, single woman. She lives with her son in a one-bedroom apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son is 4 years old. Otganjargal’s parents look after her son, giving Otgonjargal a chance to work and earn money. She has a boyfriend who works in Korea at the moment.

Otgonjargal worked at a factory in South Korea on a labor exchange contract for three years. When she came back from Korea, she started running a clothing retail business. She rents a stall at the Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar city. 

She buys her products from wholesalers who import them from abroad. The rent price for the stall is quite high and its costly for her business. Therefore she decided to buy a stall at the Narantuul market, making an investment in her business. The loan she is taking will be used to buy a permanent stall at the market and to sell her products to clients.

loans.use: to buy a permanent stall at the market and to use it for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Osita

texts.en:
Osita is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Osita has a shop that sells coconut wine, snacks & firewood. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional snacks, coconut wine & firewood.

Osita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Osita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional snacks, coconut wine & firewood

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This is 36 year-old Business man.  He is married and has 5 children aged 16,13, 9, 6 and 4. In 2001, he established his DVD and VCD cassettes and DVD players business. 

He began his business because he wants to make himself self-reliant. It is his only source of income. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 10,240,000 every month from this business. He now requires a loan of Le 5,000,000. Le2,000,000 is for buying DVDs and VCDs and Le3,000,000 is for buying a DVD player and laptop.

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, he plans to establish a bigger and more modern electronic shop, to build more houses and become an international business man. He also plans to educate his children and send them abroad. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more video cassettes for rental

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 36 year old single lady. Lucia is in the hawking business in Mikindani, Mombasa. Lucia’s business has been in operation for the last ten years. 

Lucia has been a KADET client and this marks her third borrowing to finance her business. With this loan she plans to purchase combs, face towels, basins, scissors, buckets and saucepans for her business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to benefit her family. Lucia's dream is to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase combs, face towels, basins, scissors, buckets and saucepans for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 51 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cosméticos como perfumes, lápiz labiales, cremas y polvos, ella vende en forma independiente llevando a diferentes lugares como instituciones y al publico general, la socia quiere ampliar le negocio de venta de productos de belleza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cosméticos como perfumes, lapiz labial y cremas.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Amauta” communal bank that’s located in Cusco District that belongs to Cusco Province and Department.

She is 51 years old, married and has two children.  She alternates her daily chores with cosmetics sales.  She sells perfume, lipstick, cream and powder.  She sells independently going to various places like institutions and to the general public.  She wants to expand the beauty products sales business and is asking for a loan to buy cosmetics like perfume, lipsticks and creams.

She is happy with the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.en:
Cipriana is 63 years old and married with three children. Her husband is a fisherman.

Cipriana is a rice retailer. She buys directly from farmers and sells rice to the people in her community. Cipriana is also a seaweed farmer. She is able to provide for her family through her earnings.

Cipriana is requesting a loan to buy more rice to sell. She hopes for her business to grow. She also desires for her children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar works hard to support her family. Pilar is single and has a motorcycle-for-rent business in the Philippines.

Pilar requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her motorcycle.

Pilar has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Pilar would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her motorcycle

loans.name: Eric

texts.es:
Eric  de 51 años de edad se dedica a la venta de alimentos como hayacas pasteles y deliciosas y nutritivas sopas, en un mercado doméstico conformado por sus vecinos, particulares provenientes de otros barrios y gremios que ya lo reconocen. Su negocio inició hace 20 años cuando su suegra le propuso unir su buena sazón al cocinar, con el capital de Eric, que  en ese momento trabajaba en una empresa importante de Barranquilla. Así inició su negocio compartiendo utilidades con su suegra y vendiendo hayacas, pasteles, chichas, bolis y productos derivados de la harina de trigo como deditos de queso, empanaditas etc. Desde el año pasado su suegra falleció y él ha continuado trabajando con su familia paterna. Hoy Eric tiene muchos clientes en diferentes gremios, trabaja solo los fines de semas y festivos,  para la producción posee todo el menaje necesario para hacer crecer su negocio. Eric vive con su madre y hermanas, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo y un legado de sazón que le dejó su suegra para continuar generando ingresos para el bienestar de sus hijos. Así mismo genera otros ingresos complementarios,  pues presta sus servicios como cobrador en una cooperativa. En la actualidad se propone continuar fortaleciendo su capital de trabajo y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará harina, aceite,en mayor volumen y reemplazará enseres que se encuentran en deterioro; su inversión será exitosa porque incrementará sus ventas, pues con ella se prepara para atender la demanda de un gremio de taxistas ubicados en un centro comercial muy reconocido. Mientras Eric trabaja para lograr sus sueños familiares como el de tener una vivienda propia para sus hijos y dejarle a ellos estabilizado el legado de su suegra, maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor a 37% un margen de contribución del 62,8%, desde el cual planea la expansión de su negocio. 
.
texts.en:
Eric is 51 years old and sells food like hayacas, cakes, and delicious and nutritious soups, in a domestic market formed of neighbors, individuals from other districts, and unions that recognize it.  His business began 20 years ago when his mother-in-law proposed that they unite her good sense for cooking with his capital, since he was working for a major company in Barranquilla at the time.  So he started his business sharing profits with his mother-in-law, selling hayacas, cakes, chichas, treats, and products derived from wheat flour like cheese sticks and empanadas.  His mother-in-law passed away last year and he has continued working with the paternal family.  

Today Eric has many customers from different unions.  He works only on weekends and holidays.  For the production he has all the necessary utensils to grow the business.  Eric lives with his mother and sisters and has 2 children in his care.  He also has the legacy of good cooking sense that his mother-in-law left him to continue generating income for the well being of his children.  He also generates additional income by serving as collector of a cooperative.  

Now he wants to continue to strengthen his working capital and this is the reason he requests the loan.  This is his first finance with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and he will use it to buy flour and oil in greater volume and replace household goods that are deteriorating.  His investment will be successful because it will increase his sales, as he will now be able to meet the demands of a union of taxi drivers located in a well-known shopping mall.  While Eric works to achieve his dreams for the family, like owning a house for his children and leaving them stabilized with his mother-in-law’s legacy, he manages a return on sales not less than 37% and a contribution margin of 62.8%, from which he plans to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy flour and oil in greater volume and replace household goods that are deteriorating.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Emelda has a retail shop that sells motor oil, fuel, kerosene & gasoline per liter. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy gallons of gasoline & fuel to sell.

Emelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Emelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy gallons of gasoline & fuel to sell.

loans.name: Ana Julieta

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de sorbetes, vive con sus hijos, todos trabajan, el negocio lo inicio hace 2 años y ha sido un negocio rentable, cuenta con clientes quienes la prefieren por la calidad de sus productos.
Actualmente quiere comprar sorbetes, de varios sabores y paletas, esta compra le ayudara para ofrecer a los clientes diversidad de sabores para mantener siempre su preferencia.
Su aspiración es crecer en el negocio, ya que sus ingresos dependen únicamente del volumen de ventas que obtenga a diario.
texts.en:
Ana works selling sorbets.  She lives with her children, and they all work.  She began her business two years ago and it has been a profitable business.  She has customers who choose her for the quality of her products.

She currently wants to purchase sorbets in various flavors and tastes.  This purchase will help her to offer her customers a variety of flavors so that they will always find what they prefer.

Her aspiration is to grow her business, as her income depends solely on her daily sales volume.

loans.use: to buy sorbets in various flavors and tastes.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao, 44 years old, is doing farming and earns $3 per day. Her husband is also a farmer and earns $3 per day. They have five children, four are studying and one more is a farmer and earns $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $60 on food, $15 on electricity, $60 on school fees, and $30 on transportation.

She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy cell cards from the mobile phone company to resell so that she can make some profit from it. She plans to sell grocery goods in front of her house after she rests from doing farming. She hopes to be able to send her children to study in the university after they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy cell cards from the mobile phone company to resell

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with seven children.

Virgilio has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. He has had this business for four years. He requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

Virgilio has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Virgilio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Lydia provides manicure and pedicure services. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy materials needed for pedicures and manicures. Lydia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lydia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for pedicures and manicures

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 28 years old farmer who raises and sells seasonal fruits and vegetables.  He is IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He has four years of experience in farming. 

Ali also works in construction as a laborer during the winter season.   He is married and has three children.  Ali's monthly income from farming is about 250 AZN. 

Ali's wife helps him run the business.  Being their main source of income, Ali is seeking financial support.  For this purpose, he applied for a 1000 AZN loan.  This will be his second loan and he has a positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and organic fertilizers

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
Mostafa is a 27-year-old Lebanese engaged man. He has owned a small shop since 2009, and his job consists of repairing electricA. generators. It wasn’t that hard starting his business alone since he had already seven years of experience working in the same occupation. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase mechanicA. tools and a range of spare parts. He plans to serve more customers in order to gain superior income and therefore, save enough money to be able to get married soon. In the future, he plans to open his own repairing shop.

loans.use: to purchase mechanical tools and a range of spare parts.

loans.name: San Juana

texts.es:
La señora San Juana y su esposo están esperando la llegada de su primer hijo. Solicitan un préstamo para pagar la clínica donde nacerá su bebe, y estar preparados para cualquier emergencia que se pueda presentar. También les esta haciendo falta algunos productos y accesoria para la llegado del bebe. 
Doña San Juana se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en diferentes partes de la ciudad y su esposo es empleado de una fábrica.
texts.en:
San Juana and her husband are awaiting the arrival of their first child. They are requesting a loan to pay the clinic where their baby will be born, and to be prepared for any emergency that may arise. They also need some products and accessories for the baby's arrival. 

San Juana works selling used clothing in different parts of the city, and her husband is an employee in a factory.

loans.use: pay medical expenses for childbirth.

loans.name: Sam Orn

texts.en:
Som Orn, 47, is married and has four children, one of whom is still in school. Her main source of family income is from rice and cassava farming; she also supplements her income by raising pigs and catching fish to sell. She now earns less than 5 U.S. dollars a day to feed her family.

Som is requesting her first loan from VisionFund. She will use this 250 U.S.-dollar loan to buy cassava seedlings to enlarge her cassava plantation. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow more cassava so as to earn additional income to create a better life. She also hopes to set aside some savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy cassava seedlings to enlarge her cassava plantation.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Druscillah Moraa

texts.en: Druscillah is a 35-year-old married woman. She has 3 children between the ages of 9 and 11. She describes herself as a courageous woman. She operates a retail shop where she sells home products such as bread, salt, cooking oil, and detergent. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located at a strategic and competitive place. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stocks of home products. Her goal is to expand the business to create job opportunities for people within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her retail store.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es:
La Sra. Ignacia tiene 42 años de edad, es una señora que trabaja mucho, está casada con el Sr. Juan hace 25 años, tienen una hija que se llama Alexandra, viven en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo hace mas de 10 años.
La señora Ignacia tiene una despensa y su marido es herrero hace 15 años.Comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado porque ella trabaja en la despensa para hacerle estudiar a su hija, todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta muy entrada la noche.
Ella junto a su marido se esfuerzan al máximo para poder darle todo lo mejor a su hija, y de esa forma poder mantener la casa y el negocio. Su sueño es comprar más congeladoras para poner en su despensa y de esa forma poder tener más espacio para poder congelar.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de harina, azucar, galleta, leche y demás artículos de primera necesidad, con las cuales podrá seguir ofreciendo más variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Ignacia is 42 years of age.  She is a lady that works a lot.  She was married to Señor Juan 25 years ago.  They have a daughter who is called Alexandra.  They have lived in the city of Colonel Oviedo for more than 10 years.  
Señora Ignacia has a pantry and her husband has been a blacksmith for 15 years.  She tells us that her work is very difficult because she works in the pantry every day from very early in the morning until late into the night, so that her daughter can study.  She and her husband strive to the maximum to be able to give all the best to their daughter, and in that way to be able to maintain the house and the business.  Their dream is to buy more freezers to put in her pantry and in that way to be able to have more space for frozen goods.  She requests the loan for the purchase of flour, sugar, cookies, milk and other consumer staples, with which she will be able to continue offering more variety to her clients.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cookies, milk and other supplies.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 49-year-old married woman. She has two children, age 18 and 20 years. She describes herself as social. 

She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a viable area. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate funds for improving the clothes retail store. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more skirts and blouses. Rose's business goal is to be a wholesale supplier of clothes within five years.

loans.use: To buy more skirts and blouses.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda, who is 54 and a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Raniel, a laborer, and is the mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Yolanda runs an “ukay-ukay” business. “Ukay” literally means to “dig out” or “hollow out” from a stack or heap of anything. In Yolanda’s case, she is selling used (but not yet worn out) clothes that are usually stacked up on a table or mat. Some special kinds are displayed on hangers. In the Philippines, especially in urban poor communities, many people resort to buying used clothes from “ukay-ukay” stalls. These are much cheaper compared with brand new clothes sold in malls. Since Yolanda’s stall is located in an urban poor public market, her business flourishes. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) net sales every day. 

To help her expand the business, Yolanda is requesting a PHP10,000 loan to buy additional used-but-quality clothes. Customers are attracted to buy from an “ukay-ukay” stall with lots of clothes to choose from. She plans to add more pants or jeans, and also used bags and footwear. If she can roll the profits from this loan, she can meet the customers’ demand. Through proper management of capital and profit, she can expand her business and boost its income.

Yolanda hopes to to give her children a good future and a high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of used clothes needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock.

loans.name: Margarita Reyna

texts.en:
For 5 years I have sold clothing for men, women and children, and I have a loyal clientel, I sell in offices, and by contract for neighbors. The saint-week will be coming and I need to stock my summer clothing to satisfy my customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Desde hace cinco años me dedico a la venta de ropa para varon, mujer y niño, ya tengo mi clientela fija, vendo en oficinas, y vecinos por encargos. Ahora que viene la semana santa necesito surtir la ropa de verano para satisfacer a mis clientes.

loans.use: To purchase blouses, skirts, summer clothing and other items.

loans.name: Pili

texts.en: Pili S. lives in the Yombo area in Dar es Salaam and is married with three children. Pili sells non-alcoholic beverages. Her stock supply ran out after Easter, when sales were great. She would like to replenish the stock and rent another premise (new outlet) to increase sales. To fulfill her plan, she needs funding of $750.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ey

texts.en: Mrs. Ey L. is 42 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She stays at home and cooks meals for the entire family. Her husband works as a driver for a private company and also runs a small booth in his area charging vehicle batteries.  With these two jobs he contributes approximately $4.5 each day towards covering the family's expenses. Two of the couple’s children are welders, while the other two are still at school. Currently, her husband needs to repair his car and leftover money from the loan will be used to purchase some tools for his business. In the future, he would like to make enough money to expand his business and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To repair a car and purchase tools for his business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
"I have a business selling new and used clothing in my home, and my sales are very good, but I would like to invest a bit more since my customers ask for things which I have not been able to buy, due to the fact that they are too expensive. I am requesting $1200 to invest in my business."

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

“Tengo una venta de ropa nueva y usada en mi casa y mis ventas son muy buenas, pero me gustaría invertir un poco más ya que mis clientes me piden cosas que no he podido comprar debido a que me cuestan más caras”. Solicito 1,200.00 dlls para invertirle a mi negocio

loans.use: To invest in my business

loans.name: Ayao

texts.fr:
26 years old, Mr. Ayao A. was born in Togblé in the prefecture of Golfe. Married with two (02) children in his care, he ended his studies in the third class (equivalent to 9th grade) due to a lack of finances. He did not even get the chance to learn an occupation, and began very early, with his friends, in the extraction, washing, and sale of gravel. It is this activity which allows him to meet the needs of his small family. However, this business requires significant financial means. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of $1000. This loan will allow him to obtain the material and human resources for the large-scale extraction of gravel, a construction material which is much desired by the construction industry.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 26 ans, Monsieur Ayao A. est né à Togblé dans la préfecture du Golfe. Marié avec deux (02) enfants à charge, il arrêta ses études en classe de 3ème faute de moyens financiers. Il n’a même pas eu la chance d’apprendre un métier et s’est très tôt engage, avec des amis, dans l’extraction, le lavage et la vente de graviers. C’est cette activité qui lui a permit de faire face aux besoins de sa petite famille. Cependant, cette activité nécessite beaucoup de moyens financiers. Pour cela, il sollicite un crédit de $1000. Cet financement va lui permettre d’avoir les moyens matériels et humains nécessaires pour l’extraction à grande échelle du gravier, un matériau de construction très recherchés par les entreprises de construction.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Mrs. Christiana E. is 42 years old, married with 9 children, and lives in Benin City, She sells bush meat. She learned the business from her mother.

Mrs. E. requests a loan of $450 to buy more bush meat. She has been a LAPO client for 7years, and she thanks you.

loans.use: Buy more bush meat to sell

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti R. is a 31 years old woman who has a small shop from which she sells snacks, household goods, vegetables, cigarettes, rice and many other things. She can earn US$44.50 per day, due to the amount and variety of goods she has in stock. Siti R. requests a IDR 900,000 loan to fill her shop with more inventory. Her husband, Dahlan, has no regular income, so she has to work hard for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her shop with more inventory

loans.name: Ida

texts.en: Ida, 28, is the mother of 2 children. She sells household necessities on credit such as powder, soap, toothpaste, shampoo, etc., door-to-door around the villages. From this business she can earn up to $7 a week. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of $75 to expand her business. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: to expand her little household necessities sales

loans.name: Ky

texts.en: Ky H., 40, is married with seven children and owns a plot of land for growing yams.  She normally earns around $3 a day. Her husband is a construction laborer and also helps Ky to grow yams when he has free time.  He typically earns about $4 a day. Two of their children, one elder brother and younger daughter, work in a garment factory earning $70 each a month.  They have been so successful selling yams that they now want to borrow $500 to rent another plot of land.

loans.use: To rent more farmland for growing yams.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a single mother who supports her family with a small clothing sales business. Her business is located at one of the markets in the city of Kahovka in south central Ukraine. In business for a year, she sells an attractive variety of women’s clothing. Elena currently makes about $200 in profit each month. She has two children – a son who is eighteen and a daughter who is fourteen.

Elena has requested a short term loan of $500 to help purchase new clothing inventory. With the change of seasons, it is important for clothing vendors like Elena to update their inventories for spring and summer. This loan will give Elena necessary capital to buy new clothing items that will sell well and allow her to earn a good income.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her clothing store

loans.name: Todia

texts.fr:
Todia M., age 31, is married and has three children to care for. She has been a member of the village bank of Kounkané Viviane Wade in the Kolda region for five and a half years. She wants to buy peanuts to make peanut butter, to get supplies to make beignets (a kind of doughnut), and to sell sugar, cookies, batteries, cigarettes, etc., at the retail level. Her income enables her to contribute to her family's well-being. Todia wishes to strengthen her business. She is applying for a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Todia M., 31 ans, mariée, 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Kounkané Viviane Wade dans la région de Kolda depuis 5 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter de l' arachide pour faire de la pâte d’arachide et s’approvisionner pour faire des beignets et vendre au détail du sucre, des biscuits, des batteries, des cigarettes etc .Ses revenus lui permettent de contribuer au bien être familial. Todia souhaite renforcer son activité. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy sacks of peanuts and various goods, such as sugar, cookies, batteries, and cigarettes

loans.name: Julia Mercedes

texts.es:
Julia is 38 years old and married to Juan Carlos. They live in the district of Manuel Arevalo, in the province of Trujillo. They have 4 children who attend school and depend on them. Two years ago she began a business selling sweets in a kiosk close to an education center in the district. But feeling that she was spending too much time away from her home, she decided to change her business and now she sells clothing from her home. She also makes and sells chocolates to shops, and by request to her friends.

With her first loan she invested in clothing to sell to friends and family. She is a member of the communal bank called Santa Elena II. With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase diverse merchandise such as lingerie, and jackets which are requested in the colder months, as well as the ingredients she needs to make her chocolates. Julia hopes to improve her health, as she has had serious health issues, so that she is able to continue to work and improve the quality of life for her family.

La señora Julia tiene 38 años de edad, casada con Juan Carlos Yontop, vive en el Distrito de Manuel Arévalo - Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad; curso estudios secundarios completos, tiene 04 hijos, los cuales aun dependen del hogar, éstos están cursando estudios primarios y secundarios. Se inicio hace 02 años en la venta de golosinas en un quiosco cerca a un centro educativo del distrito, pero al sentir que su hogar estaba siendo descuidado decide cambiar de negocio y en la actualidad se dedica a la venta de ropa por campañas y estaciones variando así lo mercadería. También prepara y vende chocolates a tiendas y por pedidos de amigos y familiares. Con Manuela Ramos empezó como ahorrista, luego le fue otorgado su primer préstamo de S/. 100, los invirtió en la compra de ropa interior y venta a familiares y amigos. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Elena II ” Con el reciente préstamo de S/. 800.00, el cual cancelara en 4 meses y será invertido en la compra de mercadería diversas como: ropa interior y chompas que es lo más pedido por invierno y también comprara insumos para la preparación de sus chocotejas. Ella aspira mejorar en su salud, esta pasando por un gran problema y desea mejorar para así poder trabajar y seguir sacando adelante a sus hijos conjuntamente con su esposo.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE FOR HER CLOTHING BUSINESS, AS WELL AS INGREDIENTS NEEDED TO MAKE THE CHOCOLATES SHE PREPARES AND SELLS.

loans.name: Dinh Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dinh Thi B. joined the TYM Fund since 1994. Before becoming a member of the Fund, her family worked on the rice field and raised the pigs. Then, she borrowed 20 USD to buy a pig. When she was done repaying for the first time, she had 2 farrows of pigs, profited 80 USD. Later, she continued to borrow money from the Fund to raise animals like pigs, chickens and ducks. The raising activity brought her lots of profit. As a result, her family economy became stable. She was able to furnish her house. She has 3 children, who are all grown up, working and having stable incomes. They send money for them every month. This time, she wants to borrow 1025 USD to expand her raising area. Her family average income is 400 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Trước khi tham gia Quỹ, gia đình chị làm ruộng và chăn nuôi lợn, mong muốn mua được 1 con lợn nái để gây giống . Năm 1994 chị Đinh Thị B. tham gia Quỹ, mức vốn đầu tiên gia đình chị vay 300.000 đồng mua 1 con lợn nái sau khi vòng vốn hoàn thành cũng là lúc gia đình chị thu 2 lứa lợn bột lãi 1.000.000 đ, các năm tiếp theo chị tiếp tục vay vốn từ Quỹ chủ yếu phục vụ chăn nuôi như lợn, gà, vịt và đều cho lãi cao vì thế thu nhập của gia đình ngày càng ổn định hơn. Gia đình đã xây thêm được công trình phụ, mua sắm được nhiều trang thiết bị trong gia đình, chị có 3 người con hiện các con chị đều đã đi làm và có thu nhâp đều đặn. Hàng tháng đều hỗ trợ thêm cho bố mẹ. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 17.000.000đ, tiếp tục mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi lợn, gà, vịt. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình. 6.000.000đ/tháng

loans.use: expand raising project

loans.name: Him

texts.en: Mrs. Him S. is 35 years old and the mother o five children, three of whom are attending school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is on the right of the photo.  Mrs. Him S. sells rice soup as a breakfast food in Kampong Os Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Aside from this business, she is a teacher receives only a small salary per month. Her husband, Mr. Siyath Men, is a village chief and he also is a fish farmer. His breeding fish business is going well, so Mrs. Him S. requests a loan to buy more fish for breeding and more fish food.

loans.use: To buy more fish for breeding and more fish food.

loans.name: Mbabazande, Luwayo Group

texts.en: Mariam M. was a farmer, while still with her husband, before she joined the retail shop business a year ago. She is now divorced and because she was sent away from her marital home, she had no land to farm anymore and hence opened up a shop. This is her first time with the group, and she is determined to make ends meet since she has been taught every skill concerning lending and loan repayments. She has 7 children, but their father is paying for 4 of them while she still cares for 3 primary school-going children. She has been able to include almost all that is needed in her shop, only in small quantities, and would like to increase the quantity of sugar, maize flour, and soap, plus a few other commodities. She has no dream of changing her business right now but only of making it better.

loans.use: Mariam would like to increase the quantity of sugar, maize flour, and soap, plus a few other commodities.

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en: Sevda (her father is pictured) lives in Khachmaz town. She is married and has one child. Sevda has been farming for three years. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy seedlings for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy seedlings

loans.name: Thai

texts.en:
Thai P., who is 47 years old, is a widow and lives with her parents in the Prey veng province of Cambodia. Thai P. started a livestock raising pigs in 2004. Usually, she buys pig from other breeders and starts raising them.
 After six to seven month her pigs will grow enough such that she can sell them to others in her area. 

Recently, P. has applied a loan from KIVA to purchase more pigs to breed.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to breed

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 32 años, en la actualidad vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Atiende todas las tardes en su puesto de ropa, sus prendas son hechas a base de lana, tejidas a mano  como también a máquina de tejer, los artículos de vestir que vende, van desde chalinas hasta chompas, con los más bellos puntos y colores. Este negocio surge por la idea de tener un ingreso fijo, ya son 14 años de vender estos artículos, sus prendas tienen la línea de ser artesanías, se ubican en un local comercial donde se expenden productos nativos de su zona. Todas las tardes es su horario fijo de atención y por las mañanas no descuida la atención de sus 2 hijos. Para Gloria la única dificultad es su saturado tiempo, pero poco a poco lo va superando. Solicita este préstamo por primera vez,  pero se compromete a ser muy responsable en sus pagos. Con este dinero podrá adquirir más mercadería y mejorar su stand, Gloria compra directamente de los artesanos.
texts.en:
Gloria is 32 years off age, she lives with her husband and their two children. In the afternoons she tends to her clothing stand. The clothes are made of wool, hand knitted and also machine made. The articles of clothing she sells are anything from sweaters to jackets, with only the most beautiful stitching and colors. This business came about because she wanted a steady income. It has now been 14 years since she's been selling these items, now known to be artesan's fine crafts. Her stand is located in a zone where many other items native to her region are sold. Gloria's only challenge is she doesn't have enough time, but slowly she is improving. She is requesting a loan for the first time, but she is committed to be responsible with her payments. With these funs she will be able to add selection to her merchandise and improve her sales. Gloria buys directly from artesans.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire more stands to improve her clothing store.

loans.name: Rolando Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Rolando tiene 55 años de edad,  habita en Laureles Sur, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 16, 18 años de edad, los dos estudian la secundaria, y también en tiempos libres ayudada a sus padres con la elaboración del pan ya que su esposa también lo apoyado siempre y trabajan juntos, este negocio lo inicio hace diez años lo cual es una herencia de sus padres, ya que ellos hacían y vendían el productos de ricos y variados panes tanto dulce como simple, pues el ha seguido la tradición vende y lo elabora lo cual le genera a una buena ganancia, esta solicitud es la octava en Afodenic lo cual ha sido de buenos beneficios para su incrementos de inventario, como su producción en las ventas, lo que desea es invertir en materia prima, para producir mas pan, y así seguir ofertando sus productos a diversos proveedores.
texts.en:
Rolando is 55 years old, lives in Laureles Sur, and he and his wife have two children aged 16 and 18. Both of his children are in high school and help their parents during their free time with making bread as his wife also always supports him and they work together. He started his business ten years ago when he inherited it from his parents as they made and sold delicious products and various breads, both sweet and simple. He has continued the tradition and developed the business which generates good revenues. This is his eighth loan with Afodenic which has been of great benefit in increasing his inventory and sales production. He would like to invest in raw materials to make more bread and thus continue to offer his products to different suppliers.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to make bread.

loans.name: Than's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by five borrowers, all of whom live in Kok Rolosh Commune in Siem Reap Province. The group leader, Mr. Than P., age 37, makes a living driving a taxi motorcycle, picking up his passengers in and around his community.

Mr. Than P. is currently earning an average of $3 a day and has been running his service for a long time. He is a father of three children, all of whom are teenagers and attend school. His wife, Neam Nim, sells used clothes at the market. She is also a good housewife who cooks delicious meals. She runs her business very well and has a lot of customers who buy clothes from her. To expand the business, P. seeks a loan for his wife to purchase additional used clothing for sale.

The four other borrowers include Phen S., age 40, who is a motorcycle taxi driver. He needs a loan to buy souvenirs for his wife to sell. Dok P., age 39, sells vegetables at the market. She is asking for a loan to purchase various kinds of vegetables for sale. Phan P., age 55, sells Khmer noodles. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to make the noodles. Phen T., age 31, is a staff member at a company. He is applying for a loan for his wife to enlarge her souvenir business.

loans.use: Purchase additional used clothes for sale

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa I. is a 25-year-old. She is single and a mother with one child who is currently in primary school. She is very hard-working and resourceful for her family. She sells bags of maize, and she also sells food in her neighborhood. She has been selling "kenkey" for the past six years now. Hawa prepares kenkey from milled maize. It is well packed in maize leaves and it is left to boil for 2 hours to be served with hot pepper or any gravy stew together with fried fish.

Hawa obtains her supply of foodstuffs like maize, vegetables, and charcoal from the surrounding villages near Abofour. Hawa then retails them to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk supplies of charcoal, maize, fish and vegetables to increase her inventory, especially in this season of "hamatan" where demand for her goods is high. She hopes the loan will enable her to increase her savings to pay her child's educational fees and also to save part to restock her inventory. Hawa belongs to a village bank called ‘Naomi’. She hopes to receive a loan in the amount of GHS 700 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy bulk supplies of charcoal, maize, fish etc.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila, a 35-year-old married woman with three children, lives in Haret Hreik, a suburb of Beirut. Four years ago she started working as a home-based hairdresser to help her husband in the family expenses. Today, she is requesting a loan of $800 to buy new equipment in order to increase her client base.

loans.use: To buy new equipment for her business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.es: Robert tiene 43 años, es conviviente y padre de dos hijos que viven en su casa. La agricultura es la actividad que económica que heredó de sus padres, ellos sembraban, alverjas y hortalizas de acuerdo a la temporada del año, de eso dependía la cosecha, le enseñaron. Bajo esos conceptos empezó a sembrar pero no le funcionó, intentó con la floricultura, pero también fracaso. Sin embargo, hace cuatro años un amigo le propuso sembrar manzanilla en sus chacras; desde entonces este producto le resultó muy rentable, por no tener competidores. Las cosechas de su manzanilla son cada tres meses, en abril, julio y noviembre; para ello invierte mucho en la mano de obra, para trasplantar, sacar las hierbas, abonar y fumigar, por cada uno de estos trabajos le cobran entre 200 y 300 soles En esta última siembra a invertido 1500 soles con miras de ganar hasta 5 veces más, por lo que tiene que abonar y cultivar con mucho esmero, para hacer realidad sus sueños. Robert es un cliente nuevo que ingresa a un banco ya formado, es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que tiene muchas expectativas de desarrollo, asimismo hace compromisos de pagar sus cuotas en las fechas indicadas. El dinero que solicita, es para la compra de fertilizantes, que le permitan abonar su cultivo de manzanilla para que logre cosechar y obtener las ganancias de acuerdo lo que se propuso.
texts.en:
Robert is 43 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He inherited his farm from his parents, who planted peas and vegetables according to the season. The crop depends on the seasons, and his parents taught Robert how to plant accordingly. With these concepts in mind Robert began to plant, but his crop didn't do well. He tried planting flowers, but this also failed. Nevertheless, four years ago a friend proposed that Robert plant chamomile in his fields, and this crop has been profitable, because there is no competition. Robert harvests the chamomile every three months, in April, July, and November. This means that he must invest a lot of money in labor, in order to transplant,harvest, fertilize, and fumigate. Each of these jobs costs between 200 and 300 soles. Robert invested 1500 soles in this last harvest, hoping to earn five times as much. In order to realize his dreams he has to go to a lot of trouble to fertilize and cultivate large quantities of chamomile. He's now asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, which will help improve his crop and earn the projected amount of profits.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Lise

texts.en:
Lise S., age 18, is married and has no children. She has 3 years of experience farming taro and ta'amu (giant taro). She sells to the villiage people, especially the public, one day per week.

This is her first loan from SPBD to help her with her farm. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 80 Tala ($32 USD). SPBD loans are Lise’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase tools and equipment needed for farming, such as weed killer, fertiliser, chemicals.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes P. is 48 years old and happily married to Rosito. They live a simple and happy life in Barangay Bangar, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. As a fruit of their patience and sacrifices in farming, two of their children successfully graduated from college in their chosen profession and are now working abroad, while their youngest is still studying in college. She hopes that their farming business will become successful for them to combat life’s difficulties.

She and her husband are working together in cultivating their farm. They plant rice and vegetables. To assist her husband in their farming needs, she is now borrowing a loan of PHP 20,000 for their farm maintenance. The amount will be of big help to purchase their needed agricultural inputs such as fertilizers, hybrid seeds and pesticides. She hopes that, in the coming harvest season, they are able to have a higher yield. She prays for good weather since rain and other calamities are some of the factors that affect their harvest.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, hybrid seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell staple goods

loans.name: Hoàng Thị

texts.en:
Xuê Hoàng Thị is 40 years old and lives in the town of Gia Lộc. She is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Xuê raises livestock, primarily chickens. Xuê has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 4000000 VND a month.

In 2008, Xuê joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation. Xuê has successfully repaid her previous loan from TYM Fund. She used that loan to purchase breeding livestock. Xuê is now requesting a new loan so she can purchase baby chickens. Xuê plans to use the additional revenue generated by the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy chicks

loans.name: Wendy Xiomara

texts.es: Wendy Xiomara V. M. de 23 años de edad reside en Cojutepeque junto a su madre, padrastro, un hermano y su pequeño hijo. Ella junto a su madre poseen una venta de carne en el mercado municipal de Cojutepeque, en el cual hace ocho años invierte su tiempo para obtener los recursos necesarios para vivir de una manera digna. Wendy solicita un préstamo, ya que necesitan comprar más carne para que de esta manera las ventas puedan incrementarse y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Wendy Xiomara V. M. is 23 years old and she lives in Cojutepeque with her mother, stepfather, one brother and his young son. She and her mother run a business selling meat in the market of Cojutepeque. She has invested her time in this business for eight years to earn a decent living. Wendy is requesting a loan because she needs to buy more meat. This way, she can increase sales and increase earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more meat

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Sinsin Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sinsin est constitué de huit  femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques avec en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le quartier Sebougou de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali).
Les membres du groupe Sinsin font le commerce d’articles divers tels, les pagnes, les condiments alimentaires (tomates et oignons), les fruits exotiques, la pâte d’arachide, du savon, les activités de tricotages etc.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, elles ont décidé de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt, elles sont à leur 2ème  deuxième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  15 pièces de tissus légers, 20 rouleaux de laine et 2 sacs de graines d’arachide.
La laine est transformée en napperons et les grains d’arachide en pâte d’arachide après être triés, grillés, décortiqués et broyés. Elles se ravitaillent en matières premières au grand marché et au marché château de Ségou chaque semaine. Les produits sont revendus à domicile et au marché de Sebougou à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et faire face aux évènements sociaux (baptême, mariage et décès) sans l’apport d’autrui.
Elles ont pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de leurs activités dans la collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso
NB : Mariam S. est absente de la photo pour raison de décès de son père.
texts.en:
The Sinsin group is made up of 8 women, married and mostly from monogamous families, with an average age of 38 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in the Sebougou neighborhood of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali).

The members of the Sinsin group sell various articles, such as “pagnes” (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth), condiments (tomatoes and onions), exotic fruit, peanut butter, soap, knitted goods, etc. So as to satisfy the needs of their ever growing clientele, they decided to join Soro Yiriwaso. After having correctly reimbursed their first loan, they are on their second solidarity loan that will be used to buy 15 lengths of light-weight cloth, 20 skeins of wool, and two sacks of shelled peanuts.

The wool is made into place mats, and the peanuts are made into peanut butter after being cleaned, grilled, shelled, and crushed. They get their raw materials in the big market and the “château” market in Ségou every week. The products are sold out of their homes and at the Sebougou market to a clientele composed mainly of women.

They expect to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and to cover societal expenses (baptisms, marriages, funerals) without having to rely on anyone else.

Their ambition is to increase their business collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso.

NB: Mariam S. is absent from the photo because of the death of her father.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various raw materials to process

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity A. has a small boutique in Abura where she sells panties. Charity is married with two children and has received a junior high school education. Her husband is a trader and she is responsible for supporting him. Charity has been selling panties since 2008.  Her loan will be used to buy more and varied clothing for sale. She plans to use the new profits from her business to re-invest.

loans.use: To buy more and varied clothing.

loans.name: Aku Esse

texts.fr:
cette dame réside avec sa famille dans le quartier d'adidogomé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé. elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois. actuellement son stock a baissé, ce qui a entrainé une baisse de ses recettes. elle veut reconstituer son stock pour rehausser ses recettes, c'est pour cette raison qu'elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 22 sacs de charbons de bois.
avec ce qu'elle gagne comme revenu de son commerce, elle contribue aux dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en:
This lady lives with her family in the Adidogomé neighborhood, an outlying district of the town of Lomé. She is married and the mother of 3 children. She earns a living selling charcoal. Presently her stock is low and that has caused her receipts to fall. She wants to replenish her stocks to raise her receipts, and for this reason she has asked WAGES for a loan to buy 22 sacks of charcoal.

With the income from her business, she contributes to supporting her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of charcoal for re-sale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn C. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Evelyn is married and has seven school-age children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. Evelyn has been in business for over 32 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Evelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to the borrower's house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Sheyla

texts.es:
Sheyla es una mujer trabajadora, creativa y dinámica, tiene 36 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos adolescentes, se dedica a la preparación y decoración de tortas, también tiene una bodega que funciona en su casa, su esposo la apoya en todo lo quiere emprender, él es obrero de construcción civil. Hace cuatro años que viene siendo socia del banco comunal “Guadalupe”; su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, el cual invirtió en la venta de comida.
