COn este crédito de S/.  1500 soles,  invertirá en la compra de abarrotes y en la compra de telas al por mayor. La meta de Sheyla  es terminar de hacer el piso de su casa y seguir apoyando a su esposo en la educación de sus 2 menores hijos.
texts.en:
Sheyla is a hard working, creative, and dynamic woman. She is 36, married, and has two adolescent children. She makes and decorates cakes. She also has a store in her house. Her husband supports her in everything she wants to undertake. He is a civil construction worker. She has been a member of the Guadalupe Communal Bank for four years. She used her first loan of 300 PEN for food sales. With this loan for 1,500 PEN she will buy groceries and wholesale fabric. Sheyla’s goal is to finish the floor in her house. She also wants to continue helping her husband with the education of their two children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her grocery business and buy fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk for

loans.name: Rosio

texts.es:
La socia Rosio; pertenece al banco comunal Ayni, actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 37 años de edad y es madre de 2 hijos, la socia alterna sus diferentes labores del hogar con el trabajo independiente, ella es docente de profesión y a su vez realiza en sus horas libres el servicio de llamadas a celulares de forma ambulante en las esquinas, la socia trabaja duro para sacar adelante a su familia, ella solicita el préstamo para poder reinvertir en su pequeño negocio y de este modo hacer algo mas grande y que le genere mayores beneficios.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago otorgado en las fechas establecidas.
texts.en:
Our member, Rosio, is a member of the communal bank “Ayni” and lives in Cusco. Our member is 37 years old and the mother of 2 children. She alternates her time between housework and freelance work. She is a professional teacher and in her free time offers cell phone service on street corners. She works hard to help her family get ahead and is asking for a loan so she can invest in her small business. In this way she could do something bigger that generates greater benefits. Our member thanks, and values, the loan and promises to meet her payments as they come due.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in small business

loans.name: Lazati

texts.en: Lazati K. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and married woman with three children—one in kindergarten, one in primary school, and one in secondary school. She runs a clothing store at Yombo Makangarawe ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases wholesale and retail business goods from the city market at Kariakoo and Karume. She meets her daily family demand from her business income. She has been in the business for four years, and she has managed to build a residential house. She is requesting a loan of 600,000 TZS to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods to capitalize the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve the quality and range of her products

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 25-year-old married man with a 3-year-old son. He describes himself as a mature and aggressive businessman that is trustworthy and innovative. He owns two retail clothing stores, from which he sells men's jeans and shirts. On a daily basis, he runs one of these stores, while his wife runs the other shop across town. From this business, Francis generates approximately 30,000 KES per month.

Francis explains that he started his business two years ago with a loan from Equity Bank. He was able to obtain this loan because he was a salaried employee working in accounting. When he left his accounting job, he opted for a loan from KADET to help him improve his business. With this loan that he is seeking, Francis will purchase new jeans and shirts to sell in his clothing shops. He only buys one of each style so that he can keep his merchandise unique, which he thinks draws customers to his stores. In the future, Francis hopes to open a large retail shop and to import specialty men's clothing.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. Specifically, KADET provides financial services to its members, thereby improving living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the following website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing new men's jeans and shirts to sell in his clothing shop

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 55 años, vive con su esposa y su hijo, que ya es mayor de edad y se dedica al transporte de pasajeros.
Él cuenta con una chacra, pues desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, inclinándose por la siembra y cultivo de la yuca, lo cual lo complementa con otros productos; como el plátano,  arroz, maíz y frutos cítricos. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 20 años, tiempo donde la ha ido muy bien.
Lo que le gusta a Víctor de su trabajo es trabajar duro y seguir adelante con esta labor que tanto le gusta y lo mantiene activo. La venta de la yuca es un negocio muy rentable porque su comercialización es regular y segura.
Asimismo, también lleva a vender otros productos en el mercado de su localidad, como el plátano, maíz y algunas variedades de tubérculos que produce su chacra, que también son demandados por la gente de su zona.

Este es su 7mo crédito con MFP, es parte de un banco comunal y está contento porque no tiene  problemas con sus compañeros de grupo, y todos son responsables con sus pagos. El dinero que solicita lo usará en la compra de abono para el mantenimiento de su chacra.
texts.en:
Víctor is 55 years old. He lives with his wife and his son, who is already grown and works as a passenger transport driver. Víctor has a farm; since he was very young he has worked in agriculture, mainly concentrating on planting and cultivating yucca, which he complements with other products such as plantains, rice, corn and citrus fruits. He has been doing this work for 20 years, and during this time it has gone very well for him. What Víctor likes about his profession is working hard and continuing with this labor which he enjoys so much and which keeps him active. Selling yucca is a very profitable business, because the market for it is regular and reliable. At the same time, he also takes other products to sell at the market near where he lives, such as plantains, corn and some varieties of root vegetables he produces on his farm, which are also in demand among the people of the area. This is his seventh loan with MFP; he is a member of a communal bank, and he is happy because he does not have any problems with his fellow group members, and all of them are responsible with their payments. The funds he is currently requesting will be used to buy fertilizer to maintain his farm.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie G. is from the village of Tuburan Aloran Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Elsie is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Elsie owns & operates a business making and selling food products in the local community. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Elsie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used for additional capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Elsie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional capital

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth G. is from the village of Catarman in Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Lilibeth is widowed. To make a living, Lilibeth sells seafood, such as fish and shrimp, in the local community. Lilibeth is just starting this business.

In 2009, Lilibeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilibeth is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Lilibeth's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud has been working as a farmer for the past 12 years. He's a 32-year-old single man who lives alone. He learned his occupation from his father. He grows all types of vegetables, each in its season, and he also has an agriculture tent (like a greenhouse) to facilitate the cultivation. He sell his harvest in the market. 

Today, Mahmoud is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy supplies, such as fertilizer, seeds and equipment, that he needs to increase his productivity and raise his income.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as fertilizer, seeds and equipment

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda P. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin province. She is 4 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Brenda owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Brenda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Choung Svay Group

texts.en:
Mr. Choung S. is the village bank president for a group loan consisting of 16 people located in Phdau Tboung village in Takeo province. The members of this group will use their loans to purchase supplies, equipment and other items for different purposes.
Mr. Choung S. is 61 years old, a widower, and has two children, one of whom is a construction worker while the other is a laborer in the silk-weaving industry.  He is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare field to cultivate rice. He is now requesting 400,000 KHR  from Kiva partner, AMK, to purchase fertilizer to support his dry farming. All the members are shown in the photograph but some of them are hidden from view.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Carolina Aurora

texts.es: Carolina D. 36 años D. edad es soltera, trabaja como responsable D. bodega en el taller D. mecanica D. su papá, tiene 2 hijos: el mayor D. 19 años D. nombre Ramiro, quien vive con su abuela materna para acompañarla ya que vive sola y Belen D. 4 añitos D. edad estudiando el pre-escolar.  Carolina gracias a un proyecto D. vivienda en el Residencial Bosques D. Juigalpan obtuvo la oportunidad D. tener su propia vivienda con financiamiento a largo plazo, pero esta unicamente es embaldozada y como la niña esta pequeña y le gusta jugar mucho  esta solicitando su 2do credito para mejorarla poniendole ceramica a toda la casa y asi evitarle enfermedades a su hija.  El mayor sueño D. Carolina es tener una vivienda bonita con todas las condiciones que necesita su familia para vivir en un ambiente agradable, ademas desea que sus hijos sean personas D. bien y que en el futuro lleguen a ser profesionales que ayuden a salir adelante al pais.
texts.en:
Carolina is 36 years old and single. She is in charge of running the warehouse for her father's mechanic shop. She has two children. Her oldest son Ramiro is 19 and lives with his grandmother because she lives alone. Her daughter Belen is only four years old and is in pre-school. Thanks to a housing project in the Forests of Juigalpan residential development Carolina was able to purchase her own home with a long-term mortgage. The house has an unimproved floor and because her daughter is little and likes playing on the floor she would like a second loan to improve the house using ceramic tiles and thus avoid potential illnesses for her daughter. Carolina's dream is to have a beautiful home with all the necessities for her family to live in a comfortable environment. She also hopes that her children are upstanding people and that in the future they become professionals and help improve their country.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to tile floor

loans.name: Memunt

texts.en:
Memunt, 46 years old, is a widow with four children, ages 9 to 20 years old. She sells yams to make sure she meets her family's financial needs. Memunt sells every day of the week except on Sundays. Her biggest priority is that she feed her family and make sure the children’s school fees are paid. As a widow, she does not have support from anyone; hence, she puts in her best to make sure she succeeds in her business.

Memunt wants to expand the size of her business by buying more yams to sell. She is asking for a loan of 170,000 nairas to purchase more yams to sell to her numerous customers. This will enable her to meet the demand of customers and also buy at a cheaper rate which will also increase her profit. She says thanks to Kiva and LAPO microfinance.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Gilbert Kingi

texts.en:
Gilbert is a 40-year-old man, married with five children. He has been practicing farming in Kibaoni Malindi for the last two years and earns a profit of Kshs 9,700 monthly. Gilbert is also employed in a salt manufacturing company.

Gilbert was introduced to Kadet by an existing member and is applying for his first loan. He will use Kshs 3,600 of this loan for land preparation, Kshs 1,120 to buy seedlings, Kshs 3,200 to buy fertilizers and the rest will be used for weeding.  He anticipates a boost and some extra earnings from this loan which he plans to use to increase his farm acreage and pay school fees for his children. 

A hard-working man, he dreams of owning a good residential house and investing in quality education for his children.

loans.use: Buying seeds, fertilizers and paying for land preparation and weeding

loans.name: Sreang

texts.en: Mrs. Sreang H. lives in Trapeang Chrey village in Kandal province. She was born in 1955. She and her husband, Mr. Sung Nhiem, are telephone sellers in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. So to improve their business, Mrs. Sreang H. is applying for a loan to buy more phones to resell. Through this activity, the couple supports a child who is helping them to sell phones too. Her husband appears in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy more phones to resell

loans.name: Ingrid Jeaneth

texts.es: Ingrid Jeaneth V. V. de 22 años de edad, vive junto esposo y a su único hijo de 4 años de edad, el cual asiste a su primer año de kinder. Ella reside junto a su pequeña familia, en el barrio San Jacinto, ubicado en la capital del país. Ingrid posee una venta de herramientas y electrodomésticos de segunda mano tales como: televisores, hornos tostadores, taladros, planchas, serruchos; así mismo comercializa cables para televisores, controles remotos universales y algunas herramientas más. Este negocio esta ubicado en la avenida Gerardo Barrios, una de las calles más concurridas del centro de San Salvador, en donde muchas personas llegan a buscar diferentes tipos de productos de segunda mano, con el fin de poder encontrarlas a precios más bajos. Ingrid posee este negocio desde hace cinco años, el cual inicio con el deseo de poder brindarle todo el apoyo económico a su esposo y de esta forma contar con una mejor estabilidad económica. Ingrid solicita un préstamo para poder comprar mayor cantidad de productos usados, los cuales se encuentren en muy buen estado, ya que esto le permitirá contar con más clientes los cuales confíen en el buen estado de sus productos.
texts.en:
Ingrid Jeaneth V. V. is 22 years old. She lives with her husband and her only child who is 4 years old, who is in his first year of kindergarten. She resides with her little family in the San Jacinto neighborhood, located in the country's capital. Ingrid has a business selling second hand tools and appliances such as: televisions, toaster ovens, drills, irons and saws. She also sells television cables, universal remote controls and some other tools. This business is located on the Gerardo Barrios avenue, one of the busiest streets in downtown San Salvador. A lot of people go there looking for differernt types of second hand products, with the purpose of finding them at a lower price. Ingrid has had this business for five years. She started it wanting to offer her husband economic support and in this way have better economic stability. Ingrid is asking for a loan to be able to buy a greater quantity of used products that are in very good condition. This allows her to have more clients who trust the good condition of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase used appliances and tools.

location.town: San Jacinto , departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.fr:
Yvonne U.  est née à Kirundo au Burundi avec ses parents Rwandais, qui s’étaient refugié là-bas pendant la guerre civil de 1959. Elle a 29 ans et sa famille est rentrée dans leurs pays originaire en 1995. Elle avait dans ce temps là 13 ans, elle a sa mère car son père est déjà mort en 2000. Elle a un diplôme de niveau secondaire en comptabilité.

Elle travaille dans une entreprise de construction  comme aide comptable, et elle a une expérience de 3 ans sur ce poste. 

Elle épargne  chez Amasezerano depuis 2009, et elle sollicite maintenant son premier prêt avec un bût de payer le minerval pour sa deuxième année académique, comme elle compte obtenir son licence en management. Elle prend un prêt de 400000 Francs Rwandais. 

Elle veut prendre courage et bien étudier pour la réussite dans ses études et continuer à la troisième année de ses études. Avec ses épargnes, elle pourra dans le proche avenir entreprendre soit un mini-supermarché, soit un petit bureau de  change.

À la longue, ses ambitions sont de devenir une grande économiste de son pays. Si elle devient grand économiste et obtient un bon boulot, elle pourra financer sa famille dans tous les aspects de la vie.
texts.en:
Yvonne U. was born in Kirundo, Burundi, of Rwandan parents who had sought refuge in Burundi during the civil war of 1959. She is 29 and her family came back to their homeland in 1995. At that time she was 13. She now has only her mother since her father died in 2000. She has a secondary school diploma in accounting. Yvonne works in a construction firm as a bookkeeper, and she has three years' experience in this job. She has been putting aside savings with Amasezerano since 2009, and she is now requesting her first loan with the intention of paying the fees for her second academic year, since she would like to get a Bachelor's degree in management. She is taking out a loan of 400000 Francs Rwandais (Rwandan Francs). Yvonne wants to work hard and diligently so that she will succeed in her studies and be able to continue with her third year. With her savings, she will soon be able to open a mini-mart or a little currency exchange booth. In the long run, her ambition is to become a well-known economist in her country. If she can do that and can find a job, she will be able to support her family in all regards.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: pay the fees for her university courses

loans.name: Fazil

texts.en: Fazil Q., 44 years old, rents a place where he runs a café or tea house, as it called in Azerbaijan. He is married and has three children. His monthly income is 150-200 AZN. He serves about 50 to 60 people a day and works from 6 a.m. until 1 a.m. especially in the summertime. He would like to improve conditions in his café and purchase new chairs and tables. Fazil wishes to build his own café in the next several years.

loans.use: purchase new chairs and tables

loans.name: Cueto Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Cueto está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Mercedes P. Gonzales de 28 años por el  deseo de autosuperarse y adquirir ingresos extras instalo una pequeña venta desde hace tres años.
Los otros integrantes son Luz Adilia S. propietaria de un pequeño bar que inicio hace 12 años y Francisco Gutiérrez quien tiene un pequeño taller de recarga de baterías. 
Este grupo ha sido participes  tanto en la oferta de créditos como en el desarrollo empresarial y de autoestima por medio de los programas de  capacitación los cuales son  Desarrollo Humano con Enfoque de Género, Desarrollo Empresarial con Enfoque de Género, Intercambio Empresarial  y Articulación de Actores. Esto según expresaron les ha permitido administras su negocio.
texts.en:
The Cueto group is made up of three hard-working and enterprises people. One of these is 28 year old Mercedes P. Gonzales, who started a small store 3 years ago following her desire to improve herself and her income. The other members are Luz Adilia S. who owns a small bar she founded 12 years ago and Francisco G. who has a small battery recharging shop. This group has taken part in loans as well as courses in business development and self esteem such as: Human Development with Gender Emphasis, Business Exchange and Intercommunication Skills. They say these have allowed them to manage their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Basic grains, meat, snacks, etc

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Luisa; ella tiene 49 años de edad y La socia es madre soltera ella tiene 1 hijo, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia compra materiales de arcilla, pigmentos y mucho más para la elaboración de pequeños ajedrez hechos en cerámica y la cajita de madera, Ella trabaja en este negocio desde hace 8 años y está situada en la plazoleta de San Blas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para la elaboración de artesanía.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This partner belongs to the "Choquequirao" community bank; she lives in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco. The partner is Mrs Luisa; she is 49, and a single mother of 1 child. She alternates her housework with a retail business. She purchases materials: clay, pigments and much more to make small ceramic chess pieces and wooden boards. She has worked in this business for 8 years and sells from the small plaza of San Blas. She is requesting this loan to purchase materials for her craftwork. She infinitely appreciates and values this loan since it will allow her to expand her business and improve her quality of life. She promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of materials for craftwork

loans.name: Leonia

texts.en:
Leonia L. is 52 and married with four children. Her business activity is planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Leonia has many years of experience in this business. Leonia needs a loan to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve the business.

In 2007, Leonia joined SPBD. This is her fourth loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Leonia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital for her clothing business

loans.name: Jacob Njoroge

texts.en:
Jacob has been in the quarry business for 5 years now. He is 32 years old, married to Hannah Wambui and they have two children.

Jacob was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan. He repaid his previous loan of KES 15,000 well and on time. He plans to employ another person to increase production and meet the demand at his work site. Jacob also has plans of opening up a hardware shop in Naivasha in the future.

loans.use: to employ another person to increase production and meet the demand

loans.name: Lilliam Haydee

texts.es: La señora Lilliam Haydee M. T. tiene la edad de 33 años habita en el barrio Los Meléndez Ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe. Esta señora vive con su esposo quien  le ayuda con los gastos de la casa, él es asalariado de una epresa en el area de servicio al cliente ; ellos tienen a cargo a dos hijos que estudian actualmente en primaria, los sueños de doña Lilliam es darle una condición de vida mejor a sus pequeños ya que ha pasado por muchas dificultades para poder lograr lo que hoy en día tienen, esta señora es comerciante tiene una pulpería  ubicada en su casa, y el apoyo de Afodenic y los fondos Kiva, han permitido la incursión a nuevos mercados que favorecen su bienestar, los señores también son agricultores, y es para sus terrenos que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas, y abonos vegetativos que brinden un mejor mantenimiento a sus tierras, un aumento en la producción e incremento en las ventas a favor de la continuidad de una buena economía de la familia y tras esto un cambio positivo en sus niveles de vida.
texts.en:
Señora Lilliam Haydee M. T. is 33 years old and lives in the Los Meléndez neighborhood in the town of Ticuantepe.  She lives with her husband, who helps her with the household expenses.  He is employed by a customer service company in the area.  They have two children in elementary school.  Doña Lilliam dreams of giving them a better life as it has been very difficult for her to be able to give them what they have today.  

Señora Lilliam has a store located in her house.  The support of Afrodenic and Kiva have permitted her to venture into new markets that promote her well-being.  She also dreams of working in agriculture and it is for this reason that she is requesting a loan.  She will use the loan to buy fertilizer, fungicides and vegetative compost which will be the most beneficial for her land, increase her production, increase her sales so that she can continue to support her family and effect positive change in their quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, fungicide and vegetative compost to maintain her farmland

loans.name: Esmeralda Ii Group

texts.es:
El grupo Esmeralda II está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Lidia Aurora M. S. de 43 años quien se dedica al comercio de lotería, raspadita y decimo actividad que realiza desde los 13 años. Ella invertirá el crédito en la adquisición de estos billetes de lotería ya que en estos meses se dan los premios altos y es donde las ventas suben.

M. tiene el proyecto de poner una tienda donde venda desde ropa, zapatos, perfumes, cremas, etc. y mejorar su negocio de la lotería.
 
Las otras integrantes son Raquel del Carmen M. S. y Verónica Elizabeth G.. M. S.  de 36 años quien es comerciante de lotería desde hace 17 años, actividad que inicio porque no tenía otro medio de subsistencia. Ella además de este negocio tiene un puesto de comida rápida y tiene la meta de montar un restaurante. Mientras G. se dedica al comercio de productos Avon y prendas de oro y plata en grandes cantidades.
texts.en:
The group named Esmeralda II is made up of three hard working women. One of the members is Lidia Aurora M. Sanchez. She is 43 years old and she sells lottery tickets, a business she has had since she was 13 years old.  She will invest her loan in the purchase of these lottery tickets to take advantage of this time of year when large prizes are awarded and sales are good.

Mrs. M. wants to set up a store to sell clothing, shoes, perfumes, skin creams etc. She also wishes to supplement her lottery ticket business.

The other members are Raquel del Carmen M. Sanchez and Veronica Elizabeth G.. Mrs. M. Sanchez is 36 years old and she has been selling lottery tickets for the past 17 years. She started her business when she didn't have any other source of income. In addition to this business she also has a fast food stand and her goal is to expand it into a full restaurant. 

Mrs. G. sells Avon brand products and gold and silver jewelry in wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase lottery tickets for resale.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta forma parte del banco comunal “Creación”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Chillán. Ella tiene un bazar, librería y paquetería en su casa, hace  4 meses. Sin embargo desde antes trabajaba ya además en confección de cortinas de baño y sábanas. 
Con este préstamo viajará a Santiago, capital de Chile, a comprar mercadería, es decir, telas y artículos para reponer sus productos en el bazar, como por ejemplo silicona y palitos de maquetas entre otros. 
Su sueño es crecer en su  negocio, para lo cual cuenta también con el apoyo de su esposo. Tiene 3 hijos, pero solo el menor,  de 22 años, quien es estudiante de diseño gráfico en la universidad, vive con ella. 
Para Marta ha sido muy bueno trabajar con Fondo Esperanza, no solo por los préstamos, sino por los gratos momentos que vive junto a sus compañeros de grupo y la asesora de FE. 
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “Silla del Sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en esta ella han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
Marta is a member of 'Creación' community bank in the town of Chillán.  She has had a stationery store, book store and small goods store in her house for 4 months.  She has also been making shower curtains and sheets for some time.

With this loan she will travel to Santiago, the capital of Chile, to buy goods, that is to say material and articles to replace products in her stationery store such as, for example, silicone glue and little sticks for making scale models.

Her dream is to grow her business and she has her husband's support in this.  She has 3 children but only the youngest who is 22 and studying graphic design at University lives with her.

For Marta, working with Fondo Esperanza has been very good, not only for the loans but also for the pleasant time which she spends with her fellow group members and the Fondo Esperanza advisor.

Chillán is a district in the 'centro sur' (south central) region of Chile.  The name means “Silla del Sol” (Sun's Chair) in Mapudungun, the language of the Mapuche, our indigenous inhabitants.  Chillán is known as “Cuna de la Patria” (Birthplace of the Nation) or “Tierra de Artistas” (Land of Artists) owing to the fact that it is the birthplace of a number of prominent characters in Chile's history such as, for example, the well-known pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise: stationery store products and material

loans.name: Julia Cruz

texts.es:
Julia de 68 años, tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive en una zona  caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes llamada suburbio de Guayaquil.  

Hace 35 años por el sector donde vivía no existía ninguna tienda o lugar donde comprar víveres fue por ello que ella decidió tener la primera tienda del sector para tener ingresos y poder mantener a su familia y darle una oportunidad a sus vecinos donde comprar. En la actualidad tiene su tienda de víveres y trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 16h00pm vendiendo arroz, enlatados, bebidas, granos etc. Para seguir con el negocio y surtir más su tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo bebidas, arroz, dulces, enlatados. 

Sus aspiraciones para el futuro es que quiere que su tienda este mas surtida y grande, también quiere comercializar pollos para tener un ingreso adicional.
texts.en:
Julia, age 68, sells provisions from a store in the front part of her house. She lives in an area called Suburbio de Guayquil where most of the residents work as merchants.

Thirty five years ago, this area did not have a store or any other place to buy provisions. For this reason Julia decided to open the first store in the area so that she could earn income, support her family, and provide her neighbors with the opportunity to buy things. She currently works at her store from 8am until 4pm selling rice, canned goods, beverages, grains, and other products. To keep her business running and restock her store with more inventory, Julia wants to use this loan to buy beverages, rice, candy, and canned goods.

Her aspirations for the future include having a larger well-stocked store. She also wants to sell chickens to earn additional income.

loans.use: Purchase beverages, rice, candy, and canned goods

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.es: Cornelia S. B. es estilista desde hace varios años por que opto por poner su negocio en su propia casa el cual es llamado “Estética unisex Conny”, donde realiza trabajos de belleza como los son cortes de cabello para hombre y mujer, peinados para todo tipo de evento, tintes, depilaciones y mas. Este será su tercer crédito en esta institución el cual ha demostrado su buena cultura de pago, por lo que ahora lo quiere utilizar para mejorar su negocio y así ir incrementando sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Cornelia S. B. is a stylist. Several years ago, she decided to start a business out of her home called “Estética Unisex Conny” where she provides beauty services such as haircuts for men and women, styling for all types of events, coloring, waxing, and more.

This will be her third loan with FVP. Cornelia has demonstrated a good payment history and now wants to improve her business and increase her revenues.

loans.use: Invest in improvements to her business

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es: El señor Cesar ingreso a la institución el año 2004 con el grupo solidario raza de bronce el cual hasta la fecha continua con los mismos integrantes, durante todo el tiempo que ha trabajado en emprender siempre fue responsable con sus pagos, es una persona con ganas de superación es por lo cual recientemente abrió un local donde expende comida.  El vive en casa de los suegros para poder velar por ellos, el es casado y tiene dos hijos pequeños los cuales están estudiando.  El destino del préstamo es para compra de muebles para su nueva pensión comprara sillas, mesas, ollas y refrigerador, su esposa y el trabajaran juntos en la pensión preparando la comida y atendiendo a los clientes, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Cesar joined our institution in 2004 as a member of the 'Raza de Bronce' solidarity group.  The group is still going with the same members.  During all the time that he has worked with Emprender, Cesar has always been responsible in making his payments.  He is a person with a desire to improve himself which is why he recently opened premises in which he sells food.

Cesar lives in his in-laws house so that he can look after them.  He is married and has two young children who are studying.

Cesar will use his loan to buy furniture for his new business.  He will buy chairs, tables, pans and a refrigerator.  He and his wife work together in their business preparing food and serving their customers.  He is very grateful to the institution for the support he has received.

loans.use: To buy furniture for his business

loans.name: Fidela

texts.es:
Fidela es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatarisun, tiene 55 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de papa rellena de manera ambulatoria en el terminal de salida al sur, también vende en toda la avenida cuzco y arenales donde hay talleres. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación como: papa, aceite, carne cebolla, zanahoria, carne, etc.
Está en Finca hace 2 ciclos, le gusta porque le dan créditos, puede ahorrar y recibe capacitaciones de la familia, superación personal, negocio.
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y que sus hijos se superen.
texts.en:
Fidela is a member of the Ccatarisun Communal Bank. She is 55 years old, married, and has 5 children. She sells stuffed potatoes as a street vendor at the bus station, she also sells along Cusco and Arenales streets where there are shops. The loan she seeks will be invested in buying ingredients to prepare her dishes such as: potatoes, oil, meat, onion, carrot, meat, etc.

She has been with Finca for 2 cycles; she likes the loans and she can save money and receive education services related to family, personal growth, and business.

Her dream is that her business grows and that her children be successful.

loans.use: Buy potato, oil, meat, onion, carrots, etc.

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Nov T. has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $3 per day. Her husband helps her in farming business as well. They have given birth to one kid, and still living under her care. They had planted rice crop for over three but their crop is not grows well because it needs more fertilizers. To deal with this situation, Nov T. would like to request a loan from Kiva to buy gasoline, and some fertilizers for her crops to grow well. With the rest of fund she will use to buy a horse for picking up rice.

loans.use: To buy gasoline, and some fertilizers for crops to grow well.

loans.name: Jigjidsuren

texts.en: Jigjidsuren, 36, married and lives with his wife and four children in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. All his four children attend school. He operates a grocery trading business with his wife which they started in 2007. They buy grocery products from the local market and sell them to herders who live in the countryside, far from the city. They own a car which is very useful for their business. He is a hard-working and active person who says, "I would like to buy a new car and expand my business activities." He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy more food to sell to the countryside people.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell

loans.name: Cruz María

texts.es:
En un sector conocido como Las Piedras de la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocida por su cultura tradicional por la alegría de su gente  y sus fiestas de san Pedro y San pablo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del banco comunal  Las Piedras.

La señora Cruz María es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la seriedad tanto de sus compañeras como los de la institución. Tiene 52 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tuvo seis  hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero aun dos de ellos viven con ella, uno de ellos está comprometido y vive con su esposa y su hijo pequeño y la menor que está soltera.

Ella realiza el crédito para su hijo ya que es él quien se hace cargo de los gastos familiares,  su hijo se dedica al comercio, vende legumbres y mariscos, el recorre la ciudad en su carro. Además de esto en las tardes también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo ya que como dice ella su hijo vende de todo con tal de ganarse el sustento diario y su forma de apoyarlo es realizar estos créditos y asistir a las reuniones, nos cuenta que lleva en estos negocios ya por siete años y que le va bien.

Este crédito es para comprar legumbres, mariscos y ropa de todo tipo. Sus sueños son tener una tienda en su casa para así poder contribuir más con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Señora Cruz María is a founding member of the bank. She likes the responsible attitude of both the bank and the other members. She is 52 years old; her husband passed away several years ago. She has six children from her marriage, all of them now adults although two still live with her, one of whom is engaged and lives with his fiancee and their little son, and the youngest who is single.

Señora Cruz María is taking on this loan for her son as it is he who is responsible for the family’s expenses. He has a business selling vegetables and seafood which he takes to the town in his car. In addition in the afternoons he sells all types of clothing. According to his mother, her son sells anything and everything in order to earn a living. Her way of helping is to take on the loan and attend the bank meetings. Her son has had his business for seven years and all is going well.

The loan will be used to buy vegetables, seafood, and clothing. Her dream is to have a store in her house so she can contribute more to the cost of running the household.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, seafood, and clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock clothing and cosmetics for sales business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma N. lives in the Bwaise neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has five children, all of whom are in school.   She also takes care of additional family members (her late sister's children).    

Fatuma has a business selling plastics.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Fatuma sells her products at the market, retail.    Fatuma has requested a loan of 900,000  Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more plastics. She also generates additional income through selling soda and juice.

The main business challenges for Fatuma include seasonality and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale.   Fatuma lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more plastics for sale

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Aminata F..  She is married, and has three children aged five months, three years and seven years. She has two additional dependents, who live with her because they are her relatives whose parents live in the village. These children depend on her to take care of them while attending school in the city.  

In 2007, Aminata F. established her local foodstuffs, palm oil, "gari" (cassava couscous) and beans business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,300,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000.

Aminata F. requires a loan in order to buy more foodstuffs. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Aminata F. plans to open a big store for the sale of local produce.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more food items for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary W. W. is a 22-year-old single mother. 

She joined Moonlight Group in Faulu Kenya so that she could access loans easily because the members of the group guarantee each other loans. She is able to pay weekly dues with the group because she sells clothes and fabric. She is also able to meet her basic needs with the income from her business. 

She hopes that one day she will open a big business. 

She has requested  20,000 KES to buy more fabric and ladies' clothes.

loans.use: to buy ladies' clothes and fabric

loans.name: Taing

texts.en:
The rice-planting business is the most popular occupation for Cambodian people who live in the countryside. Taing S. earns a living by cultivating rice crops. She was blessed with seven children, two of whom are working on the farm. Another source of family income is her husband’s business.  He is a horse cart driver in and around the community. 

Taing S.’s house is too small and she really wants to enlarge the size of her home, but she doesn’t have enough funds. To overcome this obstacle, Taing S. would like to request a loan to purchase some housing materials to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase some housing materials for  to build a new house.

loans.name: Chilbert

texts.en:
Chilbert B. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 45 years old.  Chilbert is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Chilbert owns & operates a business providing multi-purpose van services to local community members. Chilbert has been engaged in his business for over 14 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Chilbert joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chilbert has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. The loan was used to purchase tools needed to expand services provided. Chilbert is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the van service. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Chilbert from HSPFI.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the van service

loans.name: Peljee

texts.en:
Peljee is 55-year-old widow who lives with her three children in a house in Hovd province, Mongolia.  She is a friendly woman with a good personality. Peljee manages a business selling household goods.  She started the business in 1994 at a rented stall in a local market with the help of her daughter.  Peljee has gained a lot of experience in her business. 

Peljee requests a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Ke

texts.en: Mrs. Ke, 29, is homemaker. She stays at home to care for her child and maintains a daily routine. Her husband provides for the family’s expenses with his income as a domestic construction worker. He can earn approximately US$5 per day. Her husband always rents a motorbike when he needs to get to work as he doesn’t have his own vehicle. To address this situation, Mrs. Ke has applied for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to ride to his work place. Mrs. Ke married many years ago and is blessed with only one kid who is still enrolled in the public school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to ride to his work place.

loans.name: Adim Din Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Adim Din” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 for each member in order to expand their respective businesses. 

Kadiatu, 42 years old, is the leader of the group. A native of Matham village, she is married to a tailor and the couple has 5 children – 2 in primary school and 3 in secondary school. 

Kadiatu has been in business for nearly 30 years; she currently sells cigarettes, soaps, biscuits, mints, etc. With the help of a Kiva loan, Kadiatu is going to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, soaps, biscuits, mints, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy another buffalo.

loans.name: Josefina Monserrate

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Noviembre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Josefina, tiene 54 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos ya todos mayores de edad  e independientes, con ella vive su mamá que es discapacitada. El marido trabaja de chofer pero en forma ocasional. 

Ella para  ganarse algo propio y con la finalidad de ayudar a su esposo  y tener para los gastos propios y los de su mamá  hace mas de 12 años vende toda clase de frutas, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que ella alquila un carro en el que se desplaza hasta Calderón para comprar a agricultores de esta zona, luego  vende por toda la localidad, esto lo realiza dos veces a la semana y nos cuenta que le va muy bien ya que lo que compra los vende el mismo día. 

Este crédito es para comprar frutas plátano, naranjas, papayas, limones, etc. Este es el sexto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. 

Su sueño es tener camión en donde pueda realizar sus compras y ventas sin tener que pagar alquiler del carro.
texts.en:
The members of the November 4th Communal Bank meet every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as the Panama hats that are famous within and outside of the country.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Josefina. She is 54 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has six children who are already grown and independent. Her mother lives with her since she is disabled. Her husband works as a driver, but only occasionally.

Josefina began selling all types of fruits twelve years ago so that she could earn her own income, help her husband with their expenses, and cover the expenses of her mother. She says that she rents a car so that she can drive to Calderón to buy fruit from the local farmers. Josefina then sells all of the fruit in her town. She travels twice a week and says that she has done very well because of her ability to sell everything she purchases the same day.

This loan will be used to buy fruits such as bananas, oranges, papayas, lemons, and other products. This is her sixth loan with the Communal Bank and she enjoys the ease of making her payments. Her dream is to own a truck so that she can buy and sell fruit without having to rent a car.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, oranges, papayas, lemons, and other products.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 35 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Dina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Dina has been farming vegetables for nine years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 33 years old, married and has two children, both of whom are in school. Her husband is a farmer in the Philippines and makes a living by planting  vegetables, corn and rice. Gina’s main priority is to prepare her children for school so they can become professionals someday, but for the last two years she has also earned money by raising pigs. Her dream is to expand her business so she can earn enough money to send her children to college. Gina is applying for a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy more piglets to raise because she hopes that will allow her to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El señor Jorge, de 57 años de edad, nacido en el departamento de Granada, casado, padre de dos hijos, de oficio mecánico tiene alrededor de 34 años  de dedicarse a esta actividad. Empezó a la edad de 23 años, luego de dejar de trabajar como chofer de transporte pesado en la misma localidad (autobús), inicio con capital propio, con pocos clientes en su domicilio; gracias al apoyo de su hermano quien tiene un taller por medio el cual adquirió sus conocimientos. 
Solicito el préstamo para la compra de llantas.  Las cuales las pondrá a la venta a sus clientes en su taller para darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes, sus planes a futuro son diversificar y aumentar su  inventario de llantas, mejoras al  negocio para darles una mejor atención a sus clientes y por consiguiente mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mr Jorge, age 57, was born in the Granada department. He is married and has two children. He has been a mechanic for 34 years, and started at the age of 23 after leaving his job as a bus driver. He started his business with his own capital, in his home, with a small number of clients. It got rolling thanks to the support of his brother, who has a workshop and gave him contacts.
Jorge is requesting this loan for the purchase of tires, which he will sell to his customers in his garage in order to provide better customer service. His plans for the future include diversifying and expanding his tire inventory and improving his business to provide better customer service, thus improving his income.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Kitise

texts.en:
For the last six years Kitise has been practicing farming in Kibwezi town. He is 28 years old and single.

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be his first loan. He intends to use the loan to buy fertilizers and seedlings and prepare the land for planting.

In the future, Kitise hopes to practice large-scale farming, which will increase his income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings and prepare the land for planting.

loans.name: Christian Israel

texts.es:
Christian Israel tiene 24 años de edad es soltero vive con la familia y con el hijo de dos años de edad en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Descripción de la Ventanilla  VRC Luchar para triunfar, se encuentra ubicada en el sector la poza, perteneciente a la ciudadela 10 de noviembre  Cantón Ventanas, Los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a diferentes labores tanto Agrícola como comercial.

Christian se dedica a la  agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, cacao, los productos las  compras y las ventas lo realiza en ventanas. Solicita el crédito para  la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, urea  y poder incrementar la siembra.
El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder comprar los abonos  para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentemente son la competencia y las plagas.

El sueño de Christian es poder apoyar a la familia económicamente para la alimentación y poderse comprar un carro para transportar los productos para poder venderlos. En los tiempos libres le gusta practicar el deporte en especial el indor.
texts.en:
Christian Israel is 24 years old, single, and lives with his family and his two-year-old son in Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The Communal Bank “Luchar Para Triunfar” (Fight to Win) is located in the La Poza section of the town called “10 de Noviembre” (November 10th) in the canton of Ventanas.  The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses ranging from agriculture to retail.  

Christian is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and cacao.  The loan he is requesting will be used to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, and urea so that he can increase his output.

This loan will be a great help since he can buy the compost for maintaining good conditions for his crops.  The challenges he faces on a frequent basis are the competition and pests.  Christian dreams of supporting his family financially by providing food and purchasing a car for transporting and selling his products.  

In his free time Christian enjoys practicing sports, especially indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, and urea.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
With his determination to improve his family's poor living condition, Joseph is patiently suffering hardship in operating his piggery business as a source of income. He said that this occupation isn't that easy as it needs hard work and patience to provide better nourishment to his pigs. Because of this, this 36-year-old man is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs.

He usually earns about 5,000 PHP every selling time, but sometimes it is inadequate to sustain all their expenses, so his wife also helps him in providing the needs of his family. He let his wife build a store in front of their house. With the help of his loan, he would improve his piggery business. He hopes to achieve success in the future in order to have a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs

loans.name: Rauf

texts.ru: Рауф женат имеет двоих детей. Занимается скотоводством и выращиванием картофеля. За период своей предпринимательской деятельности он расширил свой бизнес и имеет хорошие доходы. Рауф трудолюбив и это качество помогает ему заниматься сразу несколькими видами сельхоз деятельности. Займ он хотел бы получить для приобретения трех голов скота, доходы от которого пойдут на обучение его сына. Он надеется получить займ и заранее благодарить всех вас.
texts.en: Rauf is married and has two children.  He is involved in animal husbandry and growing potatoes.  During the period of his entrepreneurship, he expanded his business and now earns a good income.  Rauf is a hard-working person, and this quality helps him to be involved in several types of agricultural activities.  He wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of three heads of livestock and then use the profits to pay for his son's education.  He hopes to get this loan and thanks all of you in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Analee

texts.en:
Analee is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Analee has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her shop.

Analee is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Analee hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence lives in West Point, Liberia. She is 35 years old, single, and has four children between 4 to 16. For four years now she has been selling soft drinks and bread in her community. She likes her business because it keeps her basic. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks and bread  for her business. Her plans are to get married and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks and bread for her business.

loans.name: Calamarca Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CALAMARCA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Patacamaya, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Luisa es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejidos, venta de lana, tienda de barrio, confección de chamarras.

La señora Luisa  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de venta de lana que viene trabajando hace años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de un amigo.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de El Alto y posteriormente lo venderá a las fabricas textileras. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.
texts.en:
The “CALAMARCA” community bank are about to start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Patacamaya regional office.  The group has ten members and is run by a board of directors which has Luisa as its president.  The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include: weaving, selling yarn, running a neighborhood store and making jackets.

Luisa tells us that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution through an invitation from a loan officer.  She currently has a store where she sells yarn which she has been running for years.  She learned the business from a friend.

The loan that Luisa is taking out now will be used to increase her capital, buying yarn which she will acquire in El Alto and then sell to textile factories.  This work allows her to make income with which to support her family.  She lives with her partner and has two children.

loans.use: to buy yarn

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
11 mujeres del Chaco se han unido con ganas de progresar y salir adelante por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Ellas vieron una gran oportunidad en el programa de comité de mujeres de la fundación. Realizan actividades individuales, pero también en conjunto con lo cual podrán fomentar su compañerismo.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Lida, quien se dedica a la venta de verduras, ella nos comenta que empieza su jornada de trabajo a muy tempranas horas de la mañana, ya que va a traer productos frescos para ofrecer a sus clientes, gracias a su trabajo ha podido crecer y ayudar a su familia, cubriendo los gastos y manteniendo la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras frescas con las cuales podrá abastecerse y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Quiere comprar tomates, lechugas, repollos, cebollas y demás tipos de verduras.
texts.en:
Eleven women from Chaco have come together with a desire to move ahead in life through their work as a team.  They saw a great opportunity in the “Comité de Mujeres de la Fundación” (Foundation’s Committee for Women).  They do individual activities, but also work together and this strengthens their camaraderie.

Lida is one of the members and she sells vegetables.  She tells us that she begins her workday very early in the morning, since she has to bring in fresh products to offer to her customers.  Thanks to her work, she’s been able to raise an income and help her family, covering the household expenses and maintenance.

She is asking for this loan to buy fresh vegetables so she can supply her business and be able to meet her customers’ needs.  She wants to buy tomatoes, lettuce, cabbage, onions, and other types of vegetables.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Cosmus

texts.en:
Cosmus, aged 42 years, is married and has four children. He does dairy farming and has been doing this for thirteen years. The business earns him a monthly income of Kes. 9,900.

This is his first loan with KADET Ltd. He will use the funds to buy cattle feeds like hay and molasses and use a modern fertilization method (artificial insemination) for his dairy cows. Cosmus hopes to be a large-scale dairy farmer in the future.

loans.use: to buy hay and molasses and use artificial insemination for his cows.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble, tiene 39 años, se dedica a la venta de carros usados, tiene 2 hijos, es casada y socia de Finca Perú desde hace un año, esta muy feliz en Finca, solo aquí pudo aprender como se hace un negocio y el ahorro que es lo que mas valora, siente que aquí pudo progresar, agradece toda la confianza que le brindan, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en su negocio.
texts.en: Adela is a member of the El Roble Communal Bank. She is 39, married with two children, and sells used cars. She has been a member of Finca Peru for one year, and is very happy here. She is here so that she can learn about running a business and save money--this is the most important element for her. She feels that this is how she can improve and is very grateful for our confidence in her. She will use this loan to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for cars.

loans.name: Karama Agahikaine Group

texts.en:
Nviri is a forty-eight-year-old married man with six children. He lives in Kyenjojo,Uganda. He trades in produce and has been in business for five years. He used to be a farmer and after realizing that farming would be a long process, he decided to venture into the produce business. He is happy with the decision. He has a challenge of price fluctuation. His dream is to own a food store. 

Nviri is a member of a group whereas per policy, each one guarantees the other in acquiring the loan. He intends to use the loan to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Sobresalientes Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina “Mujeres Sobresalientes”, está constituido  por 14 señoras muy activas y solidarias, quienes son de Ciudad del Este. Ellas tienen actividades diferentes, algunas  emprenderán una nueva labor y se encuentran muy entusiasmadas.
Emilia es una mujer que tiene muchas metas y sueños, y es en mira a estos que se unió al programa de la fundación, ya que vio en este una gran oportunidad. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza que ella hace artesanalmente y comenta que le va bien, ya que es un poco más económico que los productos que se venden en las tiendas y eso la ayuda.
Solicita la ayuda de Kiva y fundación paraguaya para la compra de los insumos necesarios para hacer sus productos, como ser cloro, lavandinas, colorantes, aromatizantes y demás.
texts.en:
The committee is called “Mujeres Sobresalientes” (Outstanding Women) and it’s composed of 14 very active, supportive women from Ciudad del Este.  They have different activities and some will be starting new businesses; they are very excited.

Emilia is a woman with many goals and this is why she joined the Fundación since she saw a great opportunity in doing so.  She sells cleaning supplies that she makes in an artisanal way.  She comments that she does well since it’s a bit more economical product compared to those sold in stores and this helps her.

She is asking help from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya to buy the necessary supplies to make her products like chlorine bleach, bleach, coloring agents, fresheners, etc.

loans.use: to buy chlorine bleach, bleach, dyes, fresheners, etc.

loans.name: Sotero

texts.en:
Sotero is a tailor who works with his wife to make suits, school uniforms and other clothing articles. This family business is the main source of income for them and their 6 year old child. This is the second time Sotero is seeking a loan from Mifex and Kiva. With his first loan he was able to boost his production for the school year and saw his income increase significantly. He has made a formal agreement with a large distributor for whom he produces a pre-determined amount of clothing articles per week. He also continues to sell to the people in his community. He is now seeking a second loan with Kiva and Mifex in order to purchase a newer and better sewing machine as well as a large amount of fabric. He anticipates a very busy Christmas season and is thus preparing for a major increase in production.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Sotero will invest in a new and more powerful sewing machine as well as in fabrics

loans.name: Askar

texts.en:
A. is involved in three businesses: fish monger, selling of vegetables, and restaurant owner. She has been in this business for the last 7 years. She started her business with a capital of $100 which she got from the husband to start a hotel business. Since then she diversified as her business grew.

Given the funds, she wants to inject the money in the three businesses so that they can bring more income to her. She is a widow with six children who are school-going and solely depend on the profits from the business for their education.

loans.use: Expand her three businesses

loans.name: Grey

texts.en:
Grey lives with her parents on their farm. Her parents are too elderly to run and manage the operations of the lands so they have given the responsibilities to their daughter. With the guidance of her parents, Grey is planting rice on the lands and she is gaining much experience. She wants the loan because she needs to invest in seeds and fertilizer. She also wants to avoid borrowing from informal lenders because her parents have told her about the risks of their interest rates. She hopes she can save the profits from the land in order to start a family of her own some day.

The Santa Lucia Communal Bank

She is part of one of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Santa Lucia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia. They will use the microloans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each other's guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Centro Agricola Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The sector is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with the rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not count on formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: To farm rice on her lands

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 26 years old. He has a small mini-market in the Kirkuk market. This is his first loan from AL-Aman. He wants to get $1000 to purchase more goods for his shop and develop his shop. He wants to increase his income and enhance his living standard.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es:
La señora Dalila pertenece al Banco Comunal "El Bombonaje", se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en dos tiendas, una de ellas ubicada en el mercado central del distrito de Rioja, Departamento de San Martín y la segunda en su domicilio.  Lo que la motivó a dedicarse a este negocio fueron las ganas que tenía de seguir haciendo estudiar a sus menores hijos y además que le gusta estar en contacto permanente con sus amigos y clientes, así satisfacer sus necesidades primordiales. 

Tiene 39 años y 04 hijos, tres de los cuales son varones y una mujer, el mayor de los varones y la mujer son los que le ayudan en la atención del negocio en la casa, además de acompañarla algunos días en la compra de sus productos. Siempre se ha destacado por ser muy trabajadora y responsable con las labores asumidas.

El crédito otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/.2,500.00 ($790.00), será  invertido en la  compra de diversos abarrotes como:  cajas de jabón por cada marca (Marsella, Bolívar, jumbo, etc.), sacos de 50 kg de  arroz, azúcar, menestras de diversos variedades, papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado y de frutas en cajas, aceite por litros, además quincenalmente se traslada a la ciudad de Cajamarca para comprar granos,  frutas y verduras frescas para ofertar a sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for a general store.

loans.name: Norma Cecilia

texts.es:
Norma is a diligent, 38 year old woman who has a small business distributing breakfasts in the markets and to the public in general. She began three years ago, and feels very happy that she has been able to run this business. Thanks to her work, she has been able to gain many benefits and provide things for her small family, improving their quality of life because of her efforts.

With the sacrifice Norma makes every day, she can satisfy her requirements, but she needs to construct her own home with her boyfriend, whom she plans to marry next year. She is requesting this loan to grow her business, and begin a new business selling clothing door to door. With this she will be able to increase her savings and get closer to the day when she can have a family.

Norma es una diligente señora de 38 años, que trabaja en su pequeño negocio de distribución de desayunos a los mercados y público en general. Empezó hace ya tres años y se siente muy feliz de haber incursionado en esta noble labor, debido a que gracias a su trabajo a podido adquirir muchísimos beneficios y bienes para su pequeña familia que ha mejorado notablemente su nivel de vida gracias a su ocupación. Con el sacrificio de todos los días Norma puede satisfacer sus necesidades y no deja de esforzarse por cimentar sus bases económicas sin dejar de lado la construcción de su propia base familiar con su novio con el cual tiene planes de contraer matrimonio el próximo año. Hoy solicita un préstamo para implementar su actual negocio e iniciar uno nuevo con venta de prendas de vestir a domicilio con los que podrá incrementar sus ahorros y hará cercano el día de poder tener una familia.

loans.use: TO GROW HER BUSINESS SELLING BREAKFASTS IN THE MARKET, AS WELL A LAUNCH A NEW BUSINESS SELLING CLOTHING DOOR TO DOOR, INCREASING HER INCOME SO SHE CAN PLAN FOR HER FUTURE.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob, 47, owns a secondhand sportswear stand in the market at Kasoa. He is requesting a loan in order to make a deposit for a box of secondhand clothing. Those who are able to make deposits on the clothing are able to choose from a better selection, thus making higher profits when selling.

With the extra profit, Jacob will help pay for the education fees of his three children. One is in junior high, another is training to become a teacher, and the oldest is studying at the university.
