Julita is 49 years old and is a married woman with 3 children.  The oldest child is 19 years old.  Her husband is a rice farmer.

Julita sells fruits and vegetables that she buys from local farmers.  She started this business 3 years ago.  She earns about 4,000 PHP from this business.  She also raises pigs in her backyard.  Julita sells her pigs at her town's market.

This loan will be used to buy pig feed and more fruits and vegetables to sell.  She hopes for her business to prosper.  She also desires to have her children finish college and have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco casado, su esposa trabaja, juntos salen adelante ante las dificultades que se le presenten. Sus hijos estudiantes, planes que se preparen y que tenga una carrera. Trabajo por cuenta propia desde hace un gran tiempo, se le dificulta cuando se enferma, siendo de gran pérdida.  A corto plazo el requiere mejora la infraestructura de su vivienda necesitando la construcción de un cuarto para obtener mayor comodidad y seguridad. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, bloques, piedras canteras, estribu, láminas de zinc, golosas entre otros. Agradece al apoyo al mejoramiento de si nivel de vida.
texts.en: Francisco is married, his wife works and together they are able to get ahead despite whatever difficulties they are faced with. Their children are students and hope that they are educated and have careers. Francisco has been self-employed, for a long time, he faces problems when he gets sick resulting in great losses. In the short-term, he needs to improve the infrastructure of his home, to build a room to have greater comfort and security. The loan will be used to buy construction materials like: cement, sand, concrete blocks, gravel, braces, zinc sheets and other items. Francisco is thankful for the support that will help him improve his quality of life.

loans.use: buy materials to build a room.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Isabel works hard to support her family.  She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Isabel is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment for her fishing business.

Isabel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 42 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de lubricentro, la socia vende aceites, lubricantes y repuestos para carros, la socia también es profesora, por medio de este trabajo y negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de lubricentro. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar aceites y repuestos para la lubricante.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This group member belongs to the community bank 'Amauta'. This bank is located in the Cusco district which belongs to the province of Cusco in the Cusco department.

This group member is 42 years of age and married with three children. She alternates her daily activities with her business running a lube centre. She sells oil, lubricants and spare car tyres, as well as working as a teacher. Between teaching and running a business, this group member has been able to bring her children up. 

She would like to expand her lube centre, so she is requesting a loan to purchase oil and spare tyres. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her repayments diligently.

loans.use: to purchase oil and spare tyres for her lube centre

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru:
Зафар целеустремленный и добросовестный человек.  Он женат и любящий отец 4 детей.  Его отец является бизнесменом и помогал отцу по бизнесу и многого научился. В настоящее время он имеет свою торговую точку, и он продает продукты питание.  Кроме этого он реализует сельскохозяйственных культур, потому что начался сезон заготовки и большой спрос на рынке. Он вместе с другом занимается в данном бизнесе. Они покупает сельскохозяйственных культур из других районов и продает их на местном рынке. Зафар хотел бы получит кредит в размере 1500$ США для покупки сельскохозяйственных культур. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Zafar is a purposeful and honest man. He is married and the loving father of four children. His father is a businessman, and he helped his father in business and learned a lot. He currently has a shop, and he sells food products. In addition, he sells seed for crops, and because it is time to sow the fields, there is much demand.  He and his friend work in the business. They buy seed from other regions and sell it locally. Zafar would like to receive a loan of $1,500 to buy seed.

loans.use: to buy seed.

loans.name: Rina Margarita

texts.es: Rina Margarita tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, es la primera vez que realizara un financiamiento para su actividad, ella tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de ropa en general, calzado, cremas, perfumes, pinturas, joyas entre otros productos. el sueño de Rina es seguir creciendo con su actividad y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Rina Margarita has a general retail business. She has been in this business for 3 years and this is the first time she will be taking out additional financing.  She has 2 young children to look after. 

The loan she is seeking is for the purchase of assorted clothing, footwear, cosmetic creams, perfumes, paints, and jewelry among other merchandise. Rina's dream is to continue growing her business and increasing her income.

loans.use: to purchase assorted clothing, footwear, cosmetic creams, perfumes, paints, and jewelry among other merchandise.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a flexible person. She is determined to generate income for the daily sustenance of her family. Aside from raising hogs, she also involved herself in the farming business together with her husband. They both plant and harvest rice and sell it to traders when they harvest. According to her, profits earned were not enough to sustain all their needs, especially for the education of her only child who they send to college. 

Fe is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides used in farming. Through the help of this loan, she will improve her crop production and generate more income.

She hopes to continue the education of her child in order to achieve good employment someday to experience a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides used in farming.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es: Milagros tiene 41 años, se destaca por ser una mujer valiente, luchadora y muy responsable, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos de 22, 21, 18 y 15 años quienes aún viven con ella en su casa que es propia, inmueble que logró comprarlo con mucho sacrificio. Hoy lo que más prioriza es ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Su trabajo consiste en la venta bolsas, negocio que lo hace de manera ambulante, es así que su labor empieza desde muy temprano en el mercado de Bellavista, recorriendo los pasillos en busca de clientes así como algunas calles que son muy transitadas. Ella es muy querida, pues es carismática y sabe llegar a sus clientes, y eso ha hehco que dure en éste trabajo alrededor de ocho años y por lo que seguirá continuando para que pueda apoyar a sus hijos en su educación. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo libre para cuidar su hogar y cuidar de sus hijos, sin embargo manifiesta que se cansa mucho el tener que recorrer las calles, pero sabe que vale la pena, si desea ver a sus hijos profesionales. Espera para el futuro tener un local pequeño y evitar tener que estar caminando. Este será el cuarto crédito con MFP, manifiesta sentirse bien con su grupo por que son responsable y muy unidos, asimismo asegura cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, comprará mas bolsas para que pueda seguir con su trabajo y por ende tener ingresos en su hogar.
texts.en:
Milagros, 41, stands out for being a fine and very responsible woman and a fighter.  She is a single mother of four children, ages 22, 21, 18, and 15, who still live with her in her home, which she managed to buy with great sacrifice.  Currently her biggest priority is to give her children a better quality of life.

Her work consists of selling bags, which she does on foot, so she begins working very early in the Bellavista market, going through the passageways and some busy streets in search of customers.  She is well liked, since she is charismatic and knows how to reach her customers.  This has allowed her to last about eight years in this job, and she will go on with it so she can support her children in their education.

What she likes about her job is that she has free time to be able to take care of her home and her children.  Nevertheless, she says that she gets tired having to walk the streets, but she know that it's worth it if she wants to see her children become professionals.

Milagros hopes to have a small place in the future so she can avoid having to be walking.  This will be her fourth loan with MFP.  She says she feels good about her group because they are responsible and very united.  She also guarantees that she will fulfill her loan payments.  She will buy more bags with the amount requested so she can continue with her work and consequently have income in her home.

loans.use: to buy more bags.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda, a 53-year-old mother of seven children, is the operator of a motorcycle service that has been in operation for seven years. Working hard every day just to meet the needs of her family, she also sells frozen food in the village for additional income.

Yolanda has requested a loan of P7,000 (Philippine pesos) to buy paint for her motorcycle and frozen food to sell. She hopes to increase her profits so that she can sustain the financial needs of her family, improve their standard of living, and save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy paint for motorcycle maintenance and frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Yegon

texts.en:
Yegon, 28 is a father of 2 children aged 5 and 2. He has been in farming for 9 years producing and selling milk, tea and eggs for the local market. He deals in tea both from his farm and and one sourced from other farmers in the local market.

Yegon has requested a loan of 20,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more poultry to boost his poutry business. He says that having been in the business for a while has given him the experience that would help him make the best out of the loan and gain income to provide for the basic needs of his young family. He remains optimistic about the business. Yegon however laments the fluctuating market prices.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is 71 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.

Emilia has a shop that sells motorcycle, or habal-habal, services and her husband is the driver. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

Emilia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Emilia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

loans.name: Benvinda

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia do mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 3 ainda frenquentam a Escola. Fez a 7ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais.  Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua irmã enviando dinheiro para auxiliar nas dispesas alimentares. 

É negociante ha mais de 11 anos vende produtos de primeira necessidade e tem um rendimento de cerca 6.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Já teve emprestimo noutro banco para o negocio e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar produtos (farinha de milho, arroz, amendoim, sal, oleo e outros) para aumentar a sua mercadoria. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 12.000.00mt e 16.000.00mt ambos aplicados para o negocio.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a construção da sua casa, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Benvinda was born in the city of Maputo in the Province of the same name in the south of Mozambique. She’s single and the mother of 4 children, 3 of whom still attend School. She completed 7th grade and didn’t continue due to her parents’ lack of financial means. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her sister by sending money to aid with food expenses.

She has been a trader for more than 11 years selling essential goods and has a monthly income of around 6,000.00 meticals (MZN) which she spends on household expenditure and saves in her bank account (BIM).

She has had loans from another bank for her business and managed to pay these off without difficulties. She came to know Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her third loans with Hluvuku for the amount of 20,000.00 MZN with which she intends to buy products (corn flour, rice, peanuts, salt, oil and others) to increase her merchandise. Her first loans were for 12,000.00 MZN and 16,000.00 MZN, both applied to her business.

She commits to paying off the loan and in future intends to build her house. As such, she intends to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: purchase products for resale (corn flour, rice, peanuts, salt, oil and others)

loans.name: Shady

texts.en: Shady is a 34-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and only child who is still attending school. He has been involved in the construction field for the past 11 years. In 2008, he started to work independently using his own tractor. Today, he is asking to borrow $2500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to equip his tractor with the needed supplies to facilitate his business operations. In the future, he plans to buy another tractor and hire an employee in order to work on additional projects.

loans.use: equip his tractor with the needed supplies

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: El señor Fernando a sus 62 años de edad es padre de 8 hijos, se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos. El señor Fernando tiene más de 40 años de experiencia en la cría de cerdos, actividad con la que sacó adelantes a todos sus hijos y la cual hereda de su padre. La jornada de trabajo del señor Fernando es de todos los días de la semana. El señor Fernando desea comprar una cerda que pueda criar, puesto que varios cerdos se han muerto y de esta manera poder aumentar sus ingresos; asimismo necesita comprar cuido para alimentar a sus cerdos. El señor Fernando sueña con ver crecer su negocio y tener un buen patrimonio para dejarle a sus hijos una buena estabilidad económica y calidad de vida.
texts.en: Fernando, 62, is the father of 8 children.  He is a pig merchant.  Fernando has more than 40 years’ experience raising pigs, an activity that allowed him to raise all his children and which he inherited from his father.  Fernando works every day of the week.  He wants to buy a sow to breed because several of his pigs have died and this way he can increase income; he also needs to buy pig feed for his pigs.  Fernando dreams with seeing his business grow and to have a good estate to leave his children good economic stability and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a breeding sow and pig feed.

loans.name: Masvingo Ten Stars Group

texts.en:
Addlight is 50 years old, married and has four children aged 28, 25, 24 and 18 years; only one attends school. She has no dependents. 

Addlight has been a dressmaker for six years and has one employee; she also raises chickens at her home in Rujeko. Addlight buys her materials from Harare and in town. She faces the challenge of debtors who fail to pay. 

Addlight would like to own a shop from which to sell poultry and a boutique. This loan of 2400 USD will help her to improve her family home and take care of her children.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed and material.

loans.name: Weimar Andres

texts.es: El joven Weimar a sus 22 años de edad es propietario de una pequeña tienda que compro hace 7 meses con el dinero de unos ahorros y el apoyo de su familia. El Joven Weimar desearía tener más surtido en su tienda con el ánimo de poder mejorar sus ventas y así mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su familia. El invierno es una dificultad para el señor Weimar puesto que este conlleva a que pocos clientes compren en su tienda, sin embargo este joven es emprendedor y convierte esta dificultad en una oportunidad. El sueño del Joven Weimar en ver crecer su tienda y a futuro tenerla como un supermercado.
texts.en: Weimar, 22, owns a small store that he bought 7 months ago with savings and help from his family.  He would like to better stock the store so that he can increase his sales.  The extra income will help him to improve his family's quality of life.  The winter has been difficult for Weimar because fewer people come to his store to shop in the winter.  He's an enterprising young man, though, and is turning the challenge to an opportunity.  Weimar's goal is to grow his business and to one day own a supermarket.

loans.use: to stock his general store.

loans.name: Jenny Carolina

texts.es:
Jenny Carolina tiene 25 años Es casado vive con el esposo y con los tres hijos de nueve, siete y dos años de edad , vive en el Cantón Ventanas en el Reciento Campo Alegre.

Esta ventanilla SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Campo Alegre, cerca de la parroquia Guare perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Jenny Carolina se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace 5 años, herencia de los padres,  las compras las realizan en comercial Jiménez de la ciudad de ventanas y las vende en la misma ciudad.

El préstamo lo solicita para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para el cuidado de los cultivos, además le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos de la familia. Sueño es comprar una casa.

Le gusta descansar  y salir con los hijos.
texts.en:
Jenny Carolina is 25 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and three children, who are nine, seven, and two years old. She lives in  Ventanas canton in Campo Alegre precinct.

This communal bank, SAN JACINTO, is located in Campo Alegre, close to the Guare parish in Ventanas canton. The communal bank works in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

For the last five years Jenny Carolina has worked farming corn and rice, something she learned from her parents. She makes her purchases at Comerical Jiménez in the city of Ventanas, which is also the city where she sells her goods.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizer, and manure to care for her crops, which will also to help her increase her family's income. Her dream is to purchase a house.

She likes to relax and go out with her children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and manure to care for her crops.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 39 years old, married to Ismael, and they have four children. She has been running a beauty salon for the last three years, earning a monthly income of Kes 10,000.

She is requesting her first   loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 20,000. She intends to use the loan to purchase cosmetics and a steam dryer for the business.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a chain of beauty salons.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products and a steam dryer.

loans.name: Nexar Octavio

texts.es:
Nexar Octavio tiene 26 años de estado civil Union Libre vive con la compañera y con un hijo de 6 años. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos.

La ventanilla 14 DE DICIEMBRE esta conformado por 15 socios de la cooperativa San José, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente de las Lomas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas como la siembra de maíz.

Nexar Octavio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  maíz. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en las ferias de los alrededores.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es tener dinero para comprar una casda para la familia.

Le gusta salir con la familia.
texts.en:
Nexar Octavio is 26 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with his partner and a 6-year-old son. He lives in the canton of Ventanas, province of Los Ríos. The communal bank "14 DE DICIEMBRE" is made up of 15 members of the cooperative of San José. It is located in the San Vicente precinct, belonging to the canton of Ventanas. The members undertake agricultural labors such as sowing corn.

Nexar Octavio works in agriculture, sowing corn. He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in the same markets and in fairs in the surrounding area. The loan is requested for the purchase of fertilzer, urea, and liquid fertilizers for sowing corn. The loan will help him increase his earnings to be used by his family and to invest. His dream is to have money to buy a house for his family. He likes to go out with his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, urea, and fertilizing liquids.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un groupe de l’association BADENYA de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne  quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de AMI qui est la deuxième personne debout de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à OUELESSEBOUGOU dans la  Préfecture de KATI (Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : poivre, tomate, oignon, choux, etc. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. 
AMI, qui est un membre du groupe et très connue à OUELESSEBOUGOU, excellente dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes (poivre, tomate, oignon, soumbala.).  Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.

loans.use: Achat de condiments

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis is a mechanic who operates his shop out of his home. He’s been working on cars for 20 years since he graduated highschool. He worked in someone else’s shop while he slowly saved his money and gradually bought his own tools. He set up his business right out of his home which is conveniently located on a corner street with a steady amount of traffic. He is known in the community for his quality work and his industriousness. He has 2 assistants and also employs another mechanic. He will use the loan to buy tools and make replacement parts

Luis is 42 years old, is married and has 2 children. When he first started his business his house was built from wood, but he has now been able to improve it with cement. He has been steadily improving his home and his business and is hoping he can continue. His dream is to see his kids grow up healthy and get through college.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Materials for his mechanics shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I intend to expand and diversify my business

loans.name: Svitlana

texts.en:
Svitlana is married with a 13-year-old daughter. She runs a business selling a variety of household items such as laundry soaps, hair spray, tooth paste, and shampoo. Presently, she has about $10,000 in inventory.

Svitlana is an energetic and focused business owner with an enterprising spirit. She has been in this business for more than ten years. Svitlana loves challenges and has overcome many difficult situations with her business. Her perseverance and diligence have been keys to her success.

Today, Svitlana is requesting a loan for $1,200 to re-supply her product inventory. She is in the process of constructing a new store and believes that the household items will continue to sell well and provide necessary funding to complete the store construction. Additional retail space in the new facility will allow her to increase sales even further and bring in more income. She is confident that the availability of lending services will facilitate the construction process and help her open the new store sooner. Svitlana’s goal is to continue refining her business skills so that she can keep her venture growing and provide for the needs of her family.

Світлана – одружена, в неї є 13-річна дочка. Вона займається бізнесом з продажу різноманітної побутової хімії, а саме, пральних порошків, спре їв для волосся, зубних паст та шампунів. Зараз в неї приблизно 10 000 доларів в товарі. Світлана – енергійний та цілеспрямований підприємець, дуже заповзятлива та жвава людина. Вона займається цим бізнесом вже більше 10 років. Світлана любить долати перешкоди, вона часто потрапляла в складні ситуації, пов’язані з її бізнесом. Наполегливість та відданість стали запорукою її успіху. Зараз Світлана просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб поповнити асортимент товарів у своєму кіоску. Вона зараз займається будівництвом нової крамниці. Світлана сподівається, що побутова хімія й надалі гарно продаватиметься, а, отже, прибутки від продажу нададуть їй можливість закінчити усі роботи. Нове приміщення допоможе Світлані збільшити обсяги продажів та отримати додатковий прибуток. Вона переконана, що доступність кредитних послуг прискорить процес будівництва та допоможе їй відкрити нову крамницю раніше. Світлана прагне й надалі покращувати свої ділові якості, для того, щоб розвивати власний бізнес та забезпечувати потреби родини.

loans.use: To increase assortment of laundry soaps

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.vi:
Currently H.,age 48, lives with her spouse and 3 children. Unlike other woman farmers who plant and practice animal husbandry, she took advantage of Investment Fund and opened a dress-making shop. Six years later, her place of business is a familiar address among female populace in her area. Her husband and children do the farming thus lending her invaluable support so she can devote most of her time to the business she loves. Her business is prospering, and responding to market demand, she plans to make a loan of US$575.00 to buy additional clothing material.

Translated from Vietnamese by Mai Doan, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị H. năm nay 48 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 3 con. Không giống như những người phụ nữ nông thôn chỉ quen với trồng trọt và chăn nuôi, chị H. vay vốn từ Quỹ đầu tư vào cửa hàng may. Sau 6 năm vay vốn giờ đây cửa hàng may của chị H. là địa chỉ quen thuộc của chị em phụ nữ trong thôn. Chồng và các con chị hỗ trợ chị rất nhiều trong công việc đồng áng để chị có thể dành thời gian cho công việc mình yêu thích. Công việc kinh doanh thuận lợi, chị H. đang đề nghị được vay thêm 575USD để mua vải may quần áo đáp ứng nhu cầu của thị trường.

loans.use: buy cloth to make clothes

loans.name: Vien Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Viên Thị Dậu and her husband have four children. The youngest one is still attending school, the other three are working. Her husband works a moto-taxi driver in the city. Since her application for the fund the last time, Ms Dậu had received a lot of encouragement from her family. Her husband Trạnh is the one who's in charge of collecting money for the weekly repayments of the loan. After a few rounds of successful pigs breedings, Ms Dậu requests a loan of 500 USD to buy more pigs, chicken and to renovate the pig pen.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Gia đình chị Viên Thị Dậu có 4 ngưòi con, 3 cháu đã lớn và đã đi làm. Hiện còn một cháu đang đi học. Chồng chị làm nghề chạy xe ôm trên địa bàn huyện và thành phố, 2 con chị đang làm công nhân. Tham gia vào Quỹ, chị Dậu nhận được rất nhiều sự ủng hộ và khích lệ từ phía gia đình. Anh Trạnh chồng chị luôn là người hỗ trợ chị trong việc trả tiền tuần với nguồn thu nhập hàng ngày. Sau nhiều lần đầu tư nuôi lợn có hiệu quả, vòng vốn này chị đề nghị vay 500 USD về sửa chữa chuồng trại và mua thêm lợn, gà để chăn nuôi.

loans.use: buy chicken and pigs

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr:
Born in 1962 in Ahonlogoé, Mr. Yawo A. is the father of seven children, some of whom are apprentices and others are in school. He specializes in market gardening and has a business growing chili peppers and vegetables. But when the water dries up, he can no longer run his business and has to temporarily cease trading. His ability to manage his income has, until now, allowed him to meet the needs of his household. Hoping to increase the area he farms in order to make more profit, he plans to buy a motorized pump to make it easy to water his garden. He also needs fertilizer. To do this, he is asking for a loan of $1,000.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1962 à Ahonlogoé, Monsieur A. Yawo est père de sept (07) enfants dont certains sont en apprentissage et d’autres sont scolarisés. Spécialiste du maraîchage, il produit du piment et des légumes qu’il commercialise. Mais lorsque les eaux tarissent, son activité n’est plus possible et il est obligé de rompe. Sa capacité de gestion des revenus lui a permis jusqu’ici de subvenir aux besoins de son ménage. Dans le souci d’agrandir la surface qu’il exploite en vue d’accroître le rendement, il prévoit se procurer une motopompe lui permettant d’arroser facilement son jardin. Il a aussi besoin de fertilisant. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crédit $1000.

loans.use: To buy a motorized pump and fertilizer

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Miss Sarah A., a 24-year-old, lives in Benin City and has a business center where she sells handsets, lines, and recharge cards, and allows customers to make phone calls.  She trained in this business for a year and established her own in 2004.  She is requesting a loan to enable her to buy more handsets, lines and recharge card for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more handsets, lines and recharge cards for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of other video machines - Comprar otras maquinas de video juegos

loans.name: Virginia J

texts.es:
Ms. Virginia A. has run a grocery store at home, in the city of León, for the past two years. She sells basic needs products, food and personal items, as well as house-made products. From the beginning, she has worked very hard and has invested in her business, in order to improve her difficult financial situation as the sole provider for her family.

Previous to having her business, she was a homemaker. Realizing she didn’t have adequate resources, she turned to Ceprodel, obtaining two loans, which she has invested on the purchase of merchandise for her store. This has resulted in greater sales volumes and better costumer service.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace dos años, en la ciudad de León, la señora Virginia A. se dedica a la venta de productos básicos, comestibles, personales y caseros, teniendo su propia pulpería en su casa de habitación. Desde que inició su negocio, ha sido una dama muy esforzada y trabajadora la cual ha invertido en su negocio para el mejoramiento de su situación económica, la cual según cuenta ha estado muy difícil por el hecho de que ella es el único sostén en el hogar.

Antes de tener este negocio se dedicaba al trabajo de ama de casa pero al darse cuenta que no obtenía los recursos necesarios, acude a Ceprodel quien le ha brindado un total de dos créditos, invertidos en la compra de mercadería, lo que ha resultado en mayores volúmenes de venta y una mejor atención a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Bishop A (I) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Hanifah N.. She sells vegetables and is requesting a loan to add to her inventory. Hanifah is 48 years old and is a widow. She has 9 children ranging from ages 18 to 31, and two of her children go to school. Each week, Hanifah makes approximately UGX 21000 in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add to her business.

Hanifah is joined in her small group by Hadijah N., Mariam O., Sophia N., and Betty B.. Hadijah N. sells vegetables and wants to boost her business. Mariam O. is currently operating a retail shop and wants a loan to purchase a refridgerator. Sophia N. sells cold drinks and wants to increase her inventory. Betty B. has a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add to her capital stock.

loans.use: To expand her vegetable business

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:
Magreth is 34 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 18 and 15. Magreth is a soft drinks seller; she started her business in 2004. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 7:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $65 from her sales.

In the past, Magreth has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phan Thi T., 35 years old, joined the Fund since 2000. When she first borrowed money, she used it to breed chickens and pigs. Her income from breeding pigs and chickens was used for expanding the farm, increasing the number of animals. In 2006, Mrs. T. switched from breeding pigs and chickens to investing in building material such as bricks, cements, tiles, etc. Her store provides materials for many building projects and also satisfies local needs. Besides, she collects wasted material. In 2007, Mrs. T. was able to build a 3-storey house of 150 meter square area. This time, she wants to borrow 1200 USD to buy more bricks, sands and gravels. Her average income is 300 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Phan Thị Thủy, 35 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2000. Vốn vay vòng 1 được chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Thu nhập từ chăn nuôi chị sử dụng để xây dựng công trình phụ, mở rộng chuồng trại phát triển số lượng gia súc, gia cầm. Năm 2006 chị Thủy chuyển sang kinh doanh vật liệu xây dựng như gạch, tấm lợp Phibro xi măng, gạch men … Cửa hàng của chị chuyên cung cấp vật liệu xây dựng cho các công trình và phục vụ nhu cầu nhỏ lẻ của người dân trong vùng. Ngoài ra chị mua bán, thu gom phế liệu. Năm 2007 chị Thủy đã xây dựng được ngôi nhà 3 tầng rộng 150m2. Vòng này chị Thủy xin vay thêm 1200USD để mua gạch, cát sỏi. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình là 300USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy building materials

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores S. is from the municipal of Villanueva in Chinandega. She works hard to improve living conditions for her family that counts so much on her. For this reason she has decided to continue the reconstruction of her house, that since the initiation of construction has come along, but in order to continue with the next part, she is asking for a loan from Ceprodel to continue this work.

It is out of true necessity that Dolores emphasizes her gratefulness for the credit that Ceprodel has proportioned. With this loan of $300, her family will be able to move toward improving their living conditions and their dreams of having a good roof and making the necessary changes to live together as a family.

La señora Dolores S. es originaria del municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega. Se dedica arduamente a trabajar con el propósito de brindar las mejores condiciones de vida a su familia que tanto necesita de ella. Para ello ha decidido continuar con la reconstrucción de su casa de habitación ya que al haber iniciado ha logrado avanzar con la construcción pero aun le es necesario continuar con otra parte por lo que hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con el crédito necesario para la compra de los materiales de construcción para así continuar con dicha obra.

Hoy en día es de suma necesidad destacar que gracias a los créditos que Ceprodel le ha otorgado ha logrado salir adelante mejorando sus condiciones de vida y son sus sueños llegar a tener un techo digno y que preste las condiciones necesarias para habitar junto con su familia.

loans.use: Construction materials

loans.name: Shakhoglan

texts.en:
Shakhoglan Q. is a 57-year-old farmer who sells milk to the local milk factory in the small village of Saatli. He has been in this business for more that 20 years. Shakhoglan is married and has five children. He is on a pension but it is too small of an amount to pay his expenses.

To improve his life he needs to improve his business and develop it. For this purpose he has applied for a loan to purchase two middle cows for $500 each and raise them to produce milk over the next two months.

loans.use: To purchase two cows for milk production

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
The client, Sr. Francisco S., operates a business in the city of San Ignacio Misiones. He's married and has 3 young children. He and his wife, Elena, own their house; Elena works at a Cooperative. His business is located in his house across from a city high school. He sells cold drinks, groceries, dairy products, cookies, sweets and even pastries which he sells to order for special events. He's operated the business for 5 years and has a well-established customer base that values his shop for the quality of its products.

Francisco is applying for this loan to buy merchandise so that he can increase his inventory and buy supplies for making cakes, an especially good business. The loan will help him to increase his income and improve the lives of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El Cliente Sr. Francisco S., comerciante de la ciudad de San Ignacio Misiones, casado con 3 hijos menores, viven en casa propia con su esposa Elena, quien es empleada de una Cooperativa, su microempresa se halla ubicado en su domicilio frente a un Colegio de la ciudad donde cuenta con venta de bebidas, comestibles, lácteos, golosinas, dulces, además es repostera los vende sobre pedidos para acontecimientos. En esta actividad posee una antigüedad de 5 años, cuenta con clientela formada reconocida por la calidad de sus productos.

El préstamo solicitado es para compra de mercaderías para incrementar su stock e insumos para la elaboración de tortas, por la buena venta que posee, además le ayudará a incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for grocery business.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Mao N. is a farmer and pig breeder in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Mao Lim, is a construction worker. They have four children, two of whom are attending school while the others are too young to work or study. Currently, the youngest child has cancer, which costs around $1000 to cure. Unfortunately, Mrs. Mao N. does not have enough money to afford the price above, so she decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings in order to cure her child.

loans.use: To cure her child of cancer

loans.name: Hamisa

texts.en:
Hamisa is widow with 3 children ages between 38 and 20 years old. She has been a khanga and breads seller in 2000. Every day, she works from 7am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Hamisa now seeking for a loan to buy more khanga and breads for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more khanga and breads for re-sale.

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison T., 33, is a member of the Tuwoda group in Kamwokya. He is married with 5 children, all in school. He has a tailoring business where he works with his wife and together they make “bitenge” traditional wear for sale. He started by getting small loans for his business and over time, he has been able to develop his business.

His wife has started teaching young girls the same trade by teaching sewing skills, independence and self-esteem, as it is very good for them to have a skill if they don't get formal education, so as to avoid being very vulnerable. The length of the girls' stay with Edison’s wife will depend on how quickly they can grasp what is taught to them and this determines their fees.

Recently, Edison opened up another store in Kisenyi Bus Park in the middle of Kampala city for his business expansion. The two shops will help to better Edison’s family’s future.

loans.use: To buy more bitenge textile for his two shops.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is a member of the Amor y Esperanza (“Love and Hope”) Village Bank. She is 49 years old and married with three daughters. Her nephew, who is an orphan, also lives with her.

Emilia travels to different regional fairs to buy grains, guinea pigs (a Peruvian delicacy), sheep and pigs. She slaughters the animals herself and sells the meat in the city of Ayacucho to stores, restaurants and individuals. She has been working this way for 15 years. Emilia had left FINCA years ago for health reasons, but she recently ran into one of FINCA’s loan officers, who remembered what a good client she had been and invited her to come back. She is currently starting a second loan cycle with Amor y Esperanza.

Emilia is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy clothing in Lima, which she will bring back to Ayacucho to sell for the Christmas season. Her goal for the future is to make home improvements and to save up for old age so that she doesn’t have to depend on her children.

loans.use: Buy clothing to sell for Christmas

loans.name: Susana Del Socorro

texts.es: La profesora Susana está solicitando su 7mo refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, como es construir los servicios higienicos y reparar la cocina del hogar,  trabaja como docente de educación secundaria desde hace 21 años, es importante mencionar que Susana con los creditos anteriores otorgados por AFODENIC ha mejorado su vivienda y sus condiciones de vida, tiene 4 hijos, una mayor de edad, y 3 que tiene a cargo, la mayor trabaja como docente, el otro hijo estudia 5to año de educación secundaria, el otro hijo estudia 3 er año de educación y el hijo menor de 12 años estudia su quinto grado de educación primaria, es una mujer que sueña con tener un porvenir mejor y que sus hijos tengan siempre lo basico y que estudien para que lleguen a ser excelentes profesionales, desea tener trabajo y sobre todo estar bien con Dios.
texts.en:
Professor Susana is asking for refinancing of her seventh loan to invest in home improvements like building hygenic bathrooms and repairing her home's kitchen. She has worked as an teacher in secondary education for 21 years. It is important to mention that Susana, with previous loans provided by AFODENIC, has improved her home and her living conditions. She has 4 children, one is an adult and three that she still cares for. The oldest works as teacher, one son is in his fifth year of secondary school, one son is in his third year of schooling, and the youngest is 12 years-old and is in fifth grade. She is a woman who dreams of having a better future and for her chidlren to always have the basics and that they study to become excellent professionals. She wants to have work and, above all, be good with God.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of Hygenic Bathrooms

loans.name: Arofat

texts.en:
Arofat S. is a farmer. She is 40 years old, and is married with two children. She puts a lot of effort into the development of her farming efforts because she is aware that they can help her children. The unconditional support that she receives from them provides her with optimism, and despite the financial shortcomings at home, she tries to alleviate those shortcomings efficiently. Her wish is to improve the living conditions of her family and is requesting a loan to increase the quality and quantity of her products. She requests 2000 Somoni ($ 600 USD). She wants to purchase seeds for wheat and onions and mineral fertilizer. Arofat is very grateful to everyone who is helping her to achieve her dreams. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Jesica

texts.en:
Jesica P. is married to Robin, who cultivates a half-hectare field and does vegetable gardening. They are blessed with three children: Rhea, 18, a high school graduate; Richard, 20, who finished elementary school; and Redento, 22, a high school graduate. Financial problems hindered them in maintaining their children’s educations, causing them to stop studying early. However, Jesica said she and her husband remain contented and thankful that her children understand their poor living situation. Her family is currently residing in Barangay Cabisera 14-16 of Ilagan, Isabela, where there are existing community projects such as building new community centers and a clean and green program. 

Jesica is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 4,000.00 for her rice vending business to assist her husband with their financial and basic needs for their family. She will buy four sacks of rice averaging 50 kilos per sack for the business. She also shared that with a sack of rice, she can earn a net income of PHP150, enough to support their daily immediate needs at home. She hopes to expand the business further in the future. Jesica said despite the hardships of life, they must still go on and must do something in order to overcome life's difficulties.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Agée de 43 ans, Madame Awa T.  vit dans une famille polygame  avec son mari, ses deux coépouses et leurs enfants dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)
Très tôt elle commença les  activités  génératrices de revenu auprès de sa maman qui faisait le commerce. Awa opta pour la vente des   ustenciles de cuisine ( tasses et autres) depuis 13 ans. Elle jouit d’une réputation et d’une notoriété très enviable à Koutiala. Elle est très sollicitée lors des foires hebdomadaires de Koutiala. 
Afin de pouvoir faire un stock important d’ustenciles, elle a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 5 ans.  Après 4 prêts de groupe ( prêt solidaire ) tous  remboursés sans difficultés,  elle est à son 5 ème prêt  individuel dont les 4 précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter une grande quantité de tasses à Lomé (Capitale du Togo ) et effectuer sa vente  au grand marché de Koutiala, au comptant en détail et à crédit  à une clientèle essentiellement composée  de femmes. 
 Elle compte générer  un bénéfice de 150.000FCFA par mois qu’elle utilisera pour  le remboursement de son prêt , participer aux charges quotidiennes de la  famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Awa T., age 43, lives in a polygamous family with her husband, two co-wives, and their children in the Hamdallaye district of the city of Koutiala (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Very early on, she started working to earn an income along side her mom, who used to do commerce. Awa opted for selling kitchen utensils (tubs and other items) thirteen years ago. She enjoys a very enviable reputation and distinction in Koutiala. She is in high demand there on the weekly market day.

To build up a sizable inventory of kitchen utensils, she turned toward the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso five years ago. After four group loans (solidarity loans), all repaid without difficulty, she is on her fifth individual loan, the four preceding ones having been correctly repaid.

She intends to buy a large quantity of bowls and basins in Lomé (capital of Togo). She sells her goods at the grand marketplace of Koutiala, cash or credit accepted, to customers essentially composed of women.

She plans to generate a profit of 150,000 francs CFA per month that will be used to repay the loan, to help cover daily expenses of the family, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basins

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
A. Marie est née vers 1950 à Adjohoun, village de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative et politique du Bénin. A. Marie est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants tous scolarisés. Marie est vendeuse de divers (savon,pâtes alimenaires, laits,sac de riz 5kgs,etc.). L'activité de Marie lui génère de revenus et lui permet de faire face un temps soit peu aux charges de sa famille. Mais faute de moyens financiers pour s’approvisionner à temps afin de répondre efficacement à la demande, Marie perd ses clients. C'est pourquoi Marie a besoin de crédit pour renforcer son activité et garder sa clientèle.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
A. Marie was born around 1950 in Adjohoun, a village of Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Bénin. She is married and the mother of five children, who are all in school. She sells various goods (soap, pasta, milk, 5-kg sacks of rice, etc.). Her work generates income for her and allows her to cope with family expenses for a time, short though it may be. But due to the financial means needed for acquiring supplies on time to respond effectively to the demand, Marie is losing customers. This is why she needs a loan, so as to bolster her business and to retain her customers.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for micro-loan recipients.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy inventory:  soap, pasta, milk, rice, etc.

loans.name: Asia M. Arif Group

texts.en:
My name is Asia, and I’m a 38-year-old married lady residing in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historical places and Punjabi foods. I have completed my education until the fifth standard and couldn’t study further because my father’s income was insufficient to pay the school expenses. My husband's name is M. A., and he belongs to the welding profession. I am a mother of five kids: one son and four daughters. My son belongs to a wholesale business. He buys different items (eggs, biscuits, and chips) on wholesale and sells them to different bakeries. He has been in this business for the past three years. I am applying for a loan for my son so that he will be able to expand his wholesale business and purchase more items for it. 

I am the group leader of four other women from my locality. Qubra Baji, Safia Baji, Anwar Baji, and Saeeda Baji each want a loan to buy clothes for their cloth selling businesses. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy items for a wholesale business

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
She manages a sari-sari store business (community based store) in their village.  She converted a small portion of their house into a small store.  However, due to financial difficulties, she was not able to improve her store for she used some of the capital for the education of her children.  But still, she was thankful because even her store was closed for some time it did not affect her from sending her children to school.  For this reason, Juanita is seeking for financial support for the re-opening of her store.  She is requesting to borrow a loan amount of PHP 13, 000.00 as business capital. She said that she will be very grateful if she will be given the chance to avail a loan because it will really help her family and in reaching their dreams. 

Juanita was born in the province of Cagayan in Barangay San Roque, Centro Enrile. She is 40 years old, married and have three children: Eudato, 19 years old, a college undergraduate but working as a soldier; Jay – Ar, 17 years old, college student and Janice, 15 years old, a sophomore high school student.  Juanita is hoping that they may able to support their studies through her hard work and patience.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Yessenia Elizabeth

texts.es: Yessenia Elizabeth L. D. L. vive en Lourdes, municipio del departamento D. La Libertad.  Hace ya nueve años, Yessenia trajo al mundo  a su único hijo, Melvin, quien actualmente cursa tercer grado.  Tras el nacimiento D. su hijo, Yessenia cambio por completo sus expectativas D. vida, y tan solo dos años después  D. dar a luz, abrió un negocio propio. Una sala D. belleza que mediante esfuerzo y apoyo D. su esposo, ha logrado sacar adelante. Yessenia y su esposo solicitan un préstamo, para comprar nuevos productos  para obtener mayores ingresos que ayudaran a construir un respaldo económico.
texts.en:
Yessenia Elizabeth L. D. L. lives in Lourdes, a town in the department of La Libertad. For nine years, Yessenia has given the world to her only son, Melvin, who is in third graD. now. Because of the birth of her son, Yessenia completely changed her expectations of life and only two years later, she opened her own business. She has a beauty salon and through effort and the support of her husband, she has succeeded in going forward. Yessenia and her husband are requesting a loan to buy new products so that she can have more earnings that will help her build a financial base.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her beauty salon

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica A. bakes and sells bread in Abura. Monica has received schooling through Junior High. She is married and has 4 dependants. Monica has been baking and selling bread for 2 years. She is responsible for paying all of the housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used to buy flour and other ingredients for baking. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to re-invest.

loans.use: To buy flour and other ingredients for baking.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa S. is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: three sons and a daughter. All are currently in the senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Her husband works in a local sawmill firm. Theresa trades in vegetables and other food items. She sells vegetables such as onions, garden eggs, pepper, tomatoes, etc. on a tabletop at the market square. She buys her goods from nearby farming communities and Kumasi. She also treks to other markets to sell. Theresa has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Nkwain

texts.en:
M. is married and the mother of  five children, two of whom are under the age of fifteen years. She was born on the 8th of September 1963. M. and her family live in a four-room house in the Baingo neighborhood in the Belo subdivision in the North Region of Cameroon. Because she is the breadwinner of the family, she finds it very difficult to take care of the family single handedly. In addition, she sustained a serious accident and she was robed by thieves.  Faced with her low level of education, she could not secure a good job for herself. Thus, she embarked on the sale of second-hand dresses, which she has been doing for 2 years.

Becoming a member of GHAPE in 2008, she was fortunate to have acquired some techniques which have helped her to improve her business. She has proven successful with her previous loan, which she had conscientiously managed and repaid. Her business is going to help her community in that she will be able to supply the market with second-hand dresses. She plans to repay the loan in 12 months and repayment shall commence on the date of disbursement.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand dresses

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.es: Ana Leticia M. D. C. resiD. en el municipio D. apopa en el departamento D. San Salvador.  Ana tiene 31 años D. edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos; Oscar D. 12 años y Saúl D. 5 años D. edad. Ana recibe el apoyo económico D. su esposo ya que él trabaja, pero esto no hace que Ana se conforme y es por ello que ha montado su propio negocio; el cual maneja con mucho orden y con tres años D. experiencia en el mismo, se trata D. un chalet ubicado en un centro escolar D. Apopa donD. obtiene buenas ganancias ya que hay mucha afluencia D. personas y no se encuentra con competencia  alguna, el deseo D. Ana es surtir mas su pequeño local para ayudar a incrementar sus ventas, es por eso que solicita este crédito.
texts.en:
Ana Leticia M. D. C. lives in Apopa in the department of San Salvador. Ana is 31 years old, lives with her husband, and is the mother of two children: Oscar who is 12 years old and Saúl who is 5 years old. Ana’s husband helps her economically since he is working, but this doesn’t mean that Ana wants to stay at home. This is why she started her own business. Ana has a cafe in one of Apopa’s schools. She has been in business for three years and is very organized. She makes a good income because there are many affluent people and no competition. Ana needs a loan because she would like to stock her small store so she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
La señora Nora es socia del Banco Comunal “Chijuyo Copapujo”, ubicado en el Centro Poblado de Chijuyo, Copapujo del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil casada, es madre de 2 hijos. Juana estudió secundaria incompleta (4to grado), vive en el centro poblado de Chijuyo Copapujo.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi 02 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que utilizó como capital para la fabricación de sogas.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella va a adquirir cabuya (material para elaborar sogas) en el distrito de Desaguadero, las sogas las vende en las ferias de ganadería.  Ella también se dedica a la crianza de ganado mayor.

Su deseo es poner otro negocio ya que hay mucha competencia.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y  los ahorros.
texts.en:
Nora is a member of the “Chijuyo Copapujo” communal bank located in Chijuyo, El Collao district, Puno department. She is 27 years old, married with 2 children. She reached 4th grade, but did not complete her school studies. She lives in Chijuyo Copapujo. Nora has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for nearly 2 years. Her first loan was for 500 soles, which she used as capital for rope making. Currently, she needs an additional loan of 1500 soles to purchase materials to make rope in the Desaguadero district. She sells the rope in the livestock markets. She also works raising cattle. Her dream is to become involved in another business, as there is much competition in this one. She enjoys the [communal bank] meetings, and having savings.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase material to make rope

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes B. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 64 years old. Lourdes is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Lourdes owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of spices in the local community. Lourdes is just starting this business.

In 2009, Lourdes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lourdes from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in renovating the business

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
José Alfredo L. L. es un señor de 50 años, vecino de Los Tijos de Upala, localizado en la provincia de Alajuela. Es una comunidad rural  con una extensión relativamente grande, con topografía semi montañosa ubicada en Costa Rica, Centroamérica.  La comunidad se dedica especialmente a la agricultura de granos básicos, y en menor escala a la ganadería. Vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos.

Desde hace  varios años, don José Alfredo se ha desarrollado como microempresario, tiene un pequeño terreno en el cual  se dedica a la siembra de Ñampi, un tubérculo de agradable sabor, rico en nutrientes, de procesamiento agroindustrial amplio y de gran demanda tanto en Costa Rica como en otros países. Dice que gracias a este proyecto ha aprendido mucho y también le ha dado oportunidad de desarrollarse personalmente y profesionalmente.

Actualmente don José Alfredo está solicitando un préstamo de ¢680,000 (seiscientos ochenta mil colones), para ayudarse con  la preparación del suelo, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del ñampi. 

Con esta inversión espera lograr una buena cosecha, con un producto de características apropiadas para conseguir un precio de venta alto. Ya que desea realizar más proyectos en el futuro y también mejorar las condiciones de su familia.

Don José Alfredo forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Los Tijos, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será  su quinto crédito y dice que con el espera seguir creciendo como microempresario y sacar su negocio adelante.
texts.en:
José Alfredo L. L. is a 50 year old man who lives in Los Tijos de Upala in Alajuela province. It is a rather widespread rural community with a semi-mountainous topography in Costa Rica, Central America. The community focuses on growing basic grain and on a small scale, livestock. He lives with his wife and two children. For the past few years José Alfredo has developed his business. He has a small plot of land where he grows Ñampi, a small tuber with a pleasant flavor, rich in nutrients, with wide agro-industrial application and is in great demand in Costa Rica as well as other countries. He says that thanks to this project he has learned a lot and it also has provided him the opportunity to develop himself personally and professionally. Today José Alfredo is seeking a loan for ¢680,000 colones to help prepare the farmland, buy seeds, fertilizers, and other items needed to guarantee a successful planting of ñampi. With this investment he hopes to have a good harvest, with products worthy of a high price. He would like to do more projects in the future and also improve his family’s living conditions. José Alfredo is a member of the Los Tijos Communal Credit Business, one of 100 EDESA member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be his fifth loan and he says that he hopes to continue growing his business and keep it moving forward successfully.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy items to plant, grow, and harvest ñampi

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 23 years old Magreth M. from Mbeya. She is married  with one child, of one year Magreth has been running a clothes business since 2006. Client’s business is purchasing and selling clothes. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week Magreth currently earns about 60 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase clothes in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to improve quality and range of product. Magreth thanks you for your support!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix tiene 40 años, vive con su pareja y madre de sus 7 hijos, en su casa propia. Desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado a la agricultura, actividad que le satisface mucho, él siembra varios productos, ya sea papas, arvejas y algunas plantas medicinales. Una vez cosechados los comercializa en el mercado de mayoristas de la ciudad y tanto en la cosecha como para la venta cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, quién hábilmente negocia sacos tras sacos de sus productos, mientras Félix se dedica a contabilizar y verificar el dinero. Su deseo a futuro es comprar sus propias chacras, pues actualmente tiene que pagar arriendos por los terrenos que utiliza.

Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y durante los ciclos anteriores ha sido el primero en pagar. Asimismo, se siente muy bien en su banco comunal, puesto que se entiende con todos sus compañeros. El dinero que solicita le servirá para comprar fertilizantes químicos para sus posteriores siembras.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy flower seeds.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
la señora Blanca V. tiene 29 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Marlon Joneli Rodas quien trabaja en una llantera,  tienen 03 hijos, Blanca se dedica a la compra venta 
de lacteos, leche para hacer charamuscas y churros. tiene su negocio en su casa de habitacion, asi pasa pendiente de sus hijos que estan pequeños, en el lugar donde vive Blanca la temperatura es bien elevada, casi siempre esta entre los 35 a 40 grados, esto hace que las personas busquen productos helados y las charamuscas se venden bien.
esta solicitando el prestamo para compra de 4 cargas de maiz, maisillo, 100 libras de quesillo, y 100 de mantequilla.
su meta es poder tener un negocio grande en el cual pueda vender de todo tipo de productos lacteos.
texts.en:
Blanca Velásquez, 29, is in a common law marriage with Marlon Joneli Rodas. He works in a tire shop. They have three children. Blanca buys and sells dairy products, milk to make popsicles, and churros. She has her business in her house. That way she can take care of their children, who are small. In the place where Blanca lives the temperature is high, almost always between 35 to 40 degrees. This makes the people look for frozen products, and the popsicles sell well. She is asking for a loan to buy four loads of corn, sorghum, 100 pounds of “quesillo” (local cheese), and 100 of butter. Her goal is to be able to have a large store where she could sell all types of dairy products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy milk, fruit, bags, churros, "quesillo" (local cheese), butter, and corn

loans.name: Elizabeth Macedonia

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 31 años de edad, es casada vive con su hijo en su casa propia. Ella tiene amplia experiencia en el negocio de alquiler de mototaxis, Elizabeth comenzó con una unidad la cual compro con ahorros, ahora posee 2 unidades de las cuales una de ellas la maneja su esposo. Elizabeth con los ingresos que tiene por el alquiler de las mototaxis construyo una parte de su casa la cual se destruyo con el terremoto. Ella ahorra al máximo el dinero que obtiene de las mototaxis, el cual le ayuda para la educación de hijo. El sueño a futuro de Elizabeth es que su hijo logre terminar sus estudios en la universidad y poder culminar con la construccion de su casa. Solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas para una de las motos y para el registro de su vehículo.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 31 years old. She is married and lives in her own home along with her son. She has extensive experience in the business of renting moto-taxis (motorcycles with an attached cab for passengers). Elizabeth began with one vehicle, which she purchased from her savings. She now has two vehicles, one of which is driven by her husband. With the income she receives from her moto-taxi business, she has rebuilt part of her home, which was destroyed by an earthquake. She saves as much money as possible from her earnings from the moto-taxis, which helps her pay for her son's education. Elizabeth's dream for the future is that her son will be able to complete his studies with a university degree and that she will be able to finish rebuilding her home. She is requesting this loan to purchase tires for one of the moto-taxis and to register her vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintaining her vehicles and paying vehicle registration fees

loans.name: Maritess

texts.en:
Maritess Q. is from the village of Manolo  Fortich  Bukidnon. She is 37 years old, married, and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Maritess owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. She is just starting this business.

In 2009, Maritess joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Maritess from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa has owned a barber shop since 2007. He is a 27-year-old man who lives in Ramallah, Palestine with his parents. Alaa knows how to treat his clients and does good work.

Alaa requested a loan from Ryada in order to change the décor of his salon and purchase accessories. In the future, he plans on improving his business by purchasing more sophisticated tools. He would appreciate your assistance very much.

loans.use: To change the décor of his salon and purchase accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more maize flour, sugar, salt and rice in bulk

loans.name: Janett

texts.es:
Janett es socia del Banco Comunal Juanito.
Janett es soltera, tiene 32 años y 1 hija, Janett vende ropa a pedido, productos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, además vende cosméticos por catálogos, la mayoría de sus ventas son al crédito.
Janett necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones y polos.
El sueño de Janett es tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Janett is a member of the communal bank Juanito. She is single, 32, with 1 daughter. She sells clothing by order, things that she presents to friends and family members. She also sells cosmetics from catalogs. The majority of her sales are by credit. Janett needs a loan of $225 to invest in the purchase of pants and polo shirts. Janett's dream is to have her own shop.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pants and shirts

loans.name: Marisita

texts.en:
A sari-sari store owner from Bolinsong, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental is our featured entrepreneur. She is Mrs. Marisita G., 39 years of age and married to Roliper G. who is a driver. With her in the picture is her customer. They were blessed with five children. Two of their children are now adults, two are of school age and one is an infant. Because of this condition, she felt financial hardships and wanted to help her husband.  She undoubtedly joined the cooperative just this year. As a newly recognized member, she is given the privilege of borrowing P5,000 as capital for the re-opening of her sari-sari store. She is hoping that this time her business will prosper and, by means of this business, she will be able to send all her children to school for a good future. She also hopes that they will be able to meet their daily needs and set aside savings for future use and loan repayments.  

About PMPC:
