Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her Sari-sari store

loans.name: Ie

texts.en:
Mrs. Ie S., 58 years old, is a good homemaker who cooks tasty meals and cares for her children. She has six children: four are married and have already started new homes while the remaining two are single. Most of the children are employed at different jobs. They sometimes provide their income to help contribute to the family. Ie S. was not available when the photo taken so her husband is shown instead.

To earn a living, Ie S. and her husband cultivate crops which they sell to a buyer when the crops mature. Due to the fact that the farm is far from the watering system, Ie S. is hardly able to irrigate her crops. Thus, she has asked for a loan to buy an irrigation pump for her crops.

loans.use: To buy an irrigatation pump for her crops

loans.name: Garneth Ange

texts.en:
Garneth Ange is from the village of Lumbayao, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 26 years old, is married, and has two children which are now both in kindergarten school.

Garneth Ange owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She is just starting this business.

In 2010, Garneth Ange joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her first from PMPC.

Garneth Ange plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Mrs. Sam Art Soy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of twenty people who live in Kandoeng Thum village in Takeo province. Mrs. S. Art S. is the village bank president selected by all the members, who will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Vanna Sou is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land to grow rice to feed her family. She has a lot of free time, S. she wants to start a new business, but does not have enough money. Thus, Mrs. Vanna Sou decided to apply for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Her husband is a teacher in the local school. She is the mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local public school, while the fourth is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: 16 De Julio Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal 16 D. JULIO  en su Secuencia 3, está formado por 9 clientes, todas mujeres , todas  las socias son vecinas D. la Zona D. Kupini, las socias se dedican a la venta D. diversos productos como ser, D. ropa, comida, venta D. verduras, y la confección y venta D. delantales, condimentos   y una D. las socias trabaja con el hermano en cerrajería . En la secuencia anterior todas cancelaron  aunque tuvieron retrasos por problemas que atravesaron D. forma personal  pero terminaron D. cancelar hasta el ultimo pago.

La Sra. Carmen Rosa es presidenta del banco se dedica venta D. comida en lugares concurridos o lugares donD. se realice algún acontecimiento en las diferentes zonas , cuenta con esta actividad hace 5 años, La señora vive con su esposo hace 40 años  aproximadamente, vive con sus  dos  nietos,  ya por diferentes circunstancias los nietos se quedaron bajo su cargo, la señora Carmen ayuda a su marido para  la mantención D. toda su familia, siendo que cuenta con pocos recursos económicos, los créditos obtenidos D. la institución, le apoyaron para salir adelante junto a su familia y a sus hijos el préstamo será destinado para acceder comprar llantas para el taxi que se hace cargo el esposo y lo que reste para aumentar el capital para su negocio. En el banco comunal se ha destacado como una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos y muy alegre.

La Sra. Guadalupe es socia antigua vive en la zona D. kupini   no esta casada vive con sus hijos , asume el rol D. padre y madre para sus hijos siendo que ellos están  en una etapa D. crecimiento necesita mas recursos económicos para su alimentación y sus vestimenta razón  por la que la señora tiene que trabajar, ella al igual que su familia viven en una casa ocupando dos cuartos es una familia D. bajos recursos económicos el crédito solicitado es para la compra D. tela para la elaboración D. delantales y en adelante poder conformar un pequeña microempresa D. costura, Es una D. las representantes en su banco comunal, que ha sido elegida por su  responsabilidad y el compañerismo que ha demostrado en su proceso D. capacitación.

La Sra. Alicia es socia antigua en La Banca comunal  es reelegida como secretaria D. actas por las cualidades que tiene, ella trabaja junto a su hermano  en cerrajería  comparten el negocio D. manera que el crédito esta destinado al aumento D. capital en dicho negocio. Su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa y para ayudar en los gastos D. la familia la señora decidió trabajar con el hermano desD. hace 3 años adquiriendo ella experiencia en dicho negocio. Su familia esta conformada por su esposos y sus tres hijos. Su meta es tener su propio negocio D. cerrajería y así poder independizase para lograr secar a sus hijos profesionales, con el dinero del credito comprara arco para soldar.

Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion dle credito.
texts.en:
The 16 D. Julio Communal Bank, in its third loan cycle, is maD. up of nine members, all women. They are neighbors in the Kupini zone of La Paz. The members have diverse businesses, such as sales of clothing, food, produce, and condiments; the making and sale of aprons; and one member works with her brother in a locksmith shop. In their previous loan cycle, all members maD. their payments, even if personal problems caused a delay. At the end, they completed all their payments. Carmen Rosa, the president of the communal bank, works selling food in busy locations or at events around town. She has had this business for five years. Carmen lives with her husband of 40 years and their two grandchildren, who are in their care. Carmen helps her husband with the maintenance of the family, as they are of low economic resources. The loans from Emprender have helped them and their family to get ahead. This loan will be used to buy tires for her husband’s taxi, and for working capital for her business. In the communal bank, Carmen stands out as a responsible, cheerful person, always punctual in her payments. Guadalupe is a long-time member who lives in the Kupini zone. She is not married and lives with her children. She assumes the roles of both mother and father for her children, who at this stage of life need more resources for food and clothing. They are a low-income family and the all live in two rooms. Guadalupe will use this loan to buy cloth for making aprons and continue building her small sewing business. She is one of the representatives of the communal bank, and has been chosen for the responsibility and team spirit she has demonstrated. Alicia is also a long-time member of the communal bank. She has been re-elected as recording secretary for the qualities she possesses. Alicia works with her brother in a locksmith shop. She began working with her brother three years ago, gaining experience in this business. She is married and has three children. Her goal is to have her own locksmith business to be independent and help her children become well educated. With the money from this loan, she will buy an arc welder. All the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence represented by this loan.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: K. Wilson is a permanent resident of the Kafujo cell Katojo, Bubaare, Kashari Mbarara district. He is 50 years of age, has a poultry business and is a married man with three children. He is using the loan to purchase more poultry chicks, feed, medications, etc. in order to expand his business. He is a hard-working businessman whose dream is to prosper.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry chicks, feed, medications, etc.

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.es:
Eloisa M.  Cruz  es una señora de 56 años de edad la cual vive con su esposo y su  hijo y en una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa con grandes paisajes, presenta una gran humedad y además se encuentra sobre la carretera muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, tubérculos y  naranja. 

Desde hace 4 años que doña Eloisa inició un negocio de costura y confección de ropa. Ella remienda y elabora diferentes tipos de prendas de vestir especialmente uniformes de enfermeros, los cuales vende en negocios de la comunidad y sus alrededores e incluso la llegan a buscar a su casa. Su microempresa ha ayudado a que la condición de vida de su familia haya mejorado considerablemente. Dice que el poder brindar un buen servicio a las personas y cumplir con sus exigencias, son la base del éxito del negocio.

Actualmente doña Eloisa requiere un préstamo de ¢654,000 (seiscientos cincuenta y cuatro mil colones) para comprar una máquina especial para coser y materiales como telas, hilos, etc. Con esta inversión espera poder incrementar su producción y mejorar la calidad de los  productos. Afirma que gracias a este préstamo podrá atraer a más clientes, ofrecer mejores alternativas y mejorar considerablemente la calidad de sus productos.

Doña Elaisa es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y se encuentra muy entusiasmada ya que con el crédito su negocio mejora al igual que sus ingresos
texts.en:
Eloisa M. Cruz is a 56 year-old woman who lives with her husband and her son in a community called Hernández, located in Los Chiles in the Alajuela province. This community is known to be a mountainous area with a beautiful countryside. It is an area with a humid climate that it is found along the highway near the northern frontier of this country. The main economic activities here are livestock production and agriculture, specifically the cultivation of staple grains, tubers and oranges. Four years ago, Eloisa started a dressmaking business. She mends and makes various types of garments, especially nurses uniforms, which she sells in businesses in the community and surrounding areas. Also, people come to her home to buy her products. Her small business has helped her family's living conditions improve considerably. She says that her ability to provide good service to people and meet their demands is the basis of the success of her business. Currently Eloisa needs a loan of 654,000 Costa Rican Colones to buy a special type of sewing machine, and materials such as fabric, thread, etc. With this investment she hopes to be able to increase her production and improve the quality of her products. She states that thanks to this loan, she will be able to attract more customers, offer better alternatives, and substantially improve the quality of her products. Eloisa is a member of the "Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo," one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, and she is very enthusiastic since with this loan her business will improve along with her income.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric and equipment needed to make clothing

loans.name: Rosa Amanda

texts.es:
Doña Rosa tiene la edad de 44 años, madre de un hijo, vive en el bario Hialeah desde hace varios años, 
Es madre soltera ha tenido que trabajar mucho para poder dar lo necesario a su hijo, hoy cuenta con el apoyo de el,  ya que trabajando. El trabajo de doña Rosa es en despacho en un cafetín del colegio el cual lleva dos años. Pues anteriormente trabajaba en una universidad.
El trabajo es estable lo que desea que no surjan cambios que afecten su trabajo ya que desea seguir mejorando su casa ya que le falta el repello, hacer la cocina, pintar,  pero lo que mas le urge es poder construir el baño de concreto para una mejor higiene y mejor aseo personal. 
Para esta mejora comprara bloques, arena, cemento, madera, zinc para lograr la construcción. Contenta por que lo esta logrando mediante el financiamiento que es el medio por el cual se sale adelante por sus plazos.
texts.en:
44-year old Sra. Rosa has a son and has lived in the neighbourhood of Hialeah for several years. She is a single mother and has had to work hard to provide for her son. Nowadays he helps her while she is working. Rosa works in the office of a college cafeteria; she’s been doing this for two years. She used to work in a university. It is steady work, and she hopes that no changes take place that will affect the job as she wants to continue making improvements to her house. The walls need to be plastered and painted, and a kitchen built, but the her greatest wish is to be able to make a concrete bathroom for greater cleanliness and personal hygiene. To make these improvements, Rosa will buy concrete blocks, sand, cement, wood, and zinc sheeting. She is happy that the loan will enable her to get on with this work and make progress in life.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials for a bathroom

loans.name: Mary Njeri

texts.en:
Mary Njeri is a lady of 40 years who is married to Moses Chege. Together, they have four children aged between 6 and 20 years.

Mary is a farmer who deals in both vegetables and animal farming. She then sells the produce from her greengrocery shop to her customers who are residents of the area and also sells milk to her local cooperative society. Out of these businesses she is able to make Kshs 30,000 every month as profits.

Mary joined KADET after a marketing initiative in her area. She joined others and they formed a group and now she has applied for her first loan which she plans to use to buy animal feeds for her dairy cattle.

Mary would like, in future, to educate all her children to university level and buy her own piece of land which she will use to build a modern house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase animal feeds for her dairy cattle

loans.name: Hernandez Cabrera

texts.es: El Sr. Hernandez Cabrera J. P. tiene 56 años de edad. Vive en casa propia. Es padre soltero y vive con sus hijas siendo estas personas independientes. Trabaja como obrero de campo en la Empresa North Bay Produce desde hace 10 años. Quiere terminar con la construcción de su vivienda. Es una  persona muy responsable y trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo pretende tener una mejor calidad de vida para el y su familia. Su sueño es poder concluir con la construcción de su casa y darle una buena calidad de vida a sus hijas y nietos. El Sr. Hernandez Cabrera J. P., agradece la ayuda que le brindemos para lograr hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Sr. Hernandez Cabrera J. P. is 56 years old and lives in his own home. He is a single father and lives with his daughters who are independent. For the past ten years, he has worked as a field laborer for the North Bay Produce Company. Sr. Hernandez Cabrera wants to finish the construction of his home. He is a very responsible and hardworking person who strives to make life better for himself and his family. He hopes to finish his house and provide a good quality of life for his daughters and grandchildren. Sr. Hernandez Cabrera is grateful for the assistance provided so that he can turn his dreams into reality.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the construction of his house

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La Señora Margarita  es un cliente que ya saco varios créditos en la institución, ella tiene dos actividades la primera es la venta de ropa en la zona 16 de julio su negocio que ahora esta activo es la venta de maquinas ella compra maquinas por parte primero compra la cabeza y luego el motor, ella se dedica tanto  a la venta como también al armado, este trabajo es considerado duro por el gran peso que tiene las maquinas, su esposo es importador de maquinas industriales por lo cual el no se encuentra en su casa, ellos tienen dos hijos que son aun pequeños, la labor de la señora margarita es sacrificado por el esfuerzo que realiza la cliente, el crédito será invertido en la compra de maquinas japonesas, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada  en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Margarita is a client that has already taken out several loans with Emprender. She works in two areas. The first is in clothing sales in the 16 de julio zone. Her business that is currently active is in the sales of machines. She purchases machines by part; she first purchases the head and then the motor. She works both in sales and in the assembly. This job is considered to be hard because of the heavy weight of the machines. Her husband is an importer of industrial machines and as a result, he is not at home. They have two children that are still young. Margarita sacrifices a great deal of effort for her work. The loan will be invested in the purchase of Japanese machines. She is very grateful for Emprender and Kiva for the trust provided in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of Japanese machines.

loans.name: Lilly

texts.en:
Lilly S. is 21 and married with no children.  She owns a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Ferila has 3 years of experience in this business.  Ferila needs a loan of WST$1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 380 talas or US $158 per week) to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

In 2010, Lilly joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Lilly's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Marianella Ysabel

texts.es: La Sra. Marianella Ysabel H. E. es soltera, vive con su madre y mantiene un negocio de venta de molidos y condimentos en el mercado Toledo hace dos años. Requiere del préstamo parra invertir en el negocio en un local que ha alquilado.
texts.en:
Ms. Marianella is single and lives with her mother. For the past two years she has had a business selling ground spices and condiments in the Toledo market. She needs this loan in order to invest in her business in a location that she has rented.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita G. is from Dipolog City. She is 60 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Lolita owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2006, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Aniana

texts.en:
Aniana O. is married to a fisherman.  She is blessed with a daughter who is now 17 years old. Her only dream in life is for her daughter, who is now in her sophomore year in college, to finish her degree and then find a good job and improve her quality of life. 

Aniana joined Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (a partner of KIVA in the Philippines) to gain access to capital for her store, which she started 8 years ago. Her profits from this business help her to meet her family’s daily needs, especially the expenses incurred by her daughter in going to school. Now Aniana has decided to start selling rice, so she has applied for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy 10 sacks of rice (at PHP 1,800 per sack), sacks of charcoal, and cases of soft drinks and liquor. She plans to develop her business into a full-fledged grocery store someday, and hopes that KIVA lenders will support her financially as she works to turn her plans and goals in life into realities.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, charcoal, soft drinks, and liquor

loans.name: Debbie

texts.en:
Debbie P. is a 49-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures:  a used clothing and a RTW (ready-to-wear clothing) business. She lives in Poblacion, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,100. 

Debbie is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can fund her business activities. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Debbie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to fund the operation of her used clothing business

loans.name: Julia Noemí

texts.es: Doña Julia, tiene 26 años de edad, es casada, de oficio comerciante, tiene 1 hijo, cursó el tercer grado básico, es una persona emprendedora porque se dedica a la elaboración de bordados de blusas de marcador, con esta actividad ha logrado salir adelante con el negocio que tiene, quiere ampliar su capital de trabajo, ya que para este fin de año llega a tener demanda el producto que ella elabora. Tiene como objetivo principal agrandar su negocio y asi poder tener mejores ingreso y una mejor condicion de vida.
texts.en: Doña Julia, 26, is married with 1 child.  She works as a merchant.  She only has three years of schooling.  She is an enterprising woman and operates a business embroidering blouses.  The business is her livelihood now and she wants to increase her working capital before the end of the year because she expects demand for her work to grow.  Her goal is to grow her business so that she can increase her income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Maiama

texts.fr: Madame Mariama D. habite dans la communauté rurale de Bambilor. Elle est  mariée et âgée  de 38 ans. Pour disposer de revenus réguliers madame D. a choisi d’évoluer dans le secteur du commerce depuis l’année  dernière. Ainsi elle s’active dans l’achat et la vente de parfums et de savons de toilettes. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Bambilor depuis mai 2010. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour le renforcement de son  stock de produits. Ce financement lui permettra de seconder son mari  dans les charges au sein du foyer telles que les frais de scolarisation des enfants, et autres dépenses diverses.
texts.en: Mrs. Mariama D. lives in the rural community of Bambilor. She is married and 38 years old. In order to earn a regular income, Mrs. D. chose to join the retail sector last year. Her business is selling perfumes and soaps. She has been a member of the Bambilor fund since May 2010. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to strengthen her stock of products. This funding will enable her to help her husband with her family's expenses, such as school fees for the children and other miscellaneous expenses.

loans.use: Strengthen stock of goods for sale.

loans.name: Carmen Erlita

texts.es:
Erlita es una madre de familia de 36 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Pacasmayo, una zona bastante comercial que pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y que se encuentra ubicado en la región La Libertad, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Erlita cuenta con un puesto de venta de verduras en el mercado del distrito de Pacasmayo, ella ya lleva más de quince años trabajando en este rubro y debido a ello se ha hecho conocida y tiene una clientela fija que prefiere su negocio por la calidad de atención que brinda. Actualmente ella desea incrementar su inventario de productos para responder de mejor modo a la demanda que posee, por ello ha decidido solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer que gusta de mucho de la labor que realiza ya que le hace sentirse activa y porque también gracias a ella puede ayudar a su familia a solventar sus gastos económicos diariamente. Su mas grande deseo es verlos progresar y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Erlita is a 36-year-old mother who lives with her husband and her children in the Pacasmayo district, a commercial zone in the Pacasmayo province, La Libertad region, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.  She has a vegetable stand in the Pacasmayo market, and has already spent more than 15 years working in this area. As a result, she is well known with a steady clientele who prefer her business because of the quality of service she provides.  She is a woman who likes work that makes her feel active.  Thanks to this, she can help her family pay their daily expenses.  Her greatest wish is to see her family progress and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To increase vegetable stand inventory

loans.name: Fiorella Milagros

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON DE SANTIAGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Fiorella; ella tiene 24 años de edad, soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de juguetes, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria , vende al público en general y a sus amistades también ,la socia es estudiante de la carrera de economía de la Universidad particular Andina del Cusco y le falta poco tiempo para terminar su carrera por ello esta muy entusiasmada y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería para su negocio.

La socia feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Fiorella belongs to the “Patron de Santiago” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Fiorella is 24 years old and single.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business buying and selling toys.  She makes her sales as a street trader.  She sells to the general public and to her friends.  Fiorella is also an economics student at the Universidad Particular Andina del Cusco and she has nearly finished her degree course.  For this reason, she is very excited and has a great desire to get ahead.

Fiorella is requesting a loan so that she can buy merchandise for her business.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco.

Her name is Nilda, and she is 33 years old.  Nancy lives with her common law husband and has two children.  Her business is selling shoes wholesale in Cusco, Peru.  She is taking out the loan to reinvest in her shoe sale business, where she buys shoes such as sandals, tennis shoes, dress shoes, and kid´s shoes in bulk from distributors.  

She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in Wholesale Shoe Business

loans.name: Kun

texts.en:
Kun S. is a 43-year-old mother caring for four children, one is married and the other three are single. One of them is working in the garment industry in Phnom Penh City as a sewing worker, and has a fixed salary of $50 per month. 

Kun S. and her husband are recycling sellers – they buy used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then resells them in bulk to other countries. The used goods they deal in are mostly leftover electrical wires. 

Kun S. is looking for a loan to use as capital to buy more stock to increase her profits.  With the remainder of the loan, she will use to add to her savings to buy a used motorbike to use as transport for the business.

loans.use: To buy more electrical wires for sale.

loans.name: Pin

texts.en: Mrs. Pin P. is 28 years old and lives in Chong Angkar village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land where she cultivates rice, which she sells to support her family. It is time to plant rice in her rice field. To improve rice production, Mrs. Pin P. is requesting a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer, and to have someone plow her rice field. Her husband sells mats at a local market, which enables him to earn some money to support his family. This couple supports two children, one of whom is studying in a local public school. The other is 4 years old.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer, and to plow her rice field

loans.name: Ama Nyame Agnes

texts.en: Ama Nyame Agnes E. prepares gari for sale in Dompoase near Elmina, Cape Coast. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer. She helps her husband educate, feed and clothe the children. Ama has been in gari production for 9 years. Her loan will be used to buy fresh cassava to process for sale. Her business objective is to build a storehouse for the gari. To prepare gari, she gets raw fresh cassavas from the market. She washes and peels the cassavas and then sends it to the mill to be milled into dough. She puts the dough in a sack and places heavy stones on it. The stones are placed to drain the starch out of the dough. She leaves the dough for a day or two depending on the weight of the stones. After this process, she stir fries the gari in a pan on a fire (she is stir frying the gari in the photo). The gari is then left to cool and bagged in small bags for sale.

loans.use: To buy fresh cassava to process for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of construction material

loans.name: Las Rosas De Pabatoc Group

texts.en:
Alicia is 47 years old and married. She has 6 children and all are currently attending school. Alicia went to school through 6th graD. before starting to work for a living. Using her own savings and with help from her husband, Alicia started a business selling women´s blouses. She has been in the business for 12 years. Alicia is requesting a loan to purchase materials to help her business grow. She hopes to increase her sales and expand her business in the future by selling different types of merchandise. 

Alicia is part of the group Las Rosas D. Pabatoc. Members of this group are involved in activities including: typical clothing sales, jeans-making, other clothing sales, sporting goods sales and animal raising and selling.

loans.use: purchase clothing materials to grow the business

loans.name: Ayidote Group

texts.en:
The Ayidote group consists of three women who live in the same neighborhood and attend the same church. This is their second loan with ALIDE, following successful repayment of the first. They have agreed to support each other in business and through loan repayments.

Odile (with her hand raised in the photo) is 31 years old and lives in Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital. She and her husband Comlan support their two children, both of whom have received education.

For the past six years, Odile has been selling bottles from her home. This loan will enable her to purchase additional stock from Lomé, the capital of the neighboring country Togo. Her aim in the long term is to grow her business. Her strongest point as an entrepreneur is her welcoming nature.

loans.use: to purchase bottles for resale

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos  a la señora Diana, ella tiene 21 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de dos años. Su esposo es comerciante.

El crédito que ella realiza es para el negocio de su esposo. Él se dedica a la compra y venta de tagua (producto que se utiliza para fabricar botones, artesanías y otras muchas variedades de productos) trabaja cuatro días a la semana, él  se desplaza en las mañanas hasta los campos donde consigue este producto más barato para luego llevarlo a Manta donde les vende a comerciantes que luego llevan a otras ciudades. Nos cuenta que lleva en este negocio ya por 4 años y que le va bien.

Este crédito es para comprar tagua. Este es su quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le agrada porque le dan la posibilidad de ayudar a su esposo con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The village bank Los Corrales meets every 15 days in a place called Los Corrales, a few minutes from the city of Montecristi which has a rich prehistoric culture. Here, the majority of the residents have different economic activities like artisan crafts and general business.

Here we met Diana, who is 21 years old, married and has a two year old son. Her husband is a merchant. 

The loan will be used for her husband's business. He buys and sells tagua (a product used to make buttons, artisan crafts and many other varied products). He works four days a week. In the mornings he heads to the fields where he gets the product cheaper, and then later carries it to Manta where he sells it to the merchants who will take it to other cities. He tells us that he has been doing this for four years now, and that it's going well.

The loan is to buy tagua. This is Diana's fifth cycle with the village bank and she's grateful that it gives her the possibility of helping her husband with the loans. 

Her dream is to give her son the best.

loans.use: to buy tagua nuts

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Lien T. L. is 52 years old with 3 children. She is providing an education for two children. She started farming when her children were young and mostly focused on growing rice, vegetables and raising chickens for meat, because these agricultural endeavors would support her family's diet.  As a client of our credit program since 2006, she has used loans effectively to expand her farming. This has resulted in higher loan sizes year after year. Now, she needs a loan of 8,938,000 VND to buy fertilizer for the next crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the next crop.

loans.name: Dominique

texts.en:
Dominique is 28 years old. He is single. He owns a shop in which he sells a variety of items such as cooking oil, beans, rice and other items that are commonly wanted at home. With this business he could afford to buy himself a piece of land and equipment for installing electricity. 

Dominique is requesting a loan to buy more items to fill his store, such as rice, beans and cooking oil, and make more profits in order to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy items such as beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua, a divorced mother of two children, is a fishmonger who also sells fruits at Elmina, near Nkontrodo. Efua uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills. She is requesting this loan to purchase more fruits to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to save to build a snack bar.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mrs Keo is a businesswoman who earns a low income. She has been operating her sales business since the beginning of 2010. 

In the front her house she has a kiosk where she sells different kinds of goods. She sells items such as soft drinks, beauty products and some cooking ingredients. 

Mrs Keo is married to 21-year-old Mman, who works as a furniture maker. The couple is blessed with a young child who is still not enrolled in school. 

In order to earn extra profits, Mrs Keo will be using the loan she has requested to help her husband to purchase the equipment for making tables and chairs.

loans.use: to assist her husband to purchase equipment to make tables and chairs.

loans.name: Silvia Vigail

texts.es: Silvia Vigail reside con sus hijos los cuales asisten a una escuela cerca de la localidad. Ella posee un negocio de crianza de cerdos es con el cual  mantiene a flote su hogar; ya tiene muchos clientes pues  los cerdos que ella vende son de calidad y a un buen precio; para Silvia es un negocio muy rentable y es por eso que siempre está muy dedicada al trabajo, una de sus metas es que crezca su venta, por eso que siempre está adelante de la competencia y se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar concentrado para alimentar a los animales; así lograra que sus clientes siempre obtengan lo que necesitan y confíen en su eficiencia de su labor; Silvia tiene esperanza que de esta forma le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Silvia Vigail lives with her children, who attend a school in the area.  She has a business raising pigs; this business is how she keeps her household afloat.  She already has a lot of customers, because the pigs she sells are good quality and she sell them at an affordable price.  For Silvia, this business is very profitable, and so for this reason she is always very devoted to her work.  One of her goals is to grow her business so she can always stay ahead of the competition, so she decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy concentrate (animal feed) for her animals.  In this way she will be able to have the animals her customers need, and her customers will have trust in the quality of her work.  Silvia hopes that in this way she will be able to give her family a better quality of life and greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy concentrate (animal feed)

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marites works hard to support her family.

Marites has a carenderia (restaurant) in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her carenderia.

Marites hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her carenderia.

loans.name: Tiran

texts.ru:
Тиран родился в 1988 г. в городе Капане. Сейчас он живет в селе Доврус, которое находится в 25 км от города Капан. Тиран окончил сельскую среднюю школу и на данный момент живет один. 
Сельским хозяйством Тиран занимается уже три года: разводит крупный рогатый скот и свиней. Полученную сельскохозяйственную продукцию (говяжье мясо, свинину, молоко) скупают скупщики из деревни и продают на рынке города Капана. 
Сумма кредита в 300.000 драм необходима Тирану для покупки комбинированного корма для свиней  и для организации работ по уборке сена, т.е для приобретения топлива для трактора и веревки для перевязки сена, для аренды самого трактора и для осуществления выплаты трактористу за проделанную работу.
texts.en: Tiran was born in 1988 in the city of Kapan. He currently resides in the village of Dovrus, 25 kilometers away from Kapan. He has received a middle school education and lives alone. For the past three years, Tiran has run a small farm: he breeds pigs and large cattle. Middleman from the village buy the products of his business (beef, pork and milk) and sell them on the market in Kapan. He's asking for a loan of 300,000 drams to purchase formula feed for his pigs and to pay for a haymaking process, which includes: renting a tractor, obtaining fuel, paying a tractor operator's salary, and buying rope for binding hay.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his pigs and to organize a haymaking process

loans.name: Morris

texts.en:
Morris is 27 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is single and has one child, who is not currently in school. Morris has a health clinic, which he has run for two years.         
To help expand his business, Morris has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase medicines to sell to his patients. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Morris hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for himself.  In the future, he hopes to expand his business further. 
Morris is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped his prospects for the future by increasing his earnings.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for resale.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a 30-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and two siblings. He started his career working as a female hairdresser. And in 2010, after 10 years of experience, he opened his own female beauty salon. He provides his customers with top quality services and knows how to make women feel comfortable in his salon. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renovate his shop and make new decorations to attract more customers. In the future, Henry looks forward to further improving his business by adding new types of services.

loans.use: to renovate and redecorate his shop

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza de 54 años vive en el municipio de Malambo, área metropolitana de la ciudad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 19 a 29 años. En esta población tiene una miscelánea donde vende productos de papelería en general, vestidos prendas y muchos artículos que compran de contado y a crédito sus principales clientes, que son amas de casa y jóvenes ubicados en su barrio y en los aledaños de este. Su negocio lo aprendió desde hace 30 años,  desde cuando vivió en el municipio de Maicao, zona fronteriza caracterizada por la actividad comercial formal e informal. En un principio empezó vendiendo ropa y artículos de aseo que distribuía entre pocos clientes, pero desde que se mudó al municipio de Malambo, continuó con la actividad, con el fin de apoyar la gestión de su hogar que solo estaba a cargo de su esposo, de profesión electricista que en la mayor parte del tiempo debe viajar. Desde hace 4 años el negocio funciona en un espacio del lugar donde habita y  aunque inició sin infraestructura física, en la actualidad cuenta con dos vitrinas y una fotocopiadora donde ofrece servicios de fotocopiaje. Este es el primer financiamiento que hace para fortalecer su negocio, y con este se vinculará a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, pues vio en su credikiva una excelente oportunidad para iniciar su historial crediticio. Con su primer financiamiento por esta línea de Kiva, comprará cosméticos, fantasía, bisutería y papelería artículos que tienen muchos pedidos.
Su meta es multiplicar su negocio tener una infraestructura adecuada, para que  en un futuro se convierta en un almacén.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 54 and lives in the municipality of Malambo, a metropolitan area of the city.  She is married and has 4 children who range in age from 19 to 29.  She has a small general store where she sells office supplies, clothing, and many items that her customers buy from her with cash and on credit.  Her main customers are housewives and young people in her neighborhood and neighborhoods to the east.  She learned her business 30 years ago when she lived in the municipality of Maicao, a border area characterized by formal and informal commercial activity.  At first, she started selling clothing and toiletries that she distributed among a few customers.  When she moved to Malambo, she continued her business with the goal of helping with her family's finances.  Only her husband was contributing to their income.  He is an electrician and travels the majority of the time.  For 4 years, she has had her business in her home and although she started it without physical infrastructure, she currently has 2 display cases and a photocopier where she offers photocopying services.  This is her first loan, which she will use to strengthen her business.  With it, she will be connected to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She saw this as an excellent opportunity to start her credit history.  With her first loan, she will buy cosmetics, costume jewelry, and office supplies for which she has a lot of demand.

Her goal is to grow her business and to have adequate infrastructure so in the future she can turn it into a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, costume jewelry, and office supplies for which she has a lot of demand

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 47 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with two children.

Rosario works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 23 years. She has requested a loan for 12,000 PHP to purchase three boxes of fish to retail.

Rosario has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Rosario hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Clara Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora Clara es socia del banco comunal Siete  Estrellas del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene una hija.

Lleva tres años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la venta de comida, especialmente desayunos que lo realiza en horas de la mañana (de 6 a 11 am), el resto del día se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y la atención de su hija.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 saco de carbón, ½ saco de arroz, ½ saco de azúcar, 2 ollas medianas, 2 fuentes, 1 tazón, 1 mesa, 4 sillas, 2 jabas de gaseosas.
Esta vez implementará su negocio con mesas y sillas para dar más comodidad a su cliente porque cuenta solo con una mesa y no se abastece, cuenta con la ayuda de una señora a quien ha dado trabajo.

Manuela Ramos le ha brindado la oportunidad de tener un negocio propio, aunque es pequeño le sirve para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Clara is a member of the communal bank "Siete Estrellas" in the Calleria District, department of Ucayali.  She is 31 and the single mother of a daugther.

For three years she has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos and her business is selling food, especially breakfast food in the morning (6 to 11 a.m.).  The rest of the day she is a homemaker and takes care of her daughter.

With the new loan in the amount of 1,200 PEN she plans to buy: 1 bag of coal, 1/2 bag of rice, 1/2 bag of sugar, 2 medium pots, 2 trays, 1 jug, 1 table, 4 chairs and 2 cases of soda.

She will set up the tables and chairs to accommodate her customers.  She has only one table now and it is not enough.  She employs a lady who helps her with the business.

Manuela Ramos has given her the opportunity of running her own business, which, while small, allows her to support her family.

loans.use: To buy coal, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is a married woman with six children, three of whom attend school, while the others are grown up. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family’s basic needs. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

She has operated a vegetable grocery for the past ten years; in addition she practices farming. Her potential clients are her neighbors and passers by. She faces a major challenge of market price fluctuation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With a Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase vegetables for her business. She decided to join Yehu because it is responsible for its clients.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for her business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is aged 33 and married with six children aged between 14 and one year. He is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, western Kenya, where he lives with his family. He has been in farming for over six years, producing maize and beans for the local market. He also operates a taxi business within the area for additional income besides that of farming.

David has requested a fourth loan of 90,000 KES with Juhudi Kilimo to help him purchase poultry birds for 30,000 KES and use the remaining 60,000 KES to put up a greenhouse for growing tomatoes. He says Juhudi Kilimo loans have been of great help providing income that enables him to educate his children. He aspires to be a dairy breeder in future.

He however laments poor prices for farming output, considering high input costs.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds and build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Luyến

texts.en:
Luyến is a 35-year-old woman living in a town in Yen Phong district - Bac Ninh province.  She is married and has four school-aged children.  To make a living, Luyến owns & operates a business venture in the services sector providing waste management services.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from hauling second-hand goods for local businesses and community members.  Luyến has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Luyến joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Luyến has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,184,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase scrap metal to sell.  Luyến is now requesting a new loan of 9,632,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional scrap metal to sell.  This will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Luyến plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Luyến là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 4 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, Luyến Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ quản lý chất thải.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chuyên chở hàng cũ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Luyến thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Luyến kiếm được khoảng 8.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, Luyến đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Luyến đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua phế liệu bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.632.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua phế liệu bổ sung để bán.  Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Luyến dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional scrap metal to sell.

loans.name: Bonefance

texts.en:
Bonefance is a 45-year-old married man with four children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

He has been growing onions for sale since 1991. He started by producing two sacks of onions but now he produces 15 sacks. 

His challenge is high labor costs and his dream is to diversify his business by growing more vegetables and educating his children.

Bonefance needs the loan to hire land and plant tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: to hire land and plant tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells corn dough at Dompoase. She has six dependents and has been selling corn dough for five years. Efua uses her income to provide for her family. She will use her loan to purchase bulk maize for the dough. Ekua plans to expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: purchase bulk maize for dough.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. Elena es de ciudad del Este, tiene un hijo, el cual ella ha criado sola, con mucho trabajo y sacrificio, el cual aun se encuentra en edad escolar.
Ella se dedica a la peluquería, mediante el cual ha podido salir adelante y mantener a su hijo y también a su familia. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora, luchadora y emprendedora, a la cual le gusta trabajar sin depender de nadie. Gracias a su trabajo hoy día ella es una microempresaria exitosa con  mucha  clientela, debido a su buen trato y buen trabajo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, tijeras, gel, shampoo, cremas hidratantes y demás productos necesarios para abastecer su negocio. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues la ayuda le será muy provechosa.
texts.en:
Elena is from Ciudad del Este.  She has a school-aged son that she has been raising on her own, with a lot of work and sacrifice.  She has a hair salon, and this has been the means through which she has been able to get ahead and provide for her son and also for her family.  She is described as a very hardworking, tenacious and enterprising woman, who enjoys working and not having to depend on anyone.  Thanks to her work, she is now a successful small businesswoman who has a lot of customers, due to the good work that she does and the good treatment that she gives her customers.  

Elena requests this loan to buy hair dyes, hair weaves, hair gel, shampoo, hydrating creams and other products she needs to stock her business.  She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity that they are providing her, as this assistance will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: hair dyes, hair weaves, hair gel, shampoo, hydrating creams and other products

loans.name: Gregorio Mariano

texts.es:
Gregorio Mariano tiene 37 años es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas en el Reciento Campo Alegre.

Esta ventanilla SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Campo Alegre, cerca de la parroquia Guare perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Gregorio Mariano se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace 10 años, herencia de los padres,  las compras las realizan en comercial Jiménez de la ciudad de ventanas y las vende en la misma ciudad.

El préstamo lo solicita para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para el cuidado de los cultivos, además le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos de la familia. Sueño es tener una casa.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Gregorio Mariano is 37 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and their children. They live in the Ventanas canton in the Campo Alegre precinct.

The communal bank San Jacinto is located in the Campo Alegre precinct, near the Guare parish, which is part of the Ventanas canton. This communal bank works with short-cycle agricultural tasks such as planting corn and rice.

Gregoria Mariano works in agriculture. He has been planting corn and rice for 10 years on an inheritance from his parents. He buys his supplies at the Jiménez commercial center in the city of Ventanas, and he sells his products in the same city.

He is applying for the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and compost to care for his crops. In addition, this will help him increase his family income. His dream is to own a house.

He likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and compost to care for his crops and to help him increase the family income.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija is a 32-year-old married woman. She has three children, their ages ranging from 9 years to 16 years. She describes herself to be customer-friendly. She operates a restaurant where she sells food. She has been involved in this business for three years. Khadija also runs a boutique to increase her income. Her business is located at a busy market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the 20,000-Kenyan-shilling loan to buy ingredients for preparing more food. Her business goal is to run a bigger restaurant within five years.

loans.use: to buy ingredient for preparing more food

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge de 52 años de edad, reside con su familia en casa propia, humilde, elaborada por el mismo, es un hombre muy trabajador, responsable. Actualmente se dedica al cultivo del maíz, frijol, y al sorgo, vende sus cultivos y sus ventas son rentables debido a la calidad y los buenos precios al que los da, tomando en cuenta que es un hombre de buen carácter y manera de ser, ello le permite poseer buena clientela y siempre mantener excelentes relaciones con los demás. Jorge necesita incrementar la cantidad de sus cultivos y es por eso que se acerco a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y tener la posibilidad de comprar insumos agrícolas como: semillas, Abonos, fertilizantes y algunas herramientas como azadón, Cuma, machete para tener las mejores cosechas. esta seguro que con la ayuda recibida nunca hará falta el sustento en su hogar y espera poder solventar la deuda antes de lo acordado.

loans.use: Para comprar insumos agrícolas como: semillas, Abonos, fertilizantes y algunas herramientas como azadón, Cuma, machete

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
Feliciano es un hombre de 55 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con sus cuatro hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, lastimosamente por diversas razones desde hace varios años se separó de su esposa, desde entonces él dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver noticieros y programas educativos en televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia, Feliciano no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Agrónoma, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace varios años Feliciano trabaja como operario de riego en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Feliciano se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, él desea poder terminar el techado y tarrajeo de su casa, de esta manera él podrá tener su hogar en mejores condiciones, adecuadas y seguras que brinden mayo bienestar para él y su familia, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr sus metas y su gran sueño de terminar la construcción total de su hogar.
texts.en:
Feliciano is a 55 year old man who lives in the city of Ica in the district of Santiago with his four children, who he loves and considers to be his primary reason for living. Sadly, for a variety of reasons, he separated from his wife several years ago, and since that time, he has devoted all his energies toward helping his family to get ahead.  In his free time, he likes to watch the news and educational programming on television, and he sometimes cooks a delicious duck and rice dish to share with his family.  Feliciano was not able to study at the university level in the field of Agricultural Engineering, but he would have really liked to do so. 

With a great deal of dedication and hard work, Feliciano has worked as an irrigation systems operator on a farm in his city for the past several years. Every day he begins work very early in the morning, and he works around 10 hours a day, and he thinks it is going well because of his performance and  the goodwill that he shares with everyone.


Feliciano is very thankful for the lenders at Kiva, since it is thanks to their help that he will be able to make improvements to his house.  He wants to finish the roofing and unfinished parts of the house, and thereby to have a home in better condition, adequate and secure to improve the well-being of his family.  Therefore, he will continue working and making an effort to achieve his goals, and his greatest dream is to finish the final bits of construction on his house.

loans.use: to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a 53-year-old married woman, and she has five children ranging in age from 12 to 28 years. She describes herself to be confident. 

Loice operates a retail business where she sells maize, and she has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a conducive area and her primary customers are small scale customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low returns. 

Loice will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of maize. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize

loans.name: Dan

texts.en:
Dan is a Ugandan man, married, aged 27. He used his previous loan to buy local brew to sell. He also operates a retail shop to earn a living and supplement his income. 

He hopes to grow his business despite a lot of competition from people with similar businesses and price fluctuations. Since he is hard working, Dan is requesting a loan to buy soda for resale, targeting the Christmas season where demand is high.

loans.use: to buy soda for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase new syllabus books

loans.name: Efrain

texts.en:
Efraín has been running his business for a year and a half. "My business is a money-exchange shop near the border. People need to convert their money into U.S. dollars to go shopping in Texas, and that is how I provide a service to my community. I would like to invest more money into my business to increase my earnings, but I have not been able to. I'm asking for $1,200 to invest in my business."

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Efraín tiene su negocio desde hace 1 año y medio “Mi negocio es una casa de cambio y está en una zona fronteriza, la gente requiere de cambiar su dierno en moneda americana y poder hacer sus compras en en estado de Texas asi es que presto un servicio a la comunidad me gustaría poder invertir para aumentar mi capital pero no he podido” Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para invertir en el negocio.

loans.use: Invest in his money-exchange shop.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en: Seven years ago Angelica opened a small clothing kiosk in the market of Nikolaev, Ukraine. With the assistance of microfinance loans through Nadezhda, Ukraine, Angelica successfully expanded her business, opening two stores and transitioning from casual clothing to formal wear. A skilled businesswoman, Angelica is known throughout Nikolaev for her reasonable prices, reliable home delivery, and individualized customer service. Angelica has requested a loan of $500 to purchase additional inventory for the upcoming prom season in Ukraine. With the additional profits, she plans to continue developing her business and supporting her daughter’s university education.

loans.use: Angelica would like to purchase additional inventory for her women's formal wear store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more merchandise for his stall.

loans.name: Reina Marcelina

texts.es:
My name is Reina M. and for the past four years I have dedicated myself to the sale of staples such as beans, rice and corn. My customers are loyal because I sell quality products at prices which are affordable in our community. My children help me transporting my product to my small store. Presently I would like to buy more grains to meet the increased demand during the approaching Christmas season, when sales are very good. With my earnings I will continue to feed my family and remodel my store so I can provide my customers with better services.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

mi nombre es Reina M. me dedico a la venta de granos basicos como ser frijoles, arroz, maiz, tengo mi negocio hace 4 años, mis clientes me prefieren ya que la calidad de mi producto es muy buena y los precios son accesibles para nuestra comunidad, tengo la ayuda de mis hijos para transportar mi producto a mi bodega, en estos momentos necesito comprar mas granos basicos ya que se hacerca la epoca navideña y las ventas son muy buenas , con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y remodelar mi bodega para tener una mejor atencion a mis clientes.

loans.use: To buy beans, rice and corn

loans.name: Ismawati

texts.en: Ismawati is 24 years old and the mother of a child aged 3. She has been running her business selling snacks, household goods, and cigarettes in her small shop. She usually earns $10 per day whereas her husband, A., is a laborer at the market who earns a small income. Ismawati is requesting a loan to buy more goods to fill her shop and hopes that, with more inventory, she can contribute more toward her family's income. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shop

loans.name: Thi Tinh

texts.vi:
Miss Tĩnh, 18 years old, is an hair stylist and a cosmetic trader. Though she is still young, Miss Tĩnh has been doing this for few years. Her mother left her when she was three and she did not have opportunity to go to school. She lives with her father who tends a tea stand at home for living. She would like to take out a loan from Binh Minh because it would lift her confidence and help her learning to save. Her weekly income would easily cover the loan repayments.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Tĩnh 18 tuổi, chị làm nghề cắt tóc và bán mĩ phẩm. Chị rất trẻ nhưng đã làm nghề này được nhiều năm. Mẹ chị bỏ đi khi chị khoảng 3 tuổi vì vậy chị không có điều kiện đi học như những đứa trẻ khác. Một mình bố chị nuôi chị cho đến tận bây giờ. Chị vay vốn để mua thêm hàng mỹ phẩm để bán. Bố chị mở cửa hàng bán nước chè tại nhà. Thu nhập từ việc cắt tóc giúp chị trả dần hàng tuần dễ dàng. Chị thích tham gia vay vốn của binhminh cdc vì nó giúp chị tự tin hơn và học thêm được cách tiết kiệm.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic for sales

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
In my house I have a room that I use as a warehouse for my business. My business consists of the sale of sweets, toilet paper, groceries and other odds and ends. I would like to invest in the purchase of more merchandise so that I can have a greater variety of products and thus generate greater income. My parents, brothers and myself all depend on this business. I am asking for a loan of $1,200 to invest in the purchase of more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

“Tengo en mi casa un cuarto que utilizo como bodega para mi negocio que es L. venta a mayoreo D. dulces, papel sanitario, abarrotes y algunas cosas más, me gustaría invertir en L. compra D. más mercancía para tener variedad D. productos y así obtener más ganancias, ya que D. este negocio vivimos mis papas, mis hermanos y yo”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para invertir en L. compra D. mercancía para mi negocio

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of merchandise for my business

loans.name: Qadir

texts.en: Q. Qadir is a 47-year-old man who sells vegetables and fruits he raises in his garden. He is married and has three children. Selling the products he raises is not effective and beneficial for supporting his family. Qadir decided to start raising calves. He already built a small shed for the cattle and applied for $1200 to purchase four calves for $300 each.

loans.use: Going to purchase four calves and start an animal-breeding business

loans.name: Fatuma's Upendo 2 Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with one 12-year-old child. She owns a small shop which she started in 2000. She works from 6.30AM to 10PM and earns a monthly profit of approximately $45.

Fatuma has taken out one successful loan to expand her business. She is requesting a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in used cloth sales and groceries.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
Mrs. Rafaela O. lives in the neighborhood of "Memorial Sandino". She is 51 years old, and single. She sells cosmetics and clothes, a business in which she has 10 years of experience and that she started by selling clothes. With the loan she would like to build a 10 meter wall to enlarge her home. In the future she would like to establish a store in which she can offer different products and finish building her house so that she can have a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Rafaela O. habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, tiene 51 años de edad es soltera. Ella vende cosméticos y ropa y comenzó su negocio con la venta de ropa, ya son diez años de experiencia con el préstamo construirá 10 mts de pared para ampliar. En el futuro es instalar una tienda para ofrecer variedad de productos y terminar de construir su vivienda para una vida digna.

loans.use: To improve her house.

loans.name: Maria Agueda

texts.es:
Señora Maria lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood, is 36-years old, and is married. She has four children: 2 girls and 2 boys. The girls are 10 and 15, and the boys are 7 and 11.

Doña Maria works for a company in Zona Franca, and she has worked there for 2 years.

The money that you might offer her will go towards constructing a wall for her home that is 10 square meters. She has made improvements on her home little by little with her husband's help.

In the future, she hopes to finish constructing her house, to offer her children a decent home, and to provide them with an education so they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Maria habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, tiene 36 años de edad, es casada, y con cuatros hijos, dos niñas y dos varones, las niñas tienen 10 y 15 años de edad, y los varones 7 y 11 años.

Doña Maria trabaja en una empresa de Zona Franca desempeñándose como Operaria tiene dos años laborando.

Con el dinero que le otorguen es para construir una pared de su vivienda de 10 mts2, ella ha venido mejorando su vivienda poco a poco con esfuerzos propios y con la ayuda de su esposo.

En un futuro desea terminar de construir su casa y ofrecer a sus hijos una vivienda digna y darles educación para formarlos como profesionales.

loans.use: Construction of a 10 square meter wall for her home

loans.name: Ursula

texts.en:
Ursula is 44 years old and has been selling clothes for 20 years in a stall in Market Number 4. One of her acheivements has been the ability to construct a small house, with much effort and scarifice. The house is not yet very profitable because of the large amount of competition in the area.

The credit that she is soliciting from Fundacion Paraguaya is so she can bring various items directly from Bolivia for the winter season in order to cope with the demand for various well-priced clothing items.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.en:
Lisbeth is a member of the Florecer Village Bank. She has two children, ages 7 years old and 9 months old, that she raises with the help of her mother. Lisbeth and her husband have a restaurant located on a central street near the markets of the city of Ayacucho. In the next few months they will change their location because the current location has a very high rent. She and her husband built up this restaurant with very little capital through hard work. Her husband is the cook with the help of two employees, preparing lunch in the afternoons and soups and a la carte plates for dinner. Lisbeth is responsible for the cash register and at times customer service. Lisbeth and her husband have a project to start a chicken restaurant as well, because their new location is nicer and has more space.

Lisbeth needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in fish, a restaurant sign, and a new oven.

Lisbeth's dream is to have a larger restaurant, build a home, provide the best educational opportunities for her children and always keep her family together.

loans.use: To purchase fish, a restaurant sign, and a new oven

loans.name: Kristina Eka

texts.id: Pinjaman senilai Rp.1.000.000 sebelumnya telah dipergunakan oleh Kristina sebagai modal dalam mendukung usaha jual kacang hijau. Saat ini Kristina memasuki pinjaman periode kedua, dan dia berharap dia bisa mendapatkan bantuan modal lebih banyak dari sebelumnya. Dari pinjaman sebelumnya Kristina berhasil meningkatkan pendapatannya dari Rp.50.000 menjadi Rp.70.000 per hari. Hal ini sangat positif dan berpengaruh pada proses pengembalian pinjaman. Rencananya pinjaman kedua ini akan dipakai untuk membeli bahan pembuat es kacang hijau dan juga untuk membuka warung sendiri. Saat ini suaminyalah yang menjajakan kacang hijau buatannya dengan cara berkeliling dengan sepeda motor.
texts.en:
Earlier loan of Rp 1,000,000 (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-9,500.00) was used by Kristina as capital to support her green beans business. This time Kristina is entering her second period loan, and she hopes that she could receive higher capital help than earlier. From previous loan, Kristina was able to increase her income from Rp50,000 to Rp70,000/day. This was very positive, and has affected her timely loan payments. The plan for this second loan is to buy materials to make green beans ice drinks , and to open her own food stall. At this time her husband sells her gree beans by offering around the area by motor cycle.

Translated from Indonesian by Gwan Ang, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To add business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin was born in 1978. He is single, and he has been selling clothes for 10 years. He needs a loan of $1200 to buy clothes to increase his business.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
N. Mariam is proud to be the only Hajjat in the group of Nkokonjeru. Her business is buying and selling mukene (small silvery fish) from Nkombwe landing site in Ngogwe Sub County for eight years now. Before this business, Hajjat used to sell tomatoes and onions, but because they were perishables, she was always losing money.

With the small fish, it’s a matter of drying them properly; do so and they will last for a very long time. Mariam says the prices of the fish keep fluctuating depending on the season, and this influences her selling price. Mariam is a widow who cares for five orphans and three other orphans (her stepchildren), who are all in school; two are in candidate classes.

Since she started getting loans, Mariam has managed to care for her family and has bought some land for farming hence reducing the cost of buying everything including food. She has also bought some goats which she sells and has a dream of buying a cow (a good one costs about one million Uganda shillings). A cow would provide milk for sale, and Mariam hopes this will happen for her and her family soon. She plans to buy more small fish for her stock once she has access to a loan.
