loans.use: To buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Vu Thi Kieu

texts.en:
Mrs. L. is 30 years old and lives in the Nghe An Province, in Vietnam. She joined TYM in 2005. She has two children who go to school. Mrs. L. first successfully completed a loan with TYM to start her own family motor-bike repair shop, which is her family's main source of income. With a steady source of profit, Mrs. L.’s shop is able to provide her family with the stability it needs.

Mrs. L. would like to borrow $600 to buy tools and invest in her family’s motorbike repair shop.

loans.use: to buy tools and invest in her family motor-bike repair shop.

loans.name: Ignacia Teresa

texts.es:
La Señora Ignacia Teresa B. tiene la edad de 54 años, su estado civil es acompañada, Doña Ignacia tiene 1 hija de 12 años de edad y cursa recientemente el 1 año de secundaria, su esposo labora como contador en el hospital Oscar Danilo, en sus propósitos esta mantener activo de su negocio y a la misma tiempo sacar calidad de en productos para innovar en lo que seria su productos ya que en sus metas esta sacar al mercado productos nuevos y que a los clientes les guste los nueva línea de  productos.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de pan, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 15 años, sus inicios  se dan cuando ella tiene la profesión de enfermera  pero debido a la situación del país tuvo problemas en su trabajo y es por eso que decide establecer un negocio de una panadería con el apoyo de su familia que siempre le ha brindado la ayuda en lo que es su negocio ella inicia la producción con pan simple y pan dulce por lo que tenia mas variedad en el pan dulce y así consigue afluencia de clientes por lo delicioso que son sus productos, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesario realizar las compras de su materia prima como es harina, huevos y la compra de sartenes para la elaboración de sus productos y así tener una variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Ignacia Teresa B. is 54 years old, and is a co-habitee. Ignacia has one daughter aged 12 and who recently began her first year of secondary school. Her partner works as an accountant in Oscar Danilo hospital. Her aim is to maintain her business' activity and at the same time to keep producing quality goods and keep innovating, as one of her goal is to to introduce new products to market, as her customers like the new product lines. This business is the sale of bread: she has had this business for 15 years, first establishing it when she was a nurse, because thanks to the situation in the country she had problems in her work and as a result decided to establish a bakery with the help of her family, who have always given her all the support she's needed with her business. She began baking simple bread and sweet bread and cakes too as there were more types of sweet breads. As a result of her goods being so delicious, customers flocked to her. The loan is for work capital, as she needs to purchase raw ingredients such as flour and eggs, as well as pans, in order to make her breads and thus have a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work Capital

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata C. a 38 ans et réside avec son époux et ses quatre (4) enfants (1 garçon et 3 filles) à Sanoubougou I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Fatoumata C.  après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, elle s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et de vente  d’habillements (bazins et foulards légers teintés) il y a maintenant plus de dix (10) ans. Elle met les bazins et les foulards légers dans la teinture. Elle  a appris cette  activité auprès d’une amie. Elle dispose une place à la gare routière de Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée. Vue le positionnement de sa place, son activité marche en merveille avec une clientele composée essentiellement des routiers et d’employers travaillant à ce niveau. 
Dans ses recherches de ressources finanacières complémentaires, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant trois (3) ans. Après 3 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier (Association BADEYA de Sanoubougou I), elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel commerçant (PIC) tous correctement remboursés.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 18 pièces de bazins, 50 paquets de foulards légers, 5 sachets de soude caustique et 5 boîtes de couleurs differentes. Elle achète les bazins,la soude caustique et les couleurs sur place et les foulards à Niono sur commande.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce et contribuer aux dépenses familiales..
texts.en:
Ms. Fatoumata C. is 38 years old and resides with her husband and her four children (one boy and three girls) in Sanoubougou I, one of the working-class districts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having done many kinds of work without success, she became initiated in this work selling clothing (damask cloth and dyed light-weight scarfs) ten years ago now. She puts the damask and scarves into dyes, which she learned to do from a friend. She has a spot at the Sikasso bus station, where she is in high demand. Because of this location, her business is doing superbly, with her customers composed essentially of drivers and employees working there. In her search for supplemental financial resources, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. After three solidarity loans (group loans), all correctly repaid, with a women's association in her district (Association BADEYA de Sanoubougou I), she is on her second PIC (an individual commercial loan). She intends to use this loan to buy 18 lengths of damask, 50 packets of scarves, 5 bags of caustic soda, and 5 containers dyes of different colors. She buys the damask, caustic soda, and dyes locally, and the scarves -- in Niono by special order. With this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase her working capital and to help cover family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Nang

texts.en:
Mrs. Nang P. lives in Pong Ror village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Suon Hong, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate both rice and cassavas. In their cassava farming, they face a problem because they do not have enough money to hire laborers to help them work the field. Thus, Mrs. Nang P. decided to ask for a loan for that purpose.

Mrs. Nang P. is 51 years old and the mother of two children, both farmers who help their parents in their work. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To hire laborers to help work her field.

loans.name: Nicolasa De La Concepcion

texts.es: Nicolasa de la Concepción S. B. tiene 48 años, su estado civil es casado, y tiene un hijo. Su hijo trabaja y estudia, y tiene 25 años de edad. Las actividades económicas de Doña Nicolasa destace de cerdo y la venta de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar y aceite y solo por medio de los prestamos ha logrado salir adelante. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio. Los propósitos para su negocio son de mejorar su negocio y así proporcionarle mas progreso. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo propuesto para la compra de cerdos y la compra de granos básicos como maíz, frijol y arroz. Sus deseos son de comprar una camioneta y vender en grandes cantidades. La cantidad solicitada para realizar la compra de materia prima es de C$ 8.500 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Nicolasa de la Concepción S. B. is 48 years-old, married, and has one child (who is 25 years-old, and who works and studies). Nicolasa raises pigs and sells rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oils. Loans such as this one have given her the ability to prosper and to grow her business, a task to which she has dedicated herself for over 30 years. Her goal with this business is to continue that growth and prosperity!! She will use the loan to purchase pigs and grains such as corn, beans, and rice. She also hopes to one day purchase a pickup truck so she can sell her products in greater quantities. The requested loan amount to purchase these prime materials is C$ 8,500 cordobas, which she will re-pay in 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pigs and basic grains (corn, beans, rice)

loans.name: Yawa Brigitte

texts.fr: Madame M. yawa brigite est une dame mariée  et mère de trois (03) enfants, elle habite avec sa famille le quartier  de togo2000 à Lomé, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la couture dans son atelier de couture qu’elle appelle « COUTURE BB », elle a besoin d’agrandir son activité pour pouvoir répondre à la demande de sa clientèle et livrer à temps les commandes. N’ayant jamais obtenu de crédit de wages, elle sollicite son premier prêt pour acheter trois (03) machines à coudre,  des tissus, des fils, des doublures et des pagnes.
texts.en:
Ms. M. Yawa Brigite is a married lady and the mother of three children. She lives with her family in the Togo200 district in Lomé. To earn an income, she works as a seamstress in her workshop she calls “COUTURE BB”. She needs to expand her business to respond to customer demand and to deliver orders on time. Having never obtained a loan from WAGES before, she’s requesting her first loan to buy three sewing machines, some fabrics, thread, lining material, and pagnes (colorful West African cloth).

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing machines, fabrics, thread, etc.

loans.name: Kheiv

texts.en: Kheiv V. S., 56, is a widowed mother who has five children; three are single and the other two are married and live separately. To help meet the family's expenses, two of her single children are employed as English teachers in Phnom Penh. V. S. currently earns a living by raising animals for sale in her home. She raises chickens, ducks, and pigs. She sells the mature animals to buyers every three months a year. V. S. hopes her one single son attains a suitable job; so, she is applying for an $1100 loan to buy a motorbike for him to begin running a taxi. The family lives in Banteay Meanchey Province, in Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Umia

texts.ru: Умия продает детскую одежду в центральном универмаге города Исфара. Занимается этим давно,  с тех пор как перестала работать в госучреждении. Теперь торговля для нее постоянное занятие и этим содержит свою семью. Ей 40 лет, имеет 3 детей. С МикроИнвест сотрудничает уже 3 года и показала себя активным и ответственным клиентом. Сейчас подала новую заявку и собирается немного освежить ассортимент товаров.
texts.en:
Umia sells children's clothing in Isfara's central department store. She has been in this business for a long time, since she left work at a state institution. Now sales is her full-time employment and means of supporting her family. She is 40 years old and has three children. She has worked with Microinvest for three years, proving to be an active and responsible client, and has submitted a new application. She plans to bring some new goods into her inventory.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory expansion

loans.name: Frans Tamayo Group

texts.es: El Grupo " Frans Tamayo esta representado por la señora Martha  y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades comerciales en su mayoría a la venta D. comida, refrescos y a la venta D. prendas D. vestir, entre los varones se dedican al servicio D. moto taxis. A pesar D. ser un grupo relativamente nuevo conocen como trabajar con grupos solidarios y cuentan con la experiencia crediticia en otras instituciones similares a al Fundación Agrocapital. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. insumos y materiales para poder tener un producto D. calida para ofrecer a sus clientes así como para la compra D. repuestos para los socios que trabajan como matotaxistas ya que necesitan tener un vehículo en buen estado para realizar su trabajo y poder llevar a casa los ingresos generados durante el día. La competencia en el rubro comercial es alto pero cada uno D. los socios tiene una familia que mantener ya que D. ellos depenD. su bien estar, es por esta razón que saben como cumplir con responsabilidad y honestidad a sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The Frans Tamayo group is represented by Sra. Martha and includes 12 members who operate various busineses, most of which entail sales of food, cold drinks and clothing items or, among the men, moto-taxi services. Despite being a relatively new group, they know how community banks work and they have experience with institutions like Fundacion Agrocapital. The loan will be used to buy supplies and materials necessary for the members' various businesses. For example, spare parts for the members that operate moto-taxi services since they have to keep their vehicles in good order to operate their business and generate an income for their families from day to day. The competition in their lines of work is high but each one of the members has a family to support and that's why they understand how important it is to be responsible and honest in dealing with their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital.

loans.name: Aquilino

texts.es: Aquilino es natural del departamento de Ancash, vive en Lima desde hace 9 años, con su pareja y su pequeño hijo Ángel de 6 meses, en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de comestibles y de calzado, actividad que viene realizando desde que migro de su natal Ancash. Aquilino es un hombre muy trabajador y siempre le pone mucho empeño a las cosas que hace, es por eso que va progresando poco a poco, y ahora con su pequeño bebé, tiene más motivos para luchar en busca de un mejor porvenir. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que  puede disponer de tiempo para estar con su pequeño y su esposa, ya que no necesita ausentarse durante todo el día para conseguir el sustento diario. Además ha hecho muchos amigos en sus vecinos con los cuales conversa mucho y son muy fieles a su pequeño puesto. Aquilino quiere hacer crecer su negocio comprando más cantidad de productos y en un futuro tener una gran tienda de abarrotes. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y espera ser de mucha ayuda para su banco comunal. Lo que él comprará con este dinero son productos no perecibles, como costales de arroz, azúcar fideos, etc. para venderlos y obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Aquilina is a native of the Ancash department. He has lived in Lima for nine years. He lives with his wife and their six month old son, Angel. They live in their own house. He sells food and footwear. He has been doing this since he migrated from his native Ancash. Aquilino is a very hard working man. He always takes great care in the things he does. That is why he is progressing little by little. Now, with his small baby, he has more motivation to fight in looking for a better future. He likes his work a lot because he can arrange the time to be with his little one and his wife. He does not have to be gone all day to get the daily sustenance. Also, he has made many friends among his neighbors. They talk a lot, and they are very loyal to his little stand. Aquilino wants to expand his business by buying more products. In the future he wants to have a large grocery store. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and he hopes to be of much help to his community bank. With the loan he will buy non perishable items such as sacks of rice, sugar, noodles, etc. in order to sell them and get a greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Anastacia Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Anastacia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Semillas del Futuro”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y madre de 03 hijos, posee estudios de educación superior completa (profesora de educación primaria), y vive en el Barrio Manto.

Hoy en día se inicia con el movimiento Manuela Ramos con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, para su negocio de compra y venta de abarrotes del cuál compara diversos productos como: fideos, harina, aceite, leche arroz y azúcar para surtir su tienda.

Su mayor sueño es poder ejercer su profesión.

A ella le gustan las facilidades de pago y la forma de trabajo de su banco comunal.
texts.en:
Anastacia belongs to the Semillas del Futuro Community Bank, which is located in the Puno district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 42, married, and has three children. She has a college education (elementary school teacher), and she lives in the Manto neighborhood. She is now starting with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos. Her initial loan of 500 PEN is for her business of buying and selling groceries. She will buy various products such as noodles, flour, oil, milk, rice, and sugar to stock her store. Her biggest dream is to be able to work in her profession. She likes the ease of payment and the way her community bank works.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries (flour, oil, milk, rice, and sugar) to stock her store

loans.name: Alejo Marcelino

texts.es:
Alejo  vive en la avenida “A3” de la zona  Villa Adela en la ciudad de El Alto

Vive junto a su esposa y dos de sus hijos los cuales se encuentran realizando estudios universitarios. Su esposa, posee un negocio de venta de carne vacuna, en un mercado de la zona.
 
Alejo trabaja en su vehiculo como chofer, en rutas céntricas de la ciudad de la Paz.

El crédito lo destinara para la refacción de su vivienda, la cual se encuentra demasiado deteriorada. Para esto necesita comprar materiales como cemento, arena, estuco y pinturas.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Alejo lives on Avenue “A3” in the Villa Adela zone in the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and two of his children who attend the university. His wife has a business selling beef in a market in the zone. Alejo works as a driver in his vehicle. He drives on routes that are central to the city of La Paz. The loan is to refurbish his house. The house is much deteriorated. To refurbish it he needs to buy materials like cement, sand, stucco, and paint. This is his first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbish his house

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es: Wilson N. O. tiene 41 años, es una persona humilde. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Por lo que su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento para invertirlo en capital de trabajo y así comprar  productos de consumo diario para su pulpería como arroz, aceite, frijoles, azúcar y golosinas en general. Su mayor sueño es proporcionarle a sus hijos una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
41-year old Wilson N. O. is a simple person and is responsible for raising his two children. He earns his living by running a small grocery store, a job he has been doing for more than four years. He plans to use the loan to increase the stock in his store—to buy items that are in daily use such as rice, oil, beans, sugar, and candy. His greatest dream is to provide his children with a nice home.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more products for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing sweet potatoes

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia M. is from the city of Pagadian. She is 57 years old. Ofelia is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Ofelia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Ofelia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ofelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ofelia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Ofelia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Khardiatou Alpha

texts.fr: Khardiatou Alpha D. est une femme mariée de 57 ans, elle a un enfant en charge. Elle a ouvert une petit cantine en hutte où elle vend divers produits alimentaires: pâte d'arachide, sucre, sel, oignon etc. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer aux différentes charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Khardiatou Alpha D. is a 57 year-old married woman who has one child in her care. She has opened a small cantine in a hut where she sells several food products, such as: peanut butter, sugar, salt. onions etc. Her earnings allow her to contribute towards various family expenses.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supplement her small business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase timbers in bulk

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, el señor Juan Ramón A. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de especies en su propia localidad donde ofrece las especies a sus clientes que le visitan.

Actualmente el negocio del señor Juan Ramón tiene la necesidad de obtener un crédito para comprar las especies y algunas bolsas plásticas ya que lo requiere a lo inmediato para mejorar su condición económica. Espera en que su crédito le sea otorgado y así brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes que deben ser
texts.en:
At the wholesale market in the city of Managua, Sr. Juan Ramón A. attends to his variety store where he offers all types of products to customers that visit him.

He is currently requesting a business loan to purchase more products and some plastic bags because he needs them immediately and they will help improve his financial situation. He hopes that his loan will be granted so that he can provide better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional products & plastic bags

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda G. lives in the village of Tabao 13, San Enrique, Negros Occidental. Her one big dream is to improve her family's standard of living, to have enough capital to expand her business, and to prepare her four children for a better future. Her dream started to become a reality when she became a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon.

Emelinda is 52 years old and is married to Artimio G., who helps her manage their business. They have four children, aged 22 to 29 years old. Two of their children already have their own families and the other two still live at home -- one works as a seaman and other is a student.

Emelinda and Artimio started out selling pork to retail customers. They bought pigs and had them butchered, and then her husband delivered the pork meat to various meat shops on consignment. This earns them a good living, but they are always on the lookout for other business opportunities, so in 2000 she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon and opened a new business selling spare parts and electronic gadgets. 

They continued with their pork retail business, earning a combined monthly income of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). They use their income to support their household expenses and pay for school tuition, and they have some left over for savings. Emelinda had a previous loan of 29,500 PHP, which she used for both her spare parts and her pork retail business. She repaid this loan in full within its loan term and without any delays. She is now borrowing for her 23rd cycle the same amount of 29,500 PHP. She will use this loan as additional working capital and to purchase additional spare parts inventory. 

In the accompanying picture, Emelinda is shown in her spare parts and electronics business with her husband in the background.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital.

loans.name: Alex Enrique

texts.es:
Alex tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío El Virrey, distrito de Olmos, ubicado a dos horas y 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace seis meses el se gana la vida criando y vendiendo animales menores (chivos, chanchos, ovejas) los cuales vende a los diversos negociantes que frecuentan la zona. Por otro lado brinda servicio de carga en una carreta artesanal que es jalada por un burro. Con estas actividades el apoya a la economía de su hogar.

Alex desea ampliar su negocio de venta de animales comprando más ejemplares para criarlos y engondarlos para luego venderlos. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles.

Su sueño es comprarse una mototaxi para brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en la zona. El es un joven trabajador y muy responsable.
texts.en:
Alex is 20 years old, single, and living with his parents in the hamlet of El Virrey, in the district of Olmos, located 2 hours and 45 minutes outside the city of Chiclayo.

For six months he has been earning a living raising and selling small livestock (goats, pigs, sheep) to various dealers in the area. He also transports cargo for people using a cart pulled by a donkey. With these businesses he is able to pay household expenses.

Alex wants to increase his animal selling business by buying more animals to raise and fatten to sell later. For this reason he decided to ask for 600 nuevos soles for his first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.

His dream is to buy a motorcycle taxi in order to offer services transporting cargo and passengers in the area. He is a young and very responsible worker.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying small livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: Juana tiene 58 años D. edad, es casada vive con su esposo, sus hijos que ya no se encuentran viviendo con ellos. Juana tiene mas D. 6 años dedicandose a la venta D. pescados en un mercado D. la ciudad D. Ica, los cuales ofrece en un puesto propio. Lo adquirió con los ahorros producto D. la ventas y esfuerzo diario. En los años que lleva trabajando, Juana ya es muy conocida por muchísimas personas que acuden a su puesto D. venta por el buen trato que les brinda. Juana tiene el anhelo D. construir su casa por eso es que el poco dinero que le queda lo invierte en la compra D. materiales D. construcción. Por este motivo es que Juana solicita el crédito para invertir un su negocio y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Juana is 58 years old and married. Her children no longer live at home. She has been selling fish from her own vending post at the Ica city market for the past 6 years. With her savings, she acquires inventory to sell every day. In all the years she has been working, Juana has become widely recognized for the excellent service she provides to the multitudes of people who visit her market stall.

She hopes to build a house, but she has little money available to purchase construction materials. For this reason, Juana is requesting a loan to invest in her business so that she can generate more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Additional capital to invest in her business

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Vann P. is 50 years old and lives with his wife (pictured) in Battambang province.  He is a construction foreman and is able to make about $2 of profit a day, while his wife works in a grocery store earning approximately $5 per day. They have one school-aged child.  Vann is asking for a loan of $750 to purchase a motorbike and to reinvest in his wife’s grocery store.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Alpaquitas Del Sur Group

texts.es:
“Alpaquitas del sur” un grupo particular conformado por 9 mujeres y 1 varón que pertenece al Centro Focal Exaltación, así, Ruth V. es la Presidenta, como Tesorera está Yuly G. y como Secretaria de Actas  Maria S., las tres organizan a su base y llevan adelante su reunión con el objetivo de elaborar su reglamento interno.
Todas tienen diferentes negocios de producción, servicio y comercialización y necesitan el crédito para invertir en sus negocios y generar ingresos para darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
“Alpaquitas del sur” (Little alpacas from the south) is a group consisting of 9 women and 1 man, belonging to the Centro Focal Exaltación. Ruth V. is the President, Treasurer is Yuly G., Maria S. is Secretary. The three organize their group and carry out the meetings with the objective of creating their internal organization. They all have different businesses related to manufacturing, service, and retail; they need a loan to invest in their businesses and generate income to provide a better quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for their respective businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more chickens

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer E. is married and has four children. She received a junior-high education. Jennifer operates a grocery store where she sells sugar, Milo (chocolate milk powder), milk powder, rice and other items in Elmina. She has been running this business for some time. Her husband is a mason. Jennifer uses her income to help her husband pay for school fees and utility bills. 

Jennifer will use the loan to buy second hand-clothes in addition to the groceries she already sells. With the new profits from her expanded business, Jennifer plans to save so she can reinvest in her business and improve her capital base.

loans.use: Jennifer will use the loan to buy second-hand clothes

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
In this story, our featured entrepreneur is an operator of fish traps locally known as “bunsod”. She is Mrs. Mercy A., 41 years of age, married and a resident of Maquilao, Tangub City. The couple was blessed with 6 children and most are now adults or teenagers. Only one is a minor dependent. Her husband is a fisherman and he maintains the “bunsod”. For 25 years, they’re been in this kind of business and have been able to sustained the family even in times of bad weathers and economic downfalls.  At the present time they were earning an average net income of not less than P15,000.00.  With excellent character and a good credit record, she was approved for the loan amount of P20,000.00. 

This is her 7th cycle loan and will provide capital to purchase fishing nets for additional bunsod unit and for general repair and maintenance. The future profit of this loan will be used for their daily basic needs, loan repayments and savings for her children’s future, especially for their education. She hopes that someday all her children will become successful. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing nets and "bunsod" repair

loans.name: Ing

texts.en: The woman in the photo is Mrs. Ing S., age 55, who lives in the Province of Siem Reap in Cambodia, where she earns a living raising pigs in a stall behind her house. Since 1985, she has run this business and it has provided her with income to attain her standard of living. She is married with six children: two are married living separately and four are single. Her husband helps feed the family by working in construction. In order to earn extra income, Ing S. will be using the loan to buy more pig feed and piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy more pig feed and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe G. is 34 years old, married, and lives in Upper Sto Nino, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is blessed with two children. Fe operates a variety store and her husband manages a piggery. Fe has managed her business for more than two years. The two businesses together earn approximately $150 a month.

Fe joined PMPC to gain financial support. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC which was used for the expansion of the piggery. Now she is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP for the expansion of her store and also to have additional capital. This will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. She hopes to maintain a good repayment record.

loans.use: additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mame Bousso

texts.fr:
Madame Mame Bousso D. âgée de 39 ans est mariée mère de 3 enfants. Elle couturière et teinturière de formation.  Cependant depuis 2007, elle s’est versée dans le commerce de bois de chauffage. C’est son mari qui lui a poussé à vendre le bois. En effet, son mari un chauffeur de camion qui sillonne presque toute la sous région lui achète à bon prix du bois de la Casamance tout en respectant les règles établies par les Eaux et Forêts. 
Ainsi, elle sollicite un prêt de 200 000 FCFA pour se réapprovisionner en bois de Casamance afin de développer son commerce et de satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Ms. Mame Bousso D., 39, is the married mother of three children. She is a seamstress and a dyer by trade. However in 2007, she got into the business selling firewood. It was her husband who strongly encouraged her to sell firewood. In fact, her husband is a truck driver who covers almost all of the southern region and buys Casamance wood for a good price (respecting the restrictions established by the administration of Waters and Forests). Thus, she is seeking a loan of 200,000 francs CFA in order to buy more Casamance wood to grow her business and satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of firewood to sell

loans.name: Benkelema Group

texts.fr:
Benkelema est constitué de six femmes toutes mariées,  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans,  4 enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames  à Loulouni une sous préfecture de la région de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’accroitre leur chiffre d’affaire et leur clientèle. 
Ce groupe de femme mène  diverses  activités telles la vente de céréales de tissus, de charbon de bois et la vente d’atieké (aliment à base de manioc)  avec Awa Traoré, qui est très sollicitée et appréciée.
Awa Traoré comptent acheter avec son  prêt 30  chargements de charrettes en manioc qui sera transformé en atiéké. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Loulouni et dans les villages  voisins. 
L’atieké est vendu en détail   et en gros au marché de Loulouni à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Awa envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18 000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée en épargne pour  survenir au payement de la scolarité des enfants  ainsi que les frais de nourriture de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
Benkelema is composed of six women, all of whom are married with four children, are an average age of 40, and generally live in polygamous families in Loulouni, a sub-prefecture of the Sikasso region - the third largest administrative region in Mali. They are on their seventh collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organisation, with the aim of boosting their business revenues and increasing their customer base. The group members, such as the highly sought-after Awa Traoré, sell cereals and fabric, firewood and atieké (a manioc-based food). Awa Traoré aims to use her loan to buy 30 cartloads of manioc, which will be processed to atieké; she sources her goods from the Loulouni market and from the neighbouring villages. The atieké is sold retail and wholesale for cash at the Loulouni market, to a male and female customer base. Awa envisages generating an average monthly profit of 18, 000 FCFA - a portion of this will be saved to pay for her children's education and the family's food, and the rest will be re-invested in business activities.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of manioc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Ana Mayela

texts.es:
Ana Mayela tiene 49 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Jucuapa del departamento de Usulután, es soltera  vive con madre y un hermano. Ella tiene un negocio de venta de productos plásticos y ropa.
Este negocio fue iniciado por  su abuela cuando murió  Ana se hiso cargo y actualmente el negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal de de Jucuapa, ella acostumbra a comercializar sus productos desde muy temprano de 7: 00 am – 5:00 pm, sus clientes son amigos y visitantes de la zona, Ana es una persona emprendedora que ha logrado sacar adelante el negocio con su esfuerzo y actualmente ella necesita dinero para invertirlo en la compra de productos plásticos como son Cantaros, barriles, masetas, vasijas, vasos, platos y otros utensilios de plástico para ofrecer diversidad de productos a sus clientes, ya que le son buscados y no cuenta con ellos, también invertir en compra de ropa.
Sus aspiraciones son mejorar su negocio y surtirlo con diferentes artículos que demandan sus clientes y que  por la falta de dinero no ha podido lograr, está optimista que con la inversion en el negocio contribuirá a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y cubrir las necesidades básicas de alimentación, salud y vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana Mayela, 49, lives in Jucuapa, Usulután deparment; she’s single and lives with her mother and a brother. She sells clothing and plastic articles. The business was started by her grandmother but when she died Ana took over; it’s currently located in Jucuapa’s municipal market. Her usual business hours are from 7am to 5pm and her customers are friends and visitors to the area. Ana is a good entrepreneur that has managed to succeed in her business through her efforts. She is asking for funds to buy assorted plastic containers like: jugs, barrels, pots, eating utensils, drinking glasses, dishes and other plastic utensils in order to have a wide variety of items available for her customers because they ask for them and she doensn’t stock them; she also wants to invest in clothing. Her aspirations are to improve her business and stock it with the various articles her customers are asking for that lack of funds has prevented her from doing to date. She is optimistic that the investment in her business will improve her family’s quality of life and cover such expeses as food, health and housing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted plastic items.

loans.name: Luz Margarita

texts.es:
La Sra. Luz B. es socia del banco comunal 14 de Agosto, se encuentran en su tercer ciclo en la banca comunal, fue invitada por una amiga del sector, vive en la comunidad de Guayan, que pertenece a la parroquia de Zhidmad, ubicada al sur occidente del cantón Gualaceo, la agricultura y la ganadería son las actividades a las que se dedican los pobladores de esta parroquia, su iglesia parroquial es el principal atractivo turístico, en ella se guardan reliquias muy antiguas. El mirador del Cerro Borma, donde se encuentra una pirámide de los militares, es otro hermoso lugar para disfrutar de la naturaleza.

Nuestra socia tiene 32 años de edad, vive en unión libre y de esta unión ha concebido 5 hijos quines se encuentran de 15, 10, 8, 6 y 4 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda en la economía de la casa, sus tres hijos siguientes están en la escuela y su último hijo pasa en la guardería, su esposo trabaja como empelado del municipio, hace poco termino de construir su casa propia.

La Sra. Luz se dedica a la cría de animales como vacas, chanchos, gallinas los mismo que vende en su comunidad, esta actividad le da la oportunidad de estar con sus hijos en casa, también se dedica a la agricultura. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para sus cultivos, su meta es de llegar a tener una mejor fuente de ingresos para que todos sus hijos estudien y se superen en la vida, también desea hacerle un poco mas grande a su casa para que todos sus hijos cuenten con un cuarto independiente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz B. is a member of the communal bank “14 de Agosto”. She is in her third loan cycle in the communal bank and was invited by one of her friends from the sector. She lives in the Guayan community, in the Zhidmad parish, southwest of the Gualaceo Canton. The residents of this parish work in agriculture and livestock. Their parish church is the main tourist attraction; in it are kept very ancient relics. The Cerro Borma viewpoint, where there is a military pyramid, is another beautiful place to enjoy nature. Mrs. Luz B. is 32 years old, married and has 5 children who are 15, 10, 8, 6, and 4. Their oldest child works and helps with the household expenses. The following three children are in school and the youngest child is in daycare. Her husband works for the town and recently finished building their own house. Mrs. Luz raises animals such as cows, pigs, chickens, the same that are sold in her community. This activity gives her the opportunity to be home with her children. She also works in agriculture. With the money from the loan, she is going to invest in fertilizer for her crops. Her goal is to have a better source of income so that all of her children can study and excel in their lives. Also, she wants to expand their house a little bit so that all of her children can have their own room.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Dil Kumari

texts.en:
Mrs. Dil Kumari D. is a farmer in the village of Chappagaun. She owns a piece of land where she grows green vegetables. Mostly she grows seasonal vegetables on her land and sells vegetables in the local market in the morning and evening daily. Now she is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs 10000.00 to buy seeds and fertilizers for her vegetable farming.

Mrs. Dil Kumari lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband is a taxi driver. Her older son is studying in university and her younger son is studying in grade 12.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Rocio Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señora. Roció L. es socia del banco comunal Estrellitas, vive en  la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es considerada como la tercera ciudad más importante del Ecuador, es reconocida por sus paisajes, su cultura, sus iglesias de su centro histórico, su gente y quienes la visitan se enamoran de esta ciudad.

Nuestra socia tiene 23 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos quienes se encuentran de 6 y 3 años de edad, su primera hija se encuentra en la escuela, su esposo es comerciante entrega desayunos, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora. Roció es oriunda de Santo Domingo, pero vive en  la ciudad de Cuenca hace 7 años. Ella se dedica a preparar leche de soya, coladas, tortillas de verde, realiza esta actividad todos los días y su esposo se dedica a la venta de estos productos.

Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo,  su crédito lo va a invertir para la compra de un quintal de soya, azúcar, café y más víveres que utiliza.

Su sueño es poder  estudiar  corte y confección.
texts.en:
Sra. Roció L. is a member of the communal bank “Estrellitas”. She lives in the city of Cuenca which is considered the third most important city in Ecuador and known for its views, culture, the churches in the historical center, and the people. Those that visit are known to fall in love with the city. Our member is 23 years old, married with two children who are six and three years old. The oldest is in school. Her husband is a merchant delivering breakfast. They do not have their own home but they are leasing one. Sra. Roció is a native of Santo Domingo, but has lived in the city of Cuenca for seven years. She makes soy milk, “coladas” (thickened juice drink), and “empanadas verdes” (empanadas made of plantains) everyday so her husband can sell these products. This is her third loan cycle which she will use to purchase a bushel of soy beans, sugar, coffee, and more food needed. Her dream is to study dressmaking.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Sabahi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bushel of soy beans, coffee, sugar, fruit and milk
